name: Endy
aboutContent: Our StoryEvery Canadian Deserves A Better Night's Sleep.It Started With a Simple Belief:In 2015, we launched Canada’s first mattress-in-a-box—redefining comfort, quality, and convenience to make great sleep accessible to all. What began as a bold idea has grown into Canada’s leading online mattress brand, trusted by over a million sleepers from the Rocky Mountains to Rocky Harbour.At Endy, we don’t just help you fall asleep—we help you Rise to Shine.Every Endy mattress is proudly crafted in Canada using thoughtful and responsible manufacturing practices. From the first layer of foam to the final stitch, each mattress reflects the care, precision, and craftsmanship Canadians are known for.Made with CertiPUR-US® certified foam—free from harmful chemicals and emissions—our mattresses meet the highest standards of safety, durability, and comfort. It’s our way of ensuring you sleep soundly on a product that’s as responsibly made as it is comfortable, night after night.2015Endy is Founded in TorontoIn January, driven by a shared vision to help every Canadian sleep better, entrepreneurs Mike Gettis and Rajen Ruparell launched Endy, making high-quality sleep more accessible from coast to coast. Not long after, the very first Endy Mattress was delivered in March, marking the beginning of redefining and revolutionizing the way Canadians sleep.2016Benchmark for InnovationEndy was named one of Techweek’s Top 100 Innovators, an early sign that we weren’t just delivering better sleep, but challenging industry norms and setting a new standard for what Canadians could expect from their sleep.2017First Launch to First MillionMay marked our first product expansion with the launch of the Endy Pillow, designed to pair perfectly with our bestselling mattress. With the momentum continuing to build, November marked an extraordinary milestone: securing a $1 million investment on Dragon's Den, the show's biggest deal to date.2018Levelling UpIn September, Endy was named Canada’s fastest-growing retail startup and earned a spot on the Startup 50 list. Just a few months later, in December, we reached another major milestone by joining the Sleep Country Canada family in one of the country’s largest e-commerce acquisitions.2020Comfort for Frontline WorkersIn a year defined by uncertainty, we turned our focus to care. With our Healthcare Heroes Giving Campaign, Endy delivered new mattresses to frontline workers at more than 80 hospitals nationwide.2022Say Hello to HybridIn August, we introduced our second mattress, the Endy Hybrid, combining our signature Endy foam with durable pocket springs to deliver even more personalized support and comfort.2023From Online to In-StoreIn November, we opened our first retail store in the GTA, giving customers a chance to see, feel, and experience our products in person.2024Big WinsFrom our Adjustable Bed winning Product of the Year in February, to the launch of our most expansive product line, the Endy Bedroom Collection, in October, customers gained more ways than ever to build their dream sleep setup. We also opened stores in Halifax and Edmonton, and in November, we were named a Great Place to Work® for the sixth year in a row.2025A Year of Game-changersWe celebrated our first decade, partnered with iconic Canadian brand Tim Hortons for Roll Up To Win, and expanded our reach with the WNBA and Canadian star Aaliyah Edwards. It was a year that deepened our national roots and celebrated where we came from. As we grow, our promise stays the same: to help Canadians get a good night’s sleep—today, tomorrow, and all the years to come.We've Donated Over 24,000 Mattresses to Canadians in NeedAs a proudly Canadian company, we're here to make great sleep more accessible for everyone, from coast to coast.For over 10 years now, we've partnered with charities and non-profits nationwide to donate new and gently used mattresses to refugees, survivors of domestic violence, and newly housed youth. In 2025, we committed $25,000 in Endy products to Canadian Connections, a Toronto-based charity helping newcomers in need set up their first homes in Canada.Explore By Categorymattressesfurniturepillows

name: Purdys Chocolatier
aboutContent: About UsWe're a Canadian chocolatier with a rich history. Our founder, Richard Carmon Purdy, started selling homemade chocolates in downtown Vancouver, Canada in 1907. After 100+ years of crafting fine chocolates, you get to know a thing or two about doing it right. At Purdys, everyone - from our chocolatiers to our in-shop chocolate connoisseurs - is always inspired to take you away from the ordinary. We source premium-quality ingredients from around the world, and choose local options whenever possible. We never compromise on quality, and you bet you can taste it. Our chocolates are made with sustainable cocoa. We pay a premium for sustainable cocoa to ensure our farmer partners and co-ops are supported by programs that improve their profit and the livelihoods of their families. It's really quite simple, it's a choice we've made because it's the right choice to make. Truly Canadian and truly delicious, Purdys is a family-owned company that's proudly all about chocolate. Discover more about Purdys Heritage.

name: Mob Beauty
aboutContent: About Us EARTH-FIRST Refillable PackagingSustainable MaterialsRecyclingSustainability in ProgressPact FORMULATIONS MISSION EARTH-FIRST Refillable PackagingSustainable MaterialsRecyclingSustainability in ProgressPact FORMULATIONS MOB LabConscious without CompromisePerformance IngredientsOur StandardsNo List MISSION Better Beauty Earth-FirstRefillable PackagingWe spend as much time on our sustainability efforts and packaging design as we do on our product, and you have our commitment that we are always at work on solutions that are better for our planet. Reducing consumption reduces waste, so we designed our palettes to be endlessly refillable and customizable allowing you to make purposeful choices and individually buy only the products and shades you know you will use. Plus, what is better than having a palette designed by you and for you that holds all your makeup in one convenient place? Earth-FirstSustainable MaterialsWe carefully select our materials with consideration of their environmental impact which is why all palettes and refills are made with PET and PP resin, the easiest to recycle. Additionally, we use post-consumer recycled content (reusing material that already exists in the waste stream vs. using new virgin material) as much as possible. Our face, eye, and mascara refills are made with 100% PCR material, and our palettes are made with at least 50%! Using post-consumer recycled materials can be more expensive and challenging because it's difficult to work with, and our packaging was the first time most of our suppliers had ever used our requested material composition. 100% Biodegradable PackagingIdeally, packaging only lasts the life of your product, so we designed our individual compacts, jars, and capsules with a fully biodegradable material. After use, pop out refills for recycling with the Pact Collective and home compost or toss your empty packaging in your blue bin for easy curbside recycling. If you follow along on social, you may have seen us burying our compacts and powder jars in our garden where they completely turned to dirt in less than a year! THE FACTS: All of our outer packaging and shipping materials are 100% PCR from FSC certified suppliers that practice responsible forest management. Dark plastic cannot be seen and detected by current infrared optical sorting during recycling, so we included a resin called Ampacet in our palettes and lipstick refills that allows the infrared sensor to see the material. Our components are "mono-material" which means they are made with one single type of material. Packaging that is mono-material is much more easily recycled, and in fact many packages that use mixed materials are very difficult to recycle and end up in landfills. Earth-FirstRecyclingHow to dispose of your MOB packaging: Recycle shipping boxes and packing paper in your home bin. Recycle the outer packaging in your home bin or remove and recycle the labels and home compost the package separately. Keep and refill your palettes! Refills are too small to be recycled at home because they are smaller than a yogurt cup, so drop your empty and cleaned MOB tube, capsule, and pan refills into a Pact recycling bin. Find locations here or use our Pact mail back recycling program if you don't have access to a Pact bin. Recycled bottles waiting to be made into MOB Lip Capsules. Earth-FirstSustainability in ProgressThe beauty industry generates an estimated 120 billion cosmetic packages annually, most of which cannot be successfully recycled through your home recycling program typically because of the material composition or size. We couldn’t find a suitable recycling solution for this hard to recycle beauty packaging, so we partnered with Credo Beauty and founded Pact, a nonprofit organization that collects beauties empties that can’t be recycled in your blue bin and prevents them from becoming trash. Pact is on a mission to address the massive environmental impact of cosmetics packaging and offer truthful information and education to help you make informed and sustainable choices. Want to learn more about sustainability overall from formulas to packaging? Read HERE for more. Earth-FirstPactWe launched Pact on Earth Day, 2021, and we are so proud of the progress thus far! To date over 160 brands and retailer members from across the industry have joined, and together we have collected over half a million pounds of material! There are now over 3,300 Pact bins where you can drop off your cleaned, hard-to-recycle beauty empties, so learn more about Pact at www.pactcollective.org. We all share one planet, and together we can make a difference! EARTH-FIRST FORMULATIONS MOB LabConscious without CompromisePerformance IngredientsOur StandardsNo List MISSION FORMULATIONS MOB LabConscious without CompromisePerformance IngredientsOur StandardsNo List EARTH-FIRST Refillable PackagingSustainable MaterialsRecyclingSustainability in ProgressPact MISSION Better Beauty FormulationsMOB LabWe’re chemists, artists, and product developers and have our own MOB Labs which gives us the freedom and flexibility to create all day every day. We obsess over shades and textures and are committed to continuous formula innovation which is why we never stop searching for new technology and raw ingredients. Having our own labs also means we can bring our community in to create with us, and some of our most beloved shades and formulas we’re made alongside them! We are constantly formulating, testing, and experimenting with new techniques, so follow us on social for behind the scenes! Ingredients impact performance, your body, and the planet. FormulationsConscious without CompromiseAt MOB, clean, sustainable, cruelty-free, and vegan formulas are product requirements, and with our deep roots in research and development, we deliver on these values without any compromise to performance. Taking it a step further, we leave out silicones, petroleum- based oils, and micro-plastics that are still very common in our industry and instead substitute skincare actives and nourishing plant oils which we know are better for you and our planet but also offer superior feel and performance. We take a product-first approach with the highest standards, never settling for anything less than artist-approved formulas which means great pay-off, smooth and easy to blend textures with no "fall out", and long wear (just some of our criteria!). We meticulously test and perfect every formula and shade with our community (including our pro-artists!) before launch. You can count on us for unique textures and one-of-a-kind modern shades. FormulationsPerformance Ingredients BisabololWhy Do We Use It? Bisabolol is an extract from chamomile; a healing agent that reduces inflammation, calms, and soothes PhytosphingosineWhy Do We Use It? A natural lipid that strengthens the skin’s barrier, hydrates by locking in moisture, and is anti-bacterial Vitamin C and EWhy Do We Use It? Protective anti-oxidants that protect skin from free radicals, evens out skin tone, and strengthens the skin’s barrier FormulationsOur StandardsWe sustainably and ethically source our ingredients and leave out ingredients like silicones which don't bio-degrade and end up in our water supply harming biodiversity and our local ecosystems. We only use RSPO certified Palm Oil which verifies it was sourced from responsible areas. We only use ethically sourced Mica, and all of our suppliers provide a statement that no child labor has been used in sourcing or production. We are proud to be Leaping Bunny and PETA Certified Vegan and Cruelty-Free. Sustainable Clean Vegan and Cruelty-Free FormulationsNo ListWe don’t just stop at clean. We formulate our products to leave out ingredients that are known or understood to be health concerns. All of our formulas are hypo-allergenic, while still maintaining the highest performance. Vegan Exclusions Sustainability Exclusions Health Exclusions EARTH-FIRST FORMULATIONS MISSION Better Beauty MISSION Better Beauty EARTH-FIRST Refillable PackagingSustainable MaterialsRecyclingSustainability in ProgressPact FORMULATIONS MOB LabConscious without CompromisePerformance IngredientsOur StandardsNo List We’ve Made it Our Mission to do Beauty Better. MissionBetter BeautyWe’re here to build beauty for a better future. To define new standards in the industry by questioning everything, to improve everything. MOB is for anyone who digs deeper into what they buy, demands accountability and quality from their makeup, considers clean to be a necessity and believes packaging needs to be re-thought. Who believe: Sustainability isn't jargon — it’s our future People > Marketing Quality > Wastefulness Transparency = Truth We started MOB Beauty to build a different kind of brand — a brand that’s defined by our community and good for the planet. We’re in it for the long haul. Have a question not covered here? Email us: support@mobbeauty.com @THEMOBBEAUTYMore MOB↗

name: 19 99 Beauty
aboutContent: BEAUTY FOR EVERYONE, AGES 19 TO 99 Why does 19/99 exist? Because beauty isn’t defined by age—it’s defined by you. We believe in self-expression without limits, without labels, and without compromise. Whether you're 19 or 99, beauty is yours to define. DO MORE WITH LESS Our approach is simple: do more with less. We create multi-functional, high-performance makeup essentials for building, blending, buffing, smudging, and doing what you want. Makeup is an embellishment, an accessory, and above all, temporary. We embrace and find beauty in the smears, strokes, creases, and the time spent with ourselves to make up or just to touch up. Every product is cruelty-free, vegan, and free of synthetic fragrances. Sustainability matters to us, too. That’s why we prioritize recycled and recyclable materials while minimizing plastic use. . WHO WE ARE 19/99 is female founded, female owned, and based in Toronto, Canada. We believe beauty isn’t one-size-fits-all—it’s personal, ever-evolving, and limitless. Partnering with industry visionaries Diti Katona and Simone Otis, we’re challenging outdated standards and reshaping the conversation around beauty and self-expression. This isn’t just makeup. It’s a movement. And we’d love for you to be part of it. - Camille & Stephanie, founders of 19/99 Beauty

name: Kits Eyewear
aboutContent: ABOUT US It began on Kits Beach in Vancouver, Canada. Three friends launched a mission to create a better way to help people see. KITS makes eyecare easy We've served over 1 million customers since 2018, proving that premium eyecare can be convenient, fast, and affordable. Quality & Selection KITS offers a rich selection of premium eyecare products: our own KITS brand as well as a large, curated portfolio of designer frames and contacts. Customer First We prioritize our customers above all else. We are obsessed with the quality of our products and your KITS experience. KITS is vertically integrated, lean and local. This enables us to make premium eyecare affordable, convenient, and fast. Made in Canada KITS is proudly Canadian - owned and operated. Our modern optical lab in Vancouver is where we craft our lenses and tailor glasses to customer's prescription. explore our collection

name: Charm Diamond Centres
aboutContent: Company History From the moment you say, ‘yes’ your engagement ring becomes a beautiful symbol of the one you promise to love forever. It’s a token of the memories you have and the memories you’ll make together for a lifetime. For 50 years, Charm Diamond Centres has been honoured to help Canadians create and celebrate love stories that span generations. Founded in 1972 By Richard Calder, Charm Diamond Centres began as a love story, rooted in a passion for jewellery and celebrating love. Specializing in charms and fine jewellery, our first store opened in Dartmouth, Nova Scotia, and has grown to over 60 stores across Canada. To this day, our Charm name shines bright, as Canada's largest independently owned and family operated jeweller. From the beginning, Calder’s mission has been to, “Win the Customer for Life.” He believes providing excellent customer service and quality jewellery, at the best price, is the key to making that happen. Calder has spent his life searching and creating the world’s best bridal offerings for the Canadian Bride. As a proud Canadian, Richard has also led the way in Canadian Diamonds, being one of the first retailers to introduce them to the world. Charm Diamonds now proudly features Canada’s largest selection of Canadian diamonds, including Calder’s exclusive Canadian Diamond bridal collection, Charmed by Richard Calder. Whether you’re looking for a symbolic gift to celebrate your love or a sparkling gift to celebrate a special moment in time, the staff at Charm Diamond Centres is thrilled to be a part of your love story, because love starts here.

name: Penny Lane Organics
aboutContent: About Us HELLO I am Alexa Campbell, Owner of Penny Lane Organics, a Tree-Hugger and Skin Care Obsessed. I create a line of All Natural products based on my personal philosophy that if we wouldn’t put something IN our bodies then we won’t put it ON our bodies either. Our products are handmade in small batches to ensure high quality and freshness. We source luxurious organic ingredients that are all natural and rich in vitamins, minerals and antioxidants. Our products and ingredients are also cruelty-free, vegan/vegetarian, gluten free, sustainable and socially conscious. I believe all natural is best. If you have not made the switch now is the time. We offer Natural Skin Care, Personal Care, Baby Care, Pet Care, Aromatherapy and More. Handmade in Ontario, Canada with LOVE.

name: Lowens Natural Skincare
aboutContent: Our Story Lowen’s Natural SkincareLowen’s Natural Skincare is named after our daughter, Lowen, and inspired by our journey as parents. After struggling to find an effective diaper rash remedy, Registered Pharmacist Chad Zelensky used his clinical expertise to create a natural balm using high-quality, locally sourced, and unrefined ingredients.The result? A gentle yet powerful formula that cleared Lowen’s rash within days—and it never returned. Our youngest, Simone, and many other babies have since benefited from our balms, avoiding diaper rash altogether.Realizing that many parents faced similar struggles, we set out to share our solution and help families everywhere care for their children’s skin naturally. With that mission in mind, Lowen’s Natural Skincare was born.After launching our flagship Butter Balm, we expanded our line through research and persistence to include a wide range of balms, lotions, cleansers, scrubs, hair care products, and creams. Today, we continue to innovate—developing new products to meet the evolving needs of our customers and our own family. We Formulate Our Products Based On These Four Principles Safe for us = Safe for you We formulate our products using evidence-based, peer-reviewed, and personally-tested ingredients to ensure they are safe for you and your family. We ensure that our ingredients are thoroughly evaluated for safety, effectiveness, environmental impact, and animal welfare by the Environmental Working Group (EWG). Keeping it Simple We formulate our products with hard-working ingredients. What this means is that any single ingredient can provide multiple benefits within a particular product. This keeps our ingredients list to a minimum number of “simple” components. Do no Harm We do not test our products on animals nor do we purchase ingredients that have been tested on animals. Furthermore, Lowen’s has also been vetted by PETA and are listed in their Cruelty Free Company database. Sensible Sourcing We source local, certified organic and/or fair trade ingredients whenever possible and continually review and refine our practices to adhere to the above. If we are unable to find an ingredient close to home, we expand our search to find unrefined, organic, fair-trade ingredients from other community-minded social enterprises. THE LOWEN'S COMMITMENT TO YOU High Quality Only the best, most effective ingredients are selected. Unscented As a rule, our products generally do not have added scents… Traceable We investigate where our ingredients come from, what the parent plant(s) was/were, who farms it, how it’s harvested and how fresh it is Gentle Our products are gentle enough for everyday use for all age groups. Uncomplicated We use as few ingredients as possible and preferably those in their unrefined form. Therapeutic The entire Lowen’s line up can help relieve a variety of skin conditions as well as being incredible for daily self-care. Safe Prior to formulation, each potential ingredient is researched and screened for toxicity. Certified We are PETA Certified and EWG Verified™ Affordable We believe high-quality skincare should not cost a fortune and work hard to keep our costs low – which we pass on to you.

name: Elate Beauty
aboutContent: Skip to content 15% off Gift Cards! Until Dec 22ndCanadian Owned + Canadian MadeFree shipping on all North American orders of 75+ Your bag is empty Start shopping Add order note You may also likeUse the Previous and Next buttons to navigate through product recommendations, or scroll horizontally to view more products.Blush Balm Refill$22.00 meet elate Advocatingkindness since2014 Truth? The beauty industry wants you to feel bad about yourself. Because the worse you feel, the more you buy. It’s not kind, and we stand for kindness at Elate. We happen to think you deserve to feel beautiful just as you are—with and without makeup. By embracing diversity in ourselves and the beauty industry, we can enhance confidence, reduce waste and change the world.And as for your beauty bag? We think less is more, especially with 30% of all waste accredited to cosmetics. Curating a capsule of beloved, reusable, and recyclable products not only saves you the energy and money of cluttering your cosmetics case with lipsticks you’ll never wear, it saves landfills from unnecessary waste. If you ask us, intention makes for elation. Changing the industry together 697,000+ Plastic Packages Saved from landfills with our recycling program 157,500+ Gardens Grown from our seed paper packaging 22,000+ Trees Planted from customer orders — one for every order $27,000+ Donated to social and environmental causes in 2020 Why Elate?We’re for more mindful consumption Low-waste beauty starts with consumption. Saying no to marketing that makes you feel less than and yes to inclusive advertising that invites you to buy mindfully and minimally: When you’re ready to replenish or replace the old with the new—not before, and never impulsively. And with packaging that can be reused and recycled (and even planted), that waste-free future is within reach. We believe the makeup in our cosmetics case shouldn’t compromise the health of any person, animal or the planet. That’s why our products are 100% vegan and cruelty-free. They’re over 75% organic, but we always choose fair trade over organic when we can’t have both because it’s important to us that our farmers and their workers are paid fairly and operate safely. Organic certification is so expensive, farmers may compromise the integrity of their operation to achieve it—and that’s not okay with us. Truth? Just because packaging can be recycled doesn’t mean it is. Well-intentioned consumers may toss empties in the recycling bin, not realizing they’re too small for your typical recycling facility. At Elate, we don’t think it’s your responsibility to recycle our packaging—it’s ours. After all, we created it. Over 75% of our packaging is reusable, recyclable or plantable (we’re working on the other 25%), and all of our packaging can be returned to us (for free), so we can refill it or recycle it for you. We believe beauty is for everyone. Period. Whatever your gender identity, age, ethnicity or body type, beauty is for you. We like to think the more diverse our concept of beauty, the more inclusive our world will be, and the more empowered we’ll feel in our bodies and lives. Of course, putting on mascara isn’t going to change the world—but it may change your perception of yourself so you can. And we’re all for changing the world. So, go forth and feel beautiful. B CorporationCertified B Corps like Elate are global leaders in nurturing people, planet and profit. We use our businesses as a force for social and environmental good. Leaping BunnyAudited at every stage of product development, our Leaping Bunny certification guarantees your Elate products are cruelty-free and never tested on animals. Beauty Without BunniesFounded by PETA, Beauty Without Bunnies is a database and the gold standard for vegan and cruelty-free companies. We never use animal ingredients or tests. Think Dirty AppThe Think Dirty app is a database for rating the potential toxicity of personal care products, like cosmetics. Search any Elate product to read our ingredients and rating. Our Story Changing the world one lipstick at a time Founded by Melodie Reynolds, beauty industry insider of 20 years, Elate was born of Melodie’s penchant for kindness—for ourselves, each other and our planet. Disheartened by the unethical and unsustainable practices typical of the industry, Melodie envisioned a different future—one without shame-based marketing or single-use packaging. She founded Elate in 2014 on a mission: To redefine what “low waste” looks like in the cosmetics industry. What seems like a grandiose goal at first glance is actually modest in its practicality: It starts at home. One person, one product and one routine at a time. As Melodie always says, routine becomes ritual when the act is more important than the result. The act of intentionally choosing ethical ingredients, sustainable packaging and inclusive advertising. Choosing less over more. Choosing with kindness. The question is: How will you choose? Our CausesGiving back to our planet and people Our values in the planet, its people and animals are obvious in everything we do, from our ingredients to our packaging—but we don’t stop there. Every year, we donate 2% of our profits to causes that share our values—1% to social initiatives and 1% to environmental initiatives. We’re amplifying our impact with daily, monthly and yearly contributions to our selected charity of the year. name: Reversa
aboutContent: Our Mission A family story Ensuring people’s well-being, from generation to generationDermtek Pharma was founded in 1985 by Robert Lavoie and Nicole Clavet.Robert Lavoie has brought over 50 years of expertise and knowledge to Dermtek’s product line.______________________________________________A well-known figure in the specialty of Dermatology in Canada, Robert received the Healthcare Marketing Hall of Fame Award in 2004 and in 2016 was given the Award of Honour for his contributions to the overall well-being of Canadians by the CDA (Canadian Dermatology Association).______________________________________________The children of Robert and Nicole, Michel and Marie-Claude, have since taken over operations and continue the family legacy in formulating their own effective and affordable over the counter products with in house R&D. Reversa: Over 30 years of innovation In 1990, Dermtek launched and marketed their Ombrelle sunscreen. It was the first product to protect against UVA and UVB rays, which was a feat in and of itself in dermatological care at the time. The product line had so much success that L’Oréal bought it in 1997.______________________________________________After Ombrelle’s skin protection products, the next logical step was to correct skin damage caused by sun exposure. It is with this in mind that the Reversa brand was created and each of the brand’s products seeks to respond to the diverse needs of its consumers. ______________________________________________Reversa was one of the first brands to use glycolic acid as its main active ingredient, but the innovation didn’t stop there. Such innovation is seen daily at Reversa, since all our products are created by our team of experts. Every formula comes directly from our laboratory in Pointe-Claire, Québec. In addition, since 2018, we have been making sure that all our ingredients are vegan and that none of our products are tested on animals. Consult the pages Vegan Skincare and Cruelty-Free Lab to learn more. Why Choose Us Safe products that do not compromise performance Reversa’s reputation is based on the equilibrium the brand has found between science and nature, as well as performance and safety. It is by making dermatologists and cosmeticians its allies that the brand has found a way to develop skin care products that cater to specific and important issues facing consumers. Designed in Canada Everything happens at home At Reversa, we design and develop our products here in Canada.To ensure our products’ safety and effectiveness, we employ our industry’s recent validated safety methods. Cruelty-free PETA Certification PETA certification assures consumers that a product’s ingredients do not include any raw material of animal origin and that the company does not conduct, commission or pay for animal testing for any of its products, ingredients or formulations. Vegan 100% vegan care products Our 100% vegan skin care products do not contain any ingredients derived from animals, Proven effectiveness Dermatologist recommended The Reversa brand is recognized for the effectiveness of its products. That’s why, for over 30 years, Canadian dermatologists have been recommending their products. Dermtek Dermtek Pharma Dermtek Pharma also offers a variety of dermatological treatments for rosacea, body and scalp psoriasis, eczema, acne, warts and other skin conditions. Visit Dermtek Pharma

name: Jouviance
aboutContent: À TRAVERS LES ANNÉES 2003 L'histoire commence... Le Dr Sylvestre, dermatologue, pionnier de la médecine esthétique au Canada dès le début de son introduction, s’associe à Roger Southin, un biochimiste reconnu dans le monde pharmaceutique, pour créer Jouviance, débutant avec la Crème Anti-Age Rajeunissante 3-EN-1. 2004 Reconnaissance de la marque Les bienfaits de la crème 3 EN 1 sont vantés par Mme Dominique Bertrand, animatrice radio, et la crème se fait une place dans le milieu de la cosmétique québécoise. 2006 Expansion de la marque Seulement 3 ans après son début, la marque débute sa vente en pharmacie à travers le Québec puis le Canada. 2012 Des lancements innovants En janvier 2012, Jouviance lance une gamme de maquillage et de parfums, incluant quatre parfums distincts. Cette année marque également le début de la collaboration avec Véronique Cloutier, qui devient le visage et l'ambassadrice des soins, des parfums et de la ligne de maquillage de la marque. 2014 Introduction de nouveaux ingrédients Parmi ses innovations, le premier produit à base de rétinol, le 3D-Action, se distingue par son efficacité et sa popularité. 2015 Jouviance lance sa gamme de produits à l’acide glycolique. 2016 Découverte d'une innovation Le premier produit à base de vitamine C de Jouviance voit le jour. 2018 15 ans de science Pour célébrer son 15e anniversaire, Jouviance lance une édition limitée de son soin 3-EN-1, enrichie en acide hyaluronique et fragrance naturelle, qui est connu aujourd’hui sous le nom de la 3-EN-1 Tous types de peau. 2019 Premières récompenses Jouviance remporte le Grand Prix de la Beauté ELLE QC & Canada avec la 3D-Action Boost, dans la catégorie crème anti-âge en dessous de 60 $. 2020 Grand Prix de la Beauté ELLE QC & Canada La 3 EN 1 Tous types de peau est récompensé comme la meilleure crème de jour à moins de 100 $. 2021 Grand Prix de la Beauté ELLE QC & Canada L'Anti-Age Duo Pro remporte le prix, dans la catégorie crème anti-âge de plus de 100 $. 2022 Grand Prix de la Beauté ELLE QC & Canada La 3 EN 1 Tous types de peau est récompensé comme la meilleure crème de jour à moins de 100 $. L'Anti-Age Duo Pro remporte un prix Palmarès Beauté de Châtelaine. 2023 Jouviance remporte le Grand Prix de la Beauté ELLE QC & Canada dans la catégorie Exfoliant. 2024 Nouvelle gamme Jouviance lance une nouvelle gamme de Boosters, enrichis en ingrédients actifs pour une efficacité maximale sur la peau. Juin 2024 Le Gel Nettoyant remporte le prix « I Recommend » décerné par les professionnels des cosmétiques et le Cosmetics Magazine dans la catégorie des nettoyants dermo-cosmétiques. Octobre 2024 Pour une deuxième année consécutive, Jouviance remporte le Grand Prix de la Beauté ELLE QC & Canada dans la catégorie Exfoliant.

Affordably priced You can always count on thoughtfully priced products with a commitment to accessibility. About the Founder “I know firsthand the healing power of nature and want to see as many people as possible integrate natural moments into their everyday skincare routines.” Laura has always believed in nature’s ability to positively impact the mind and body, but kept finding nature’s offerings premium-ized to be out of reach for the average person.Looking for an alternative path forward, she began experimenting with making and using handmade natural skincare, and in 2014, she founded Wildcraft to bring the powerful effects of nature to the everyday routine.Today, Wildcraft is a thriving business with a growing team, an expansive network of retailers, and an ever-expanding line of affordable natural skincare. name: Annabelle
aboutContent: Our Story Annabelle Brand Story Annabelle was born in August of 1967. It was one of the most dazzlingly colourful summers in history, with all eyes on the cosmopolitan city of Montréal, who was playing host to the World’s Fair.The Fair was a kaleidoscope of cultural diversity, and a vibrant, visionary celebration of humanity.A sense explosive human potential was spreading like wildfire from the hippie love-ins of San Francisco to the ivory towers of academia in Paris.As a child of that era, Annabelle captured both its vibrant colour and its message of empowerment with the notion of Colour Power. We built a reputation for its extraordinary variety of bold shades and nuanced hues, created to inspire women to freely experiment and express their own powerful and colourful sense of personal style.Today, nearly fifty years later, the power of self-expression has reached a whole new level as women of all ages and backgrounds celebrate and share their beauty and strength on Youtube, Pinterest, Facebook and Instagram. The faces and messages of the beauty industry are changing for the positive, and we’re excited to be a part of that change.Our Colour Power is stronger than ever, and it’s our dream to help women everywhere find and have fun expressing a power all their own. Annabelle believes that it’s not the way you look that counts – it’s how you look at the world. A strong connection to what makes us unique is what makes us truly beautiful. And when we bring that beauty light, it can turn even the most ordinary day into something powerfully beautiful.

name: Green Beaver
aboutContent: ABOUT USOur mission at Green Beaver is to help people access a natural and healthier lifestyle, while contributing to a more sustainable world. We offer a wide variety of safe and effective cosmetics and personal care products that are suitable for everyone in the family and better for our planet. We believe that every family can truly benefit from purchasing natural products that are better for the body, for the children, and for the future of our planet. Our story It all started in our kitchen! That’s where we developed our first recipes by combining our scientific backgrounds with our desire to make a real difference in people’s lives.Our longing to offer natural products was propelled by a mission to raise awareness about the dangers of chemicals often present in conventional personal care products.We carefully select natural, organic, and locally grown ingredients. Tell me more ! Green Beaver is a Canadian company founded in 2002 with a mission to inspire natural living in a more sustainable world. Taking care of yourself by leading a natural and sustainable lifestyle is possible. Mission at values Inspiring a natural lifestyle for a sustainable world, one product at a time. We strive to make this lifestyle accessible to everyone.Our ambition is to establish ourselves as the most influential Canadian personal care company in the industry.We believe that by fostering values such as innovation, passion, transparency, and teamwork, we can all live a healthier lifestyle together. Discover our products Our Certifications Contact us!

name: Buck Naked Soap Company
aboutContent: Buck Naked Our Story Buck Naked was born out of necessity. When baby Elias, son of Buck Naked founders Rina and John, developed skin irritations from traditional baby products, they soon realized they needed a truly natural alternative. As necessity is the mother of all invention, the Chamomile & Calendula Soap was invented to help soothe the little guy’s skin. With this creation, Rina discovered her passion of formulating skin care products using the purest of ingredients. Since inception, we’ve introduced a full line of all-natural, vegan, handcrafted skin care products. We’re committed to being chemical-free, using only pure, natural ingredients. On this, we are unwavering: if you can't (or shouldn’t) eat it, we won't use it. Why Natural? Our skin is our body’s largest organ. We don't often think about it, but it’s our first line of defense against potentially harmful bacteria and contaminants. The thin layer of sebum that covers our bodies works like an invisible shield. At 22 incredible square feet, our skin deserves to be nurtured and nourished with the best quality of ingredients. However, our skin is also porous, which means that between 13% (the bottom of our feet) and 100% (underarms and groin) of the products we put onto our skin is absorbed within 26 seconds. Although federally-approved, many traditional products contain a variety of chemicals that soak into our skin and bloodstream in that 26-second window and potentially disrupt our bodies' natural balances. Some chemicals, like sodium laureth sulfate (a detergent and lather booster), can contain contaminates that are considered possible human carcinogens – harmful to the nervous system, and classified as possible developmental toxicants. This is why Buck Naked Soap Company makes only natural skin care products. [Read more…]

name: East Coast Glow
aboutContent: Hello and welcome. We’re Karen and Roger Dewling, founders of East Coast Glow, a wildcrafted skincare company located in amazing Bonavista, Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada. We began this adventure in 2010 as two creatively minded (and somewhat frustrated) parents searching for a natural solution to our newborn daughter’s agonizing skin condition. Today, our modern apothecary studio and shop sits near the edge of the North Atlantic Ocean where ancient icebergs drift by each spring, offering us the purest water on the planet to use in our distillations. We’re passionate ambassadors for sustainable, plant-based skincare. We forage and harvest by hand, using only wild, sustainable ingredients. From river mint to wild rose, we embrace the seasons and the bounty each has to offer. We capture the synergy of nature with innovative formulas that blend ancient and modern science. We invite you to join us in a simple, unhurried, self-care ritual that delights the senses. – Karen + Roger

name: Birch Babe
aboutContent: About Us We're here to make your healthy lifestyle choices a breeze, benefiting both you and the planet! We’re Birch Babe, a female and family led company offering a collection of 60+ award-winning, certified all natural, vegan and cruelty-free skin, body, baby and clean beauty products. Our mission is to help people make easy lifestyle choices for the health of their bodies and the planet with products that are clean, approachable and effective. All Birch Babe products are formulated in our lab in Ontario with sustainably sourced, EcoCert and Fairtrade ingredients and packaged low waste and plastic-free wherever possible. In acknowledging the land on which Birch Babe operates, we recognize with respect and gratitude that we are situated on the traditional territory of the Algonquin-speaking peoples like the Cree and Ojibwa, as well Iroquoian-speaking peoples, such as the Wyandot (Huron), Erie, Oneida, and Neutral. We honour their enduring presence on this land and express our commitment to fostering meaningful relationships, acknowledging their unique contributions, and working towards reconciliation and understanding. We look forward being on this sustainably journey with you. Our Products All our products are meticulously crafted to provide customers with the assurance that what they apply to their bodies and those of their loved ones is not only safe but also tailored to meet their unique needs. This commitment extends across our entire product line, and it will continue to be a guiding principle for any new releases in the future. We prioritize the well-being of our customers by ensuring that each product undergoes rigorous testing, adheres to the highest safety standards, and is thoughtfully formulated to cater to the diverse and specific requirements of individuals and families alike. Your peace of mind is our top priority, and we are dedicated to delivering products that align seamlessly with your values and expectations. Our Packaging In our commitment to environmental sustainability, Birch Babe is dedicated to using reusable and recyclable materials while minimizing plastic in our packaging. Recognizing the urgent need to address the environmental impact of single-use plastics, we have implemented a thoughtful approach to reduce our ecological footprint. By opting for sustainable materials, we aim to contribute to the global effort in curbing plastic pollution, protecting our ecosystems, and fostering a more circular economy. Our choice to prioritize reusable and recyclable packaging aligns with our values of responsible business practices, ensuring that the beauty we provide comes with a commitment to preserving the beauty of our planet for future generations. How it started: Founding Story It all began with our adventurous mom's remarkable solo trek across South America, a six-month journey that unfolded six years ago. Debbie, the pioneering spirit behind Birch Babe, embarked on an awe-inspiring hike from the southern tip of Patagonia to the northern reaches of Chile. Amidst the breathtaking landscapes, she couldn't help but witness an alarming amount of waste. While traversing Patagonia, Debbie appreciated the locals' conscientious attitude toward the environment. Already mindful of what she applied to her skin and consumed, she had grown skeptical of the skincare industry's lack of transparency and social responsibility. The transformative experience ignited a fervor within Debbie to contribute more to both our bodies' well-being and the health of the planet. Returning home, she immediately immersed herself in crafting cleaner, more responsible skincare and body care products. What began as a personal pursuit soon extended to friends, and eventually, Birch Babe products found their way to festivals and stores nationwide. Enter Debbie's daughters, Kelsey and Lindsay, both driven by a passion for environmental stewardship and making a positive impact. Joining forces, they transformed Birch Babe into a female and family-led company, infusing it with a commitment to authenticity, transparency, and a shared mission to foster a healthier world for generations to come. Birch Babe can now be found in over 200+ stores across North America, on Indigo.ca, Well.ca and has been seen on CTV’s The Social and CNN. The Team Kelsey Irvine - Chief Executive Officer (left)Debbie Alger - Founder & Lead Organic Skincare Formulator (centre)Lindsay Irvine - Chief Operating Officer (right)Together, our mother and two daughter team offers a collection of unique and diverse skills as well as an unparalleled passion for making a positive impact on the health of our bodies and the planet.Watch The Video! Learn more about our story and how Birch Babe started in our Brand Video ‘Connected’ here.

name: Pure Anada
aboutContent: About Us OUR PEOPLE The success of Pure Anada is due to wonderful people! Clients and retailers like you, who believe in supporting locally-made, healthy, Canadian products have been the catalyst for our amazing growth. We are so thankful for your word-of mouth advertising, product suggestions and purchases! Our team of employees is the most valuable part of our business. Positive attitudes, hard work ethics and a commitment to our processes, brand philosophy and customer service have distinguished Pure Anada in the marketplace of natural cosmetics. OUR BOUTIQUES Shopping online is convenient, but nothing compares to the experience of visiting one of our local boutiques! Smelling the soap, sampling the lotion and swatching makeup shades is absolutely delightful. Our boutique ladies love helping our guests choose the products that are best for you. We hope you will visit us one day soon! Learn more about our local boutiques here. FOUNDER'S STORY When asked how I got started in this business, I often find myself reflecting on the journey that has unfolded. What began as a hobby in my kitchen, turned into our family’s full-time livelihood. It’s been an exciting adventure; one that I believe is part of a greater plan and I am truly grateful for the opportunity to continue leading and growing Pure Anada. My professional background began in hairstyling, where I enjoyed the creativity of working in a salon and the relationships I built with clients. However, over time I began to develop sensitivities to some of the products and chemicals commonly used in the industry. I found myself relying on prescription creams for my hands and taking daily allergy medication just to get through the day. Growing up, I was always conscious of health and wellness, thanks to my mother who taught me the value of nourishing the body with wholesome, natural foods. As a child, I was the one bringing homemade whole grain bread and apple juice from our family orchard to school. She instilled in me a deep understanding of the importance of what we put into our bodies. This awareness led me to the realization (once I became a mother myself): if what we consume matters, then surely what we put on our bodies matters too. In 2003, with two young children at home, I made a conscious decision to embrace a more holistic lifestyle, eliminating many household and personal care products in favour of healthier, more environmentally responsible alternatives. The final conversion was my cosmetics! I had always relied on high-quality salon brands, so I struggled to find natural makeup that covered my rosacea to my satisfaction. Driven by a lifelong passion for creating things with my own hands—whether it was sewing, baking, or crafting—I decided to try making my own makeup as well. What began as a personal project quickly gained momentum. I researched natural, organic ingredients and started crafting makeup for myself, my friends, and my family. It was eye-opening to discover how many people, especially women, were sensitive to conventional cosmetics. It seemed our bodies were signaling, “Enough with the chemicals!” Even more rewarding was realizing that the products I was making, using organic botanicals and food-grade minerals - did not cause irritation. This reinforced my belief that there was a growing demand for natural, safe alternatives in the beauty industry. As consumer awareness of the ingredients in personal care products continued to grow, it became clear that this was more than just a personal passion; it was a business opportunity. Today, I am proud to lead a company that offers high-quality, natural cosmetics that make people feel beautiful without compromising on safety. The story of our family business has been nothing short of amazing. From mixing products in my kitchen to now operating in a fully equipped facility with a dedicated team, we have come a long way! The little ones I once tucked into bed while working on my business are now an integral part of our daily operation. Our goal is to continue expanding our product line, introducing new colors and formulations to meet the evolving needs of our customers. I am deeply honored to help women enhance their natural beauty with products they can feel confident wearing. Thank YOU for being a part of our story. Blessings, Candace Grenier Founder, Pure Anada Inc. Your free trial with BSS B2B Lock has ended - All locks in paid plan will be disabled! Start a subscription or continue with our free plan. Only you can see this notice.

name: Polysleep
aboutContent: It all started with a real need... and a lot of pain 😖 In 2016, the life of our founder, Jeremiah Curvers, took an unexpected turn.A diagnosis of a double herniated disc forced him into immobility for three months.Nailed to his bed, unable to move, he was faced with a physical and mental challenge. But sometimes, stopping is the starting point of a revolution 🧠 Being in bed nonstop day and night sucks 💩 But it's in those hard times that genius ideas come alive.Jeremiah realized just how much sleep was misunderstood, underestimated, and even corrupted by the products supposed to support it.A question emerged that became an obsession: HOW CAN WE DEEPLY AND SUSTAINABLY IMPROVE PEOPLE'S SLEEP?Still in bed (it still sucks), he set about creating solutions with a local factory in Montréal, Canada. Not a prototype or two, but 22, before perfecting our first product, the Polysleep Mattress. That’s how Polysleep was born 💜 What began as a personal mission (and obsession to perfection 😝) became a Canadian sleep movement in the next years, helping thousands of people rest better every night.Polysleep is proud to be one of Canada's fastest-growing mattress brands, and the only vertically integrated sleep company in Canada to manufacture its own foam recipe. In the last decade, we served thousands of happy customers online and in-store in North America. We believe in wellness through sleep and in doing business with purpose. %22 Less CO₂ Studies estimate a savings of 80–100 kg of CO₂ per 100 mattresses shipped in boxes (like ours 💪). 62 Prototypes developped To provide the best solutions to real problems. 611 + Mattresses & pillows donations Through our cross-Canada charity network. Returned mattresses get a second life - donated to someone in need through our network of Canadian charities. We craft sleep that’s good for you and the planet. Our secret sauce? Earth-friendly materials and shipping so efficient it makes Tetris jealous. We fit 6 Polysleep mattresses where others squeeze in just 2. Less truck space, less carbon, more high-fives. Internally, we thrive on diversity, creativity, and equality.Everyone here is encouraged to dream big and make a difference, just like the idea that started it all!!! Also, sleep is part of every stages of life Polysleep wants to be there, every step of the way. In the easy times, but also in the hard times.Not just to sell a mattress, but to offer real support. A cocoon, an anchor, a tool for resilience. Every night, somewhere in Canada, someone experiences a life-changing moment... and we're there, silently, to support them. Sleep Better, Live Better You’ve read about our story. Now meet the dream… mattresses.Browse our collection and find the one that suit you. Shop Mattresses

name: Pura Botanicals
aboutContent: Our Founder - Meet Lane PURA started because I felt so passionate about innovating beauty care products that I could trust. It was ingrained in me from a young age with a mother and grandmother who were both knowledgeable and wise in herbology, wellness and nutrition. My beloved mother lost her heroic battle to an autoimmune disease in 2013. Losing her has made me even more protective of women's health and longevity. When I was expecting my first baby, I became extremely sensitive to all of my conventional beauty products, especially synthetic scent. I couldn't find a skincare line I truly loved. I felt compelled to innovate a luxurious, plant-powered line. Growing up, I'll never forget the bliss of dipping my toes into her bubble baths, and her sensorial nighttime skincare routine. I can still remember the smell of her night cream from when I kissed her goodnight. As a mother of three, I'm my own customer who craves a clean skincare ritual that calms, heals, and repairs. From filling orders as a mad scientist in my unfinished basement, to shipping our products worldwide, being chosen to be Fleetwood Mac's official skincare for their last world tour, or seeing your reviews come in, we are a proud Canadian-made brand. Thanks to our loyal community who inspire me daily, we have never felt more loved and empowered to help women feel confident in their own skin and to age with power. Thank you for supporting a little girl's dream who had a potion step at the side of her home, and for trusting PURA to be a part of your invaluable self care rituals and healthy skin. In pure we trust. With Love,Lane Edwards Founder & Director Pura Botanicals Inc.

name: Om Organics
aboutContent: Own Your Individual Beauty You are not a collection of flaws to be fixed. What makes you different is what makes you powerful and strong. At the heart of Om is an appreciation for who we are as individuals and the unique gifts we each bring to the world. We’ll speak the truth, unfiltered and unretouched, and we’ll celebrate each other as we are. Beautifully made. Our Promise Pure, plant-based, totally clean skincareNo synthetic colour or fragranceNo fillers, parabens or sulfatesNo toxic chemicals or harsh ingredientsCruelty-free, gluten-free, veganSafe for moms-to-beHandcrafted in Canada Certified by CertClean North America's standard for toxin-free skin care. Better for Everyone We believe that premium products don’t have to come with a premium price tag. We keep our plant-based, totally clean formulas affordable so we can reach more people and make a bigger difference. Meet Our Founder “I spent many years working as an esthetician. Although I had access to the ‘best’ skincare products, I could never seem to manage my own skin struggles: extremely sensitive, reactive and breakout prone. I started creating my own with plant-based formulations and saw a drastic improvement in the health of my skin. Without much consideration, I quit my job, maxed out my credit cards and began a three year journey of intensive study into the world of natural cosmetics. My passion, vision and excitement for green beauty took hold. They have become deeply rooted in every part of Om.”Kari Asselin Read More Our Apothecary Each of our products is meticulously handcrafted with intention at our Apothecary in Invermere, B.C. By bringing our formulas to life in small batches, we ensure the highest level of quality and care goes into every product. This artisanal approach allows us to ensure the purity and potency of our craft, resulting in truly effective and luxurious skincare. We encourage you to experience the difference that our dedication and craftsmanship bring to your beauty regimen. Shine From Within We think principles look good on everyone. Learn more about what we’re doing to live our values. Our Impact

name: Veriphy
aboutContent: FOUNDED AND FORMULATED BY WOMEN IN STEM+BAbout Veriphy SkincareBorn out of a lucky science experiment gone wrong, Veriphy Skincare was founded by a group of women who saw the power in a vegan form of glycogen. We're built for professionals by professionals with the cleanest ingredients. We want to give people clear, radiant skin so they feel confident in every step of their life, career, and beyond. Clinically proven ingredients for real resultsOur PhytoSpherix® Technology has been clinically proven to strengthen skin and provide visible improvements. It's not just a marketing claim. Natural ingredients for healthy skinWe use only natural ingredients in our luxury skincare products, ensuring that your skin is nourished and healthy. No harsh chemicals or synthetic fragrances. Cruelty-free and environmentally friendlyOur commitment to being 100% cruelty-free and environmentally friendly means you can feel good about using our products. No animals harmed and no harm to the planet. Award-winning qualityOur brand has been recognized for providing high-quality, effective skincare products that deliver real results. Trust the experts and try our award-winning products. A note from our CEO"I spent two decades trying to prove myself in business and in my life. I worked endless hours, read countless self-growth and business books, and looked for every life hack to figure out how to ‘be successful.’ One day, I realized that when I felt truly confident and comfortable with myself, life felt like it got easier. I earned more respect from colleagues, more opportunities came my way, and I was generally happier. I became obsessed with figuring out ways to increase my personal confidence, and having great skin was one of them. It was part of the first impression I gave to the world and helped fuel a deeper confidence that had lay dormant inside of me. My quest for glowing, radiant skin led me to discover Veriphy, a small, clean skincare line with an innovative plant-based form of glycogen at the heart of each product. This unique ingredient we now call PhytoSpherix® has been proven to give amazing results; from 130% increase in skin hydration to 97% of people having more radiant complexion, this ingredient is the future of modern skincare. I fell in love with this small brand not only for their powerful range of products, but also for the support they showed to women in STEM +B (Science Technology Engineering Math + Business). Something inside felt strongly about helping this brand to grow and expand. I wanted other people to experience the amazing skincare results and feel the confidence that great skin could give them.So I decided to invest in the company and am now on a mission to help more people remember how powerful they actually are. I know that with great skin we have the confidence to do great things. Imagine what you can do when you feel like the best version of yourself."Lindsay Nahmiache, Owner & CEO Veriphy. FOUNDED AND FORMULATED BYWomen in STEM + BWe are formulated and founded by Women in STEM+B fields of Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics + Business(we added the “+B” because getting more women into Business is important too). We proudly support women in STEM+B though scholarships given in these fields every year. LEARN MORE The Proof Is In The Reviews from 338 reviews FREE SHIPPINGOn north american orders over $70 FAST, EASY RETURNSFor up to 30 days HERE TO HELPContact us whenever you need assistance

name: Cocoon Apothecary
aboutContent: Our Story: 22 Years of Intentional Beauty Cocoon Apothecary began in 2003 with one belief: nature holds the intelligence our skin needs most. Since then, founder Jessica Burman has spent two decades studying aromatherapy, perfumery, and plant science to create skincare that’s luxurious, ethical, and deeply effective. Where It All Began In 2003, a simple natural cream transformed a loved one’s skin and changed Jessica’s life. The following year, she earned her Aromatherapy Certification, studying how plant essences affect both skin and mood. This was the true beginning of her formulating career — blending art, science, and a deep respect for the skin’s natural balance. Learning the Language of Scent To refine her craft, Jessica travelled to Provence to study at the Grasse Institute of Perfumery — the historic home of fine fragrance. Among lavender fields and distilleries, she learned to compose scent with restraint, emotion, and respect for sensitive skin. These lessons shaped Cocoon’s signature aromatic identity: perfumes of purpose, not overpowering fragrance. Mastering Plant Distillation Later, in Spokane, Washington, Jessica studied plant distillation under world-renowned distiller Ann Harman. Working hands-on with copper stills and fresh botanicals, she learned how to capture the purest expressions of plants. That knowledge lives in every Cocoon formula — in the way our ingredients are chosen, extracted, and combined. Two Decades of Conscious Craftsmanship 2003Cocoon Apothecary is founded in Kitchener, Ontario. 2004Jessica earns her Aromatherapy Certification and begins formulating in earnest. 2006One of Canada’s early online natural-skincare stores goes live, sharing ingredient transparency before it was mainstream. 2011Awarded Champion Status with the Campaign for Safe Cosmetics, a coalition of 150 non-profits who worked to elimate dangerous chemicals from personal care. 2014Our own factory and retail shop opens, maintaining production in-house for full control and traceability. 2020We begin getting our products certified Natural and Organic with Ecocert Cosmos. 2023Cocoon Spathecary opens as our sensory flagship spa, built around the formulas our customers already love. What Defines Cocoon Scent with PurposeSubtle compositions that uplift the senses without overwhelming sensitive skin.Performance You Can FeelBotanical actives that restore radiance, balance, and barrier strength.Integrity in Every DetailECOCERT COSMOS, Canadian manufacturing, glass packaging, and a bottle return credit program.Longevity Over HypeTrusted, proven formulas refined over 22 years — not driven by trends. “My goal has always been to make skincare feel like a ritual — something you look forward to every day.”— Jessica Burman, Founder Join the Ritual Cocoon Apothecary isn’t just skincare. It’s a philosophy — one that celebrates nature, craft, and the quiet luxury of living intentionally. Experience what 22 years of care, study, and conscience can do for your skin. Explore the Collections

name: Hakim Optical
aboutContent: YOUR EYES CAN HAVE IT ALL AT HAKIM OPTICAL Hakim Optical began 50 years ago, when Sir Hakimi was grinding lenses for the Canadian wholesale market. He learned his craft as a youth in his native Iran and honed it in subsequent years, grinding lenses in Germany and camera lenses in Switzerland. Attracted by the excitement of retail opportunities, Sir Hakimi began to pass the great deals he gave wholesalers on to the public. Today, Hakim Optical serves the people of Canada with 161 outlets (including 140 one-hour factory outlets) across Ontario, Nova Scotia, New Brunswick, Manitoba, Saskatchewan, Alberta and British Columbia. WHETHER YOU NEED STYLE, VALUE OR CONVENIENCE, HAKIM HAS THE ANSWER ResearchThrough diligent research of the eyewear industry, Hakim Optical can offer the highest performing technology in frames and lenses to our customers. ValueHakim Optical provides best-in-class value on all of our products. If you find an advertised price lower than ours, we will beat it by 10%. StyleHakim Optical keeps our customers stylish. We offer all of the latest eyewear trends in a selection of designer brands and our Hakim brand frames. ServiceWe are committed to providing our customers with fast and simple solutions to their eyewear needs. Our expert staff, one hour laboratories and low prices combine for the complete shopping experience.

name: Fresh Prep
aboutContent: Better isn’t just a word—it’s our mission. It’s a call to action that fuels our passion for healthier, more convenient, and more sustainable ways of eating, doing business, and supporting the communities we live in.Our story starts with a simple question: "What’s for dinner?"In 2014, lifelong friends Becky Brauer, Dhruv Sood, and Husein Rahemtulla set out to make home-cooked meals easier for busy people—without the waste that often came with traditional meal kits. Fresh Prep was born: a local, innovative solution that made meal kits more sustainable and a whole lot smarter.In 2024, Fresh Prep acquired Cook it, a beloved Montreal-based meal kit company, and rebranded it in 2025 to expand across Canada—bringing even more Canadians an easier, better way to eat well.We’re changing how Canada does dinner.Less packaging & food wasteWe deliver in reusable cooler bags and offer most recipes in our patented Zero Waste Kit. We are continuing to scale our zero-waste solutions—because better meals shouldn't come with more waste.We also partner with Canadian organizations to fight food insecurity, reduce food waste, and donate meals to those in need—year-round.Fresher, quality ingredientsWe work with Canadian suppliers and producers who share our commitment to sustainability, sourcing fresh, high-quality ingredients for our chef-inspired recipes and ready-to-eat meals. We offer sustainably sourced seafood and antibiotic-free meat and poultry. Recipe ingredients are carefully chopped, prepared, and portioned to minimize waste and make mealtime easy.Delivering the promiseWe don’t rely on third-party couriers—we proudly operate our own delivery fleet. That means better quality control, convenient delivery windows, and real- time tracking, so you always know when your order is arriving. To reduce our impact, all deliveries are carbon offset, making them 100% net zero emissions.Fresh Prep was created with one simple goal: to offer something better. It’s what drives us every day—and why we’re so passionate about helping people eat well, effortlessly.Try us today and discover why we're Canada's top-rated meal kit.Sign up now

name: Canalta Hotels
aboutContent: About Canalta Family Owned and Operated Headquartered in Drumheller, Alberta, Canalta Hotels is a family owned and operated Canadian company, employing over 3000 people across Alberta, Saskatchewan, and Manitoba.Since 1974, Canalta Hotels’ founders, Cam and Sharlene Christianson, along with their sons Blair and Brooke Christianson, have dedicated their professional lives to building a genuine company based on the principles of hard work and service excellence.What began as one motor inn in Stettler, Alberta, gradually grew into a wider network and today, Canalta Hotels owns and operates more than 40 properties across Western Canada.The Christianson family’s never-give-up work ethic and “I-can’t-believe-they-did-that” service philosophy are what makes Canalta stand out in a category filled with jaded, impersonal service.That’s why the core values we hold at the center of our business operations are not forced or invented—They’re in our DNA Canalta History Canalta Cares Canalta is committed to our communities, the environment and standing for the right thing! Learn more Careers Canalta is an employer of choice – and if you are interested in joining our team, contact us and let’s see if you fit our culture! learn more Contact Need to contact us – We can help! learn more

name: Sandman Hotels
aboutContent: Skip to navigation Skip to main content Skip to footer arrow-right arrow-left arrow-bottom arrow-top calendar phone website download-arrow facebook facebook flickr flickr x google-plus tripadvisor tripadvisor instagram instagram pause play cross quote-open sun Menu mail marker clock check pinterest pinterest pinterest youtube youtube wechat wechat linkedin linkedin tiktok tiktok line-msg line-msg foursquare foursquare whatsapp whatsapp weibo weibo gallery-video triangle hotel hotel-air logout arrow-down xing xing person triangle-ruler bed floorplan google google snapchat snapchat upload close calendar guest edit dates guests rooms code search remove hotel map-view list-view video-play video-pause zoom-magnify chain-link alert height dimensions max-capacity star review-user trash tag circle-enlarge circle-video home printer Group home icon Sandman Hotels—A Family LegacyFounded by Bob Gaglardi in 1963, Sandman Hotel Group has deep roots in Canadian hospitality. With a $5000 loan and a bold vision, Bob established Northland Properties Incorporated with the intention of building hotels and restaurants where people could come together to experience exceptional customer service. Since opening our first hotel in Smithers, BC, in 1967, we have grown into a proud family-run business, now led by Bob’s son Tom. Today, you will find us across Canada–from St Johns to Vancouver–with over 60 hotels across Canada, the UK, Ireland, and the USA. Our BrandsAffordable Comfort or Premium Luxury—The Choice is Yours When you choose to stay at a Sandman Hotel, Inn, Suite, or premium Signature location, you’ll be greeted with true Canadian hospitality, comfort, style, and affordability. Sandman Hotels, Inns, & Suites are exactly where you need to be and offer incredible value for every traveller. In comparison, you can enjoy a premium experience by checking in to a Sandman Signature where spacious suites, upscale décor and enhanced amenities are yours to discover. Whether you’re travelling for business or pleasure, one thing’s for certain: you’ll always have a restful night’s sleep at a Sandman. Sandman Hotels, Inns & Suites Where it all began, Sandman Hotels, Inns, & Suites continue a proud legacy as one of Canada’s preferred accommodation providers. Discover Sandman Signature Hotels & Suites From modern interiors and upscale, spacious rooms to best-in-class amenities–our Signature properties are a class above. Discover New HotelsSandman Hotel Group is always excited to build, renovate and explore new cities. In addition to our newest Sandman Signature openings in Saskatoon, Sherwood Park, Ottawa, Plano-Frisco Texas, and Aberdeen UK, we are excited to announce three new Canadian hotels opening soon in Winnipeg, Markham, and Dartmouth. With the addition of these new hotels, you can be sure that Sandman is always the smart choice. Sandman Signature Sherwood Park Hotel Impeccable services and elevated design meet at Sandman Signature Sherwood Park Hotel. Each of the 229 spacious guest rooms features a 42-inch HDTV, complimentary Wi-Fi, and hi-tech design all while exuding modern style and timeless elegance. Upgrade to a suite for extra comfort and a separate living area whilst enjoying the surrounding restaurants and parks. Our sweeping range of amenities will take care of you, your pet, and your relaxing stay. View Property Sandman Signature Ottawa Airport Hotel With convenient access to Ottawa Macdonald–Cartier International Airport (YOW) along with the downtown business, entertainment, and shopping districts, Sandman Signature Ottawa Airport Hotel is bringing elegant, relaxed, comfort to Canada’s capital city. Offering 201 beautifully appointed guest rooms and suites, our vibrant, pet-friendly accommodations include flat-screen TVs, mini-bars, mini-fridges, microwaves, and comfortable beds that you will talk about for years. Whether visiting for business, pleasure, or a bit of both, stay connected with complimentary Wi-Fi, enjoy a meal at the on-site Chop Steakhouse & Bar, or sweat it out in the fitness centre. View Property Sandman Signature Winnipeg Airport Hotel & Suites Our new, 215-room hotel is located near Winnipeg International Airport. This pet-friendly hotel features an indoor pool and hot tub, water slide, state-of-the-art fitness centre, complimentary on-site parking, Café 1967, and Tavern on King Edward restaurant. Chop Steakhouse & Bar and Denny’s restaurant are also located a short walk away. There’s also 4519 square feet of meeting and event space complemented by free Wi-Fi throughout. Our new, 212-room hotel on Wilkinson Avenue is the latest addition to the Sandman Hotel Group chain. Within walking distance of the hotel, you’ll find Dartmouth Crossing, and Downtown Dartmouth is just 7km away. This pet-friendly hotel in Dartmouth features an indoor pool and hot tub, complimentary onsite parking, and a 24-hour Denny’s restaurant.
