name: Healthy Crunch
aboutContent: At Healthy Crunch, we believe eating whole real food makes you feel good inside and out! Proudly made in Canada with local ingredients Our mission is to innovate your favorite everyday foods, making them healthier and super delicious Meet Our Founder, Julie Hey! I’m Julie the Founder & CCO (Chief Crunching Officer) at Healthy Crunch. I have always been living a fast-paced life and fueled my days with snacking. The problem is, there was no healthy option to satisfy my craving for the crunch. As a Registered Dietitian and trained chef, I set out on a journey to to create good for you foods starting with kale chips, and evolving into our current product lineup including Kale Chips, Coconut Chips, Trail Mix, Granola Bars, Seed Butters, Instant Lattes and Chia Jams. When I’m not working at Healthy Crunch, you can find me cooking up a storm, collecting cook books, traveling the world and keeping active with the Crunch Pups. Thanks for learning more about my journey and I can’t wait for you to try some of our products! If you don’t know where to start, I have included some of my favs below. Happy Crunching! Julie BednarskiMHSc, PHEc, RD Let's Connect on Instagram Julie's Favourites!

name: Natures Path
aboutContent: 1985 Arran and Ratana Stephens open Nature's Path Organic Foods - a familly-run vegetarian food company. 1989 Nature's Path opens the first organic cereal manufacturing facility in North America. 1999 Nature's Path becomes North America's largest organic cereal manufacturer and opens the second manufacturing facility in Blaine, Washington. 2000 Nature's Path launches EnviroKidz, Optimum, hot cereals, and waffles. 2008 Nature's Path signs the Sustainable Food Trade Association's declaration of sustainability. 2011 Launch of Love Crunch granola! 2013 Nature's Path welcomes Que Pasa Mexican Foods to the family & launches the first Fair Trade Certified Toaster Pastries in the marketplace. 2017 Nature’s Path wins the Rabobank Leader in Sustainability Award & is recognized for having 100% of its manufacturing facilities certified by the Zero Waste Business Council. 2019 Nature's Path recognized as Good Food Business of the Year & receives a Sustainable Food Award for Sustainability Leadership.Arran Stephens receives Organic Pioneer Award from Rodale Institute. First organic brand to join Loop, a shipping platform which eliminates packaging waste. 2020 Introduces first Regenerative Organic Certified Oat product. Explore the Regenerative Organic difference. 2021 Nature's Path welcomes Anita's Organic Mill to the family. 2023 Nature's Path welcomes Love Child Organics to the family and expands portfolio to include organic baby food.

name: Ross Chocolates
aboutContent: About UsAbout Our ChocolateNo Sugar Added Chocolate At Ross Chocolates, we create premium No Sugar Added Chocolate for those with diabetes and others striving to eliminate sugars from their lives.Our chocolate has the smooth, rich taste of premium chocolate that chocolate lovers crave without added sugars that increase caloric intake and blood glucose levels. Sweetened with stevia and a touch of erythritol, our newest line of chocolate – with only 2.6 net carbs per bar – has virtually no impact on blood sugars and up to 17% fewer calories than chocolate sweetened with sugar. Our legacy maltitol line has been made for 25 years and continues to be a favorite of many of our customers. This chocolate for diabetics is very popular as it is suitable for both Type 1 and Type 2 diabetics, those on keto and low-carb diets, and, of course, those wanting to eliminate sugars from their diets.Try each of our bars — or a pouch of our minis — to discover how good No Sugar Added chocolate can be.Ross Chocolates — Quit Sugar, Not Chocolate! Shop NowOur Social ResponsibilityCommitment to Diabetes ResearchRoss Chocolates has always supported the diabetes community in many ways, including sponsorship of JDRF and Diabetes Canada events and research and committing a portion of each sale to diabetes research. In the area of research, we also participated in a study with the University of British Columbia in 2021 in which our dark chocolate was given to diabetics (T1D and T2D) to determine if it had any effect on blood sugar levels. We are happy to report that our dark chocolate flavors do not affect blood sugar levels to any noticeable degree.In addition, during 2021, we started supporting our cocoa farmers through Cocoa Horizons, an organization that works with Cocoa farmers in remote equatorial locations to ensure sustainable and profitable operations, so their farms and communities thrive.Finally, in recent years, we have expanded our community support to many local, small, non-profit organizations by supplying chocolate gifts and baskets for fund-raising events. Our Company HistoryHow Ross Chocolates Was Born In 1995, our founder, Bob Ross – a chocolate lover for years – was diagnosed with Type 2 diabetes. Although he now had to avoid eating sugars, Bob was determined to continue enjoying chocolate: Bob set out to create premium chocolate without any added sugar- and with that the perfect chocolate for diabetics.Based in his home in Scotch Creek, BC, Bob worked to find the perfect combination of cocoa beans, cocoa butter, and diabetes-safe sweeteners to make great tasting diabetes-friendly milk and dark chocolate. In 1998, Ross Chocolates began marketing No Sugar Added Chocolate bars for diabetics and others wishing to eliminate sugars from their diet.Ross Chocolates quickly became popular and we ship millions of bars across North America and the world. For 17 years, Bob continued to create new flavour combinations, eventually having 9 flavours of maltitol-sweetened chocolate bars.In 2015, Bob Ross reluctantly retired from chocolate making and Ross Chocolates was bought by a group of chocolate lovers who moved the production facility from Scotch Creek to a larger facility in Port Coquitlam, BC. Ross Chocolates has grown from a small chocolate operation in Bob’s kitchen into one of North America’s leading makers of No Sugar Added chocolate.Today, Ross Chocolates continues creating the wonderful chocolate that Bob Ross always made. We have also created a new stevia-sweetened line of chocolate to create new offerings that are even easier on blood sugar levels than our original bars. In the true spirit of our founder, we continue to develop new No Sugar Added chocolate treats for those striving to eliminate sugar from their lives.Ross Chocolates — Quit Sugar, Not Chocolate! Although he now had to avoid eating sugars, Bob was determined to continue enjoying chocolate: Bob set out to create premium chocolate without any added sugar.Based in his home in Scotch Creek, BC, Bob worked to find the perfect combination of cocoa beans, cocoa butter, and diabetes-safe sweeteners to make great tasting diabetes-friendly milk and dark chocolate. In the true spirit of our founder, we continue to develop new No Sugar Added chocolate treats for those striving to eliminate sugar from their lives.Ross Chocolates — Quit Sugar, Not Chocolate!RecipesSign up for Sales & PromosnewsFollow Us on Instagram @Ross_Chocolates

name: Its Skinny Pasta
aboutContent: The Beginning A diet scare. Inflammation. Gut sensitivities. Combined with a love for food, Italian heritage and a Michelin-star chef, lead to the creation of our konjac noodles. Bryan A true New York Italian with a passion for healthy food – less carbs, no unhealthy vegetable oils, or inorganic and artificial ingredients. Bryan set out to create food that brings joy to the table for every body. Elad A classically trained chef, who started his career at a 3-star Michelin restaurant in Italy. Elad ensures everything meets to his exacting taste. Keto-Friendly Great taste Healthy Vegan Low Calorie Gluten & carb free Keto-Friendly Great taste Healthy Vegan Low Calorie Gluten & carb free Keto-Friendly Great taste Healthy Vegan Low Calorie Gluten & carb free Keto-Friendly Great taste Healthy Vegan Low Calorie Gluten & carb free Our Simple Difference An Ancient Root Vegetable High Fiber Slows Sugar Absorption Gut-Friendly Simple Ingredients that Bring Joy Keto Paleo All the Good, None of the Bad Non-GMO Glycophate-Free Gluten Free Why We Act on Plastic Our vision is world where food is a source of joy for every body. There is no joy in the plastic islands drifting across our endless, cerulean oceans, choking the flora and fauna and ultimately landing on someone’s shores. Which is why we are partnering with CleanHub to tackle plastic pollution in our oceans. By supporting plastic recovery in coastal communities, we’re helping to create a cleaner, healthier and more joy-filled planet.

name: Macro Foods
aboutContent: $0.00 Timer to Cutoff 2 day, 07 h 11 m 12 s Who We Are Macro Foods is in the business of making high quality chef prepared ready-to-eat fresh meals. Founded in 2015 our goal is to help change the way people think about food and reinforce healthy habits for better living. By taking farm fresh ingredients and perfect portion sizes we strive to fuel bodies to get the most out of every single day. We start back at the basics by forgetting about processed and manufactured foods and bring back simple home cooking. Our belief is simple - good food starts from the roots up. We are proud to be apart of so many healthy living success stories which in turn has allowed us to create our own success story. We now have 8 retail locations across Ontario. Our fresh prepared meals are stocked every day for grab and go meals and are vacuum sealed to stay fresh for 7-10 days. With over 50 different menu options and monthly features there is a huge variety of meals to choose from. We also sell shakes, supplements, and healthy snacks to complete a healthy lifestyle. Not able to stop by? We deliver fresh foods across Ontario direct to your doorstep as well. Clients can order online at www.macrofoods.ca and select from our regular meal options or even build their own meals to fit their nutritional goals. We have packages and subscriptions that offer additional savings available online as well. We are proud to be one of Ontario's fastest growing fresh meal preparation services. Our promise is to continue to use our growth, innovation, and forward thinking strategies to continue to be the best at what we do. name: Ode
aboutContent: The beautiful journey of ÔDE started in 2015 in a small studio in Amsterdam, The Netherlands. In 2020, the label relocated in Vancouver, Canada. Each piece has been consciously thought, designed and crafted. Comfort, aesthetic, protection and sustainability are the main priorities. Regarding fabrics: all laces come from France, more precisely from family lace makers in Calais-Caudry or Lyon. They have a real know-how and this for centuries. The quality and the fineness of the lace is one of the highest and it can last years. ÔDE wants to guarantee a non-harmful garment, so all the materials are certified Oeko-Tex. It is a label that guaranties non-harmful substances. And last but not least, production: All our pieces are proudly crafted in British Columbia, Canada. We cut and sew everything in our studio for capsule collections or we work with local atelier when the collections are bigger. name: Understance
aboutContent: Who We AreUnderstance is a solution-oriented lingerie company based in Vancouver, BC. Our mission is to empower people to discover the transformative power of comfort and support.Our PeopleUnderstance is a Canadian company based in British Columbia, Canada. Our team is proud to be made up of over 68 employees from 21 countries. About 85% POC, 85% of our leadership positions are occupied by women.Our CommitmentAt Understance, our goal isn't just to sell as many bras as possible—we want to make a difference in your comfort, confidence, and sense of self. We pledge to be honest—no photoshopped models, no fictitious pricing. What you see is what you get.Thoughtful DesignWe don't claim to have re-invented the bra. The bra industry doesn't need a revolution but reform is overdue. With thoughtful design and updated materials, an expertly-made bra can be comfortable, flattering, and attractive. If you've tried our products, you know we infuse every detail with the utmost care.Our ValuesOur ValuesBra EducationWe are committed to providing you with all the resources you need so that you can make the best decision for your shape.Ethical ManufacturingWhen you shop with us, you can take comfort in knowing that the people who made your products are treated well.Sustainable PracticeWe use 50% less wastewater, 100% recycled tags and packaging and we'll always choose recycled fabrics wherever we can.PhilanthropyWe are first & foremost a customer-focused company, but, we are also dedicated to giving back to our local community.Our FactoriesOur products are made by an award-winning factory with a focus on sustainable practices based in Ganzhou, China. It is primarily powered by solar energy with a two-tier water conservation system. Seamstresses and technicians are paid 20% above the regional average, enjoy paid time off, and work in a safety-first environment.So, what's next?Enough about us, now it's about you! Here are some options to get you started on your journey to comfort!

name: Cureus Label
aboutContent: Curious about us?Cureus Label is a luxury lingerie and intimates brand founded by mother-daughter duo, Nataly and Pilar Cure. The brand name merges the Cure family name, with the spirit of curiosity that inspires every item in our limited-edition collections. Influenced by their experiences as two generations of Latina women who confronted the stigma around embracing their sensuality and bodies, Cureus Label is committed to empowering women with confidence and authenticity, while challenging traditional norms in intimates.Cureus offers modern, non-traditional, and most importantly comfortable intimates that have no underwire ever. Designed in Toronto and ethically handmade in Colombia, all pieces are thoughtfully crafted to feel as good as they look.Signature silhouettes are offered in two high-quality, breathable materials to take you seamlessly from day to night: an ultra-soft cotton line for everyday wear and lounging, and a barely-there nylon mesh that feels like a second skin.Say goodbye to intimidating lingerie, and welcome intimates you’ll want to get curious in.

aboutContent: Skip to content Follow Us: Instagram TikTok Facebook Pinterest YouTube FREE SHIPPING ON ORDERS OVER $80 CADSUBSCRIBE + SAVELIFE-CHANGING UNDERWEARWE'RE A CANADIAN COMPANY 🇨🇦 About Us Meet the FoundersDevon + Lang was founded by Tyler and Dayna McCombs in 2019 in Calgary, AB, Canada.Tired of constantly buying "premium" boxers that did not provide the support or comfort that Tyler was looking for, he and Dayna set out to create some truly life-changing underwear.They had a goal to create underwear that was built to support you all day, didn't chafe or ride up as you went through your day, used the newest technologies, and built with environmentally sustainable fabrics.After working for over a year with world-class apparel designers and garment manufacturers, the first Devon + Lang men's boxers, under the original brand name of OKE Apparel, arrived August 2019.From there, we've launch a women's line, our LOVED. line, and life-changing bodysuits as well. Explore Our Products We Make Life Changing UnderwearFrom your first pair of D+L underwear, your life and daily comfort, will change forever! And it doesn’t end there...With every purchase made we donate underwear to organizations who support those in vulnerable communities across Canada. We have set a goal to donate over 500,000 pairs of underwear in the next 10 years.We believe that new, clean underwear is a basic human necessity. The simple gift of clean underwear provides an opportunity for self-care, health, and well-being. Learn More OUR GIVING PARTNERS Reducing Our Impact On The EnvironmentHow can we change the lives of future generations?By making our products out of sustainable materials.Nearly all of our products are made out of modal, which is a top rated eco-friendly fabric. Modal feels amazing to wear, and also uses 20x less water than cotton to make the same amount of fabric.Plus, we design our garments to last longer than your other pairs. Saving you money, and Mother Nature too. Why are we called Devon + Lang? What makes our underwear special? Careers View our current openings here. name: Fizz Mobile
aboutContent: About Fizz | Mobile services at their best. A fresh take on mobile services. Fizz is a different kind of mobile provider that was launched in 2018 by Videotron, a long-standing company that’s been partnering with other major telecom companies for over 60 years, working to offer a reliable mobile network across Canada. Testimonials and awards What we’re all about The Fizz difference Where to find us The idea behind Fizz is to shake up the Canadian telecom industry by doing things differently. With our 100% online business model, members are in the driver’s seat with direct access to their account to subscribe, modify their plan, redeem rewards, refer friends and more, whenever they want. No one to ask permission to, no time wasted. Easy-peasy. Plus, we’re a really nice bunch. Love all around. Our members rave about what sets Fizz apart, and we’ve racked up some pretty neat awards over the years. Affordable Carrier – Fizz I’ve been using Fizz Mobile for over a year now. I live in the GTA and have never experienced any network issues. US roaming is quite impressive, with no network blackouts. Using Fizz is fun—it offers data rollover, data gifting, perks, rewards, and unlimited referrals. Whenever the network signal is weak, it automatically switches to one of the big three carriers. I haven’t experienced any dropped calls. It’s easy to change your plan month to month, and you can choose only the features you want. While other networks also offer affordable plans, Fizz stands out for its flexibility. Suree, 2025-05-06 Best Supplier I have been subscribed to Fizz for almost a year, and I’m very happy to have chosen this mobile provider. The price of my mobile plan is very reasonable and comes with several benefits, such as accumulating points, and the ability to transfer or donate them to friends or to someone who needs more. I recommend Fizz. Clavet, 2025-01-08 @Léger WOW Fizz #1 in two categories Best online experience since 2020 The best online experience of any Canadian telecom provider. 2025 Best online loyalty experience The best online loyalty experience across all business sectors for 2025. @PlanHub Great distinctions received Best overall mobile provider Best mobile digital experience Best mobile welcoming experience Fair and transparent billing award Best Internet digital experience Our community is at the heart of what we do, and how we do it. Connecting our members all the while nurturing a fair, simple and intelligent experience pretty much sums up our mission. The price of your plan is important. We get that. But being a Fizz member is much more than getting a good deal. It’s about being part of a community that’s not afraid to challenge the status quo, to do things differently and, above all, to help one another. And you can’t put a price on that. As locals, we encourage local Fizz invests in local events and negotiates discounts for its members to facilitate authentic interactions within the community. Data gifting Fizz encourages members to gift mobile data to one another. If one runs out, the Fizz community will step in to help. No limit to $$$ bonuses Members are encouraged to share their referral code as much as they want, and receive the corresponding bonuses, to welcome new members within the community. A close-knit community Fizz members are renowned for their willingness to help one another, like on the forum where everyone swaps tricks and advice. The Fizz difference. Why follow others when you can do different, and better? Fizz members enjoy game-changing advantages and benefits, plus tremendous flexibility so they only pay for what they really need, month after month. See the benefits 7/7 is our thing. While Fizz doesn’t have stores or even a phone number, that doesn’t mean we’re very far. That’s the beauty of being 100% online. Follow us Check Instagram for contests and events. Keep an eye on Tiktok for fun stuff. Visit Facebook to catch up on our latest news. Get help Our FAQ offers help steps for common issues. If you’re stuck, chat with our Customer Service team. Swing by our forum to swap tips and advice with other members. You’ve got questions. We have answers. Is Fizz owned by Videotron? Yes, Fizz is a Canadian telecommunication provider that was launched in 2018 by Videotron, a Quebecor company operating in the telecom industry since 1964. What are Fizz’s main milestones? 2017 – The Fizz brand is created. November 2018 – Fizz official launches its mobile services in Quebec. March 2019 – Home Internet service is added to Fizz’s service offers. October 2020 – Fizz now sells cell phones. April 2024 – Canadian expansion of Fizz mobile services. February 2025 – Fizz TV is officially launched. Does the Fizz network offer good coverage? Fizz uses the infrastructure of Videotron and Freedom and has agreements with other mobile providers to provide mobile services that cover 99% of the Canadian population. Mobile services are available in Quebec, Ontario, Manitoba, Alberta and British Columbia. Thanks to agreements with providers south of the border, members can choose the CAN+USA coverage and use their plan anywhere in Canada and the United States. What’s so great about Fizz? Fizz sets itself apart with the flexibility it offers its members to customize their plans and change them as their needs evolve. Plus, there’s no contract, so any plan or price on our website is up for grabs for new and existing members alike. Fair and simple. Will Fizz open physical stores? Fizz is 100% online. However, SIM cards are available from partner stores such as Couche-Tard, Jean Coutu and Circle K, as well as from vending machines in Montreal metro stations.

name: Leons
aboutContent: Skip to Main Content Warning Unsupported Browser Warning Leons.ca may not function properly on Internet Explorer. To get the best experience on our site, please update to a newer browser such as Chrome, Firefox, or Edge. Your Store: Find A Store Contact Us Flyer Sign In 0 Now Shipping to BC Means you Always Get the Best Price With a Dedicated Service Team Home About Us About Us Over 115 Years and GrowingFounded in 1909 by Ablan Leon, the A. Leon Company started out as a general merchandise store in the small town of Welland in Southern Ontario. Today Leon's is one of Canada's largest retailers, selling a wide range of merchandise including furniture, mattresses, major appliances and electronics. The company continues to be run by the Leon family and maintains the standards of service, integrity and dedication established by Ablan Leon over 115 years ago. Leon’s Furniture Limited is proud to employ over 10,000 associates within our network of corporate and franchise stores throughout Canada.Our HistoryCanada's GainAt the turn of the century, a young Ablan Leon left his native land to seek his fortune. After a few years of extensive travel throughout South America and the United States, he settled into the small town of Welland in Southern Ontario. The largest town on the Welland Canal was a busy and prosperous one with large ships passing through the canal, connecting Lake Erie and Lake Ontario.Mr. Leon began his career by selling clothing from a suitcase door-to-door. After saving enough of his hard-earned profit, he bought a small building in the working class area of town and The A. Leon Company was born in 1909. Merchandise such as pants, blankets, shoes, linens and other soft goods, were sold at a fair price to his growing list of customers. The Company quickly established its reputation for being honest, honourable and caring with special attention paid to standing behind the goods sold.A Helping HandIn the early 1900s, immigration levels were steadily rising and many of these new Canadians had difficulty obtaining credit of any kind. One particular policy that enabled the store's reputation to grow, was to provide credit to customers who were unable to receive it elsewhere. This endeared Mr. Leon to a growing number of loyal customers.Once he was on sure footing with his new venture, Mr. Leon went back to his native land to take a bride, Lena. Ablan brought Lena to Welland and they started their family of 11 children. It was evident to everyone who dealt with this family, that Christian ideals such as kindness, humility, and a general concern for others were deeply ingrained in their daily lives.As the children grew, they worked in the store dusting the furniture, sweeping the floors, or washing the front picture windows.The Accidental ShopperWhen Ablan's son was to be married, he decided to purchase the couple a mattress from a local department store. When the mattress was delivered, it was leaned against the store's outside wall. Soon after, someone came into the store wanting to buy it. Because it wouldn't be needed immediately by his son, Ablan added a few dollars to his cost and sold the mattress. Considering that most of his sales provided only pennies in profit, he was amazed how much could be made on larger items. The rest, they say, is history.A Family AffairWhen Ablan Leon died in 1942, the operation of his now thriving business became the responsibility of his children. Brothers and sisters worked diligently to continue the legacy left by their father. As sales grew, additions were put on the store to accommodate a bigger selection of merchandise.Eventually it became apparent that in order to grow even further, the business had to expand to other centres. Soon, stores began appearing throughout Southern Ontario, all bearing the Leon's name.The reputation of Leon's as an honest, reputable retailer who provided quality merchandise at low prices became more and more ingrained in the minds of customers.Expanding Across CanadaTaking on TorontoThe largest city in Canada provided great potential for further expansion. Rather than open their own stores, the family strategically decided to purchase the business of an existing retailer with a good reputation. They felt this was the best way to break into this highly competitive market in order to learn the intricacies of retail.After a few years of learning the ropes, Toronto stores were opened under the Leon's name. The family was fortunate to have associates in all their stores who were dedicated to the success of this growing organization, while it worked through many challenges. Leon's Toronto stores soon became synonymous with great values on a gigantic selection of brand name merchandise.Leon's Brings "Big Box" to CanadaIt became clear that to capitalize on Leon's growing presence, a new wave of expansion was logical. This would require a significant injection of capital. In 1969, Leon's Furniture went public and was listed on The Toronto Stock Exchange. The family retained the majority ownership of the shares while individuals as well as institutions, all well aware of the Company's growing reputation, snapped up the balance.In 1973, Leon's opened the first warehouse showroom in all of Canada. This massive 150,000- square-foot building was the first example of "big box" retailing in the country. For the first time ever, customers had access to a multi-million dollar inventory that prevented long delays in obtaining their purchase. This bold new retail initiative was promoted heavily on television through a series of commercials, including one that used a helicopter to show off the immense size of the store. The buying public accepted this radical new approach with open arms and the Company began erecting huge new showrooms across Canada.Leon's TodayLeon's TodayToday Leon's Furniture Limited has grown to become one of Canada's most highly respected retailers. Leon's consistent growth of sales and profit is the envy of other retailers across the land.Even with consistent growth, the Company has not lost sight of its beginnings or the reasons for its success. Leon's continues to sell high quality brand name furniture, appliances and electronics at guaranteed lowest prices. Leon's take great pride in its after sale service, and relies on the professionalism and support of thousands of associates across Canada. This team of associates is Leon's greatest asset.Leon's Furniture has become an integral part of Canadian homes. The Company remains committed to continued growth in sales and profits for the benefit of its shareholders, Company associates and customers.With multi-million dollar inventory levels, Leon's provides customers with almost instant delivery. Computerized systems and procedures are on the leading edge of retail technology.Leon's award-winning advertising provides our customers with all the information needed to make a thoughtful and satisfying purchase. The marketing department continues to be emulated by other retailers who attempt to recreate the same winning formula that has taken nearly a century to develop.Leon's thanks you for visiting our website today, and we look forward to serving you.Community SupportThe Leon’s Leaf Project is our commitment to help rebuild Canada’s forests devastated by record-breaking forest fires.Leon’s will plant 10,000 trees and provide customers the opportunity to donate seedlings starting from $5 which will be planted in partnership with Tree Canada. Plus, every seedling you donate will be matched by the Government of Canada.Join us in restoring our forests and providing future generations with a brighter and greener Canada. Learn more about the Leon's Leaf Project.Investor RelationsFor details please click here.

aboutContent: Left Discover our products Right Best Sellers New Arrivals Decor Household Heritage Craft Preservation This maker supports the preservation of heritage crafts and enables artisans to create sustainable livelihoods through their traditional skills. Natural Materials This maker crafts products that are derived from plants, animals, or other naturally occurring materials. Recycled Materials This maker prioritizes certified recycled materials over raw or virgin resources in the creation of its products. Circular Economy This company supports an economic system that minimizes waste and maximizes the function of each resource. Gender Advocacy This maker actively advocates for women and non-binary people by fostering equitable opportunities, promoting leadership development, and supporting initiatives that empower them to enhance their skills. Marginalized Communities This maker employs and supports individuals in communities facing economic, social, gender, or geographic barriers, providing access to essential resources, opportunities, and services.

name: Loulou Lollipop
aboutContent: The LouLou Lollipop journey Our Story Designed to Love. Born to Last. We know how precious those first few months and years are. Our safe, sustainable, and so sweet baby goods are made to last (and love). Designed with durability and functionality in mind, our products are tried and tested by parents like you. That means you can be confident they will hold up, no matter what life (or baby) throws at them. Our commitment to the highest safety and sustainability standards and family-first focus means you can feel good about everything you find here. How It All Began We got our start in 2015 with our first two designs, the original silicone Donut and Ice Cream Teethers that broke the mold for safety, durability, with a sweet aesthetic that fit seamlessly into our homes … but the fun was just getting started. We’ve continued expanding, but stayed committed to quality and accessibility. All of our products are ASTM, CPSC and CPSIA compliant, because every little one—and parent—deserves the best. Featured in Milestone Moments2015: Our Magical BeginningWe're fearless pioneers, always willing to try new things in pursuit of better, cuter, and safer products. We launched our first product out of our home office with help from our husbands. Milestone Moments2016: Out On Our OwnWe moved from an Etsy shop to our own website, attended our first trade show, started selling to boutiques, and expanded our offering to include our first muslin swaddles. Milestone Moments2017: We All Scream For Ice CreamWe launched our iconic Ice Cream Teether (a design that’s been copied many times), and moved into an office space of our very own. Yay! Milestone Moments2018: Growing TogetherWe moved into an even bigger office with a warehouse to keep up with exciting growth—and grew our staff to a team of 18. Milestone Moments2020-2021: Apparel & MoreWe perfected our first line of apparel, launched silicone tableware, and before we knew it, we had over 2,000 unique product offerings. (This called for a bigger office, warehouse, and team.) Milestone MomentsToday: Global LouLou LoveLoulou Lollipop is now available in 37 countries worldwide, and in over 1,100 boutiques in the United States and Canada. Where will you find us next? Milestone Moments 2015: Our Magical BeginningWe're fearless pioneers, always willing to try new things in pursuit of better, cuter, and safer products. We launched our first product out of our home office with help from our husbands. 2016: Out On Our OwnWe moved from an Etsy shop to our own website, attended our first trade show, started selling to boutiques, and expanded our offering to include our first muslin swaddles. 2017: We All Scream For Ice CreamWe launched our iconic Ice Cream Teether (a design that’s been copied many times), and moved into an office space of our very own. Yay! 2018: Growing TogetherWe moved into an even bigger office with a warehouse to keep up with exciting growth—and grew our staff to a team of 18. 2020-2021: Apparel & MoreWe perfected our first line of apparel, launched silicone tableware, and before we knew it, we had over 2,000 unique product offerings. (This called for a bigger office, warehouse, and team.) Today: Global LouLou LoveLoulou Lollipop is now available in 37 countries worldwide, and in over 1,100 boutiques in the United States and Canada. Where will you find us next? Family First A Note From Our Founders As twins ourselves, family is our reason for everything we do. At the end of the day, if our goods make you and your little ones happy, we’re happy. We hope what you find here helps you dream big, have fun, and make many more sweet memories.xo,Eleanor & Angel Learn More About Our Mission & Impact

name: Kewe Collective
aboutContent: About Us Our work is a result of the way we look at the world. We choose to live simply and choose quality over quantity. Family Owned & Operated Since 2015 We work closely with our team, prioritizing sustainable materials and processes to develop products that focus on craftsmanship to increase the integrity and lifespan of our fashion choices. Our time is spent carefully seeking and manufacturing products that fit a few simple criteria, they need to be durable, quality made with a simplistic & sustainable approach. When it comes to our brand partners, we support the love and energy put into a product by the creator. The products we carry are from people who share our vision of striving for more responsible consumerism and who care about the world in which we live in. 100% Canadian Owned Proudly Canadian owned & operated small business Peace of mind Consciously created and curated for you, baby and beyond Hassle free returns We're not happy if you're not happy! Return within 30 days for an exchange or refund, no questions asked. Awesome rewards 1 KEWE Cash point for every 1 Dollar spent. We will even start you off with 250 KEWE Cash points at signup! (That's equal to a $5 coupon) Learn more Why Choose Us? Trusted Pieces A focus on sustainable materials, ethical manufacturing and less-waste. We’re committed to doing better for our planet. Production We work closely with an amazing team of local home sewers and thoughtfully selected manufacturing companies within Canada and Overseas. We share in our ethically driven approach to manufacturing practices to produce small batch, quality pieces. We set minimum prices for products to ensure a sustainable income, to protect workers’ right and the environment. We support the development of thriving worker communities that have more control over their futures and we strive to protect the environment in which we all live and work. Materials All of our materials are OEKO-TEX 100 & GOTS (Global Organic Textile Standard) certified products. We chose these particular certifications due to their international standards, reliability and credibility. “I bought an outfit for my nephew who is on the way. Everything arrived perfectly. You can really tell these pieces are handmade and of the highest quality! The milk and cookies print is just the cutest!” - Katie S."I had the best experience purchasing from KEWE Clothing! I bought multiple pairs of the pocket leggings and had actually bought some of the simple leggings on sale in bigger sizes and when the package arrived they had upgraded us to the pocket leggings in the bigger size for no extra cost because they had sold out of the sale leggings! It was the best surprise!"- Katlyn K."Everything is so cute and the quality is amazing. Great customer service and my order arrived right on time. Will definitely shop again. Thank you!"- Alejandra OFFSETING YOUR EMISSIONS CARBON NEUTRAL DELIVERIESWe have partnered with Grassroots Carbon to offset carbon emissions on every order through regenerative agriculture.Regenerative agriculture mimics wild herd migration patterns through a process called adaptive multi-paddock grazing. Land managers use livestock, which include bison, cows, goats, and sheep, as tools in this process. These animals are rotated frequently through pastures, which gives the plants time to “rest” between grazing periods. By letting the plants rest, it keeps the animals from being able to graze on a single plant to the point of destruction.During these rest periods, plants return to full health. The restoration of these healthy plants ensures that the land remains covered with plant life, which ensures carbon capture and drawdown, but also promotes biodiversity, improved water retention, erosion mitigation, and supports wildlife. ONE TREE PLANTED FOR EVERY PRODUCT SOLD Restoring the planet together 3,500 TREES PLANTED Since starting this initiative, together we have planted nearly 3,500 trees!!Thank you for supporting our small business.You are making an impact. Gifting with KEWE? Allow us to make the unboxing experience extra special.Have your items gift wrapped today. Join us on instagram @kewecollective

name: Petits Genoux
aboutContent: Hi! I Am Kendra Francis, Founder and Creative Director of Petits Genoux. Petits Genoux began as a happy accident in between drop off and pick up at preschool, between another mom and I. A super stylish travel writer and myself, creating pieces for our #newprojects. In a few months we had a line and a few weeks later, an order and then voila, Petits Genoux was born. No plan, no bank account, no website, but we pulled it together and had an opening in our first vendors boutique and I was right back into the swing of things. A vast new, shiny space called Childrens Clothing was breathing a new vibrant energy into me. The entrepreneurial spirit is a bit of a phenomenon to some. They question the struggle, the inconsistencies, the highs and deep lows. Those are the things that keep me in it, it’s like survivor or the amazing race, non-stop and never ending. I am a creator, and and don’t think I will ever stop. I pride myself in the quality and integrity of my work and hope when it goes out into the world that it’s received that way because, it really is in my blood... I hope you these pieces bring you joy. Kendra ********** Petits Genoux / puh-tee . jUH-nu was created for the littlest ones in our lives. Eco-conscious, socially-conscious, and gender-neutral, Petits Genoux is great gifting for any child. ***************************************** An accomplished designer, creative director, stylist, and entertaining expert, Kendra began her multifaceted journey in fashion design. Her designs are characterized by impeccable craftsmanship and attention to detail. Her distinctive approach, rooted in simplicity and thoughtful execution, has now expanded to all facets of life and the art of living. Drawing inspiration from her Caribbean and African heritage, as well as her experiences travelling around the world, Francis infuses her designs with a fusion of global aesthetics for her 20-plus years in the industry she was honoured with a Black Designers of Canada award. Kendra has been featured in publications such as Vogue, Elle, Fashion, HELLO!, The New York Times, FASHION, House and Home, The Globe and Mail and many others.

name: 49Th Parallel Coffee Roasters
aboutContent: Our mission: Make Specialty Coffee Accessible to More People (In More Ways) by Crafting Exceptional Direct Trade Coffee, With Intention, that Inspires Curiosity. Based in Vancouver, British Columbia, 49th Parallel endeavours to sustainably source and craft exceptional coffee. We are a technologically advanced roastery with a science forward approach to the craft. We strive to collaborate with enthusiastic, satisfied customers while positively contributing to the health of local and global ecosystems. We do this through motivating, recognizing, and rewarding every part of the value network - viewing each of our partners as valued team members. From origin to our roaster, into cafés and kitchens, it is human togetherness in every part of the process that makes the coffee we represent possible. OUR VALUES We Create Exceptional Specialty Coffee & Customer Experiences We are Inclusive, Respectful, & Celebrate Teamwork We Aspire to Positively Impact Coffee & our World We are Curious & Adaptable We are all Aligned to our Mission & Committed to Bringing it to Life OUR ROASTERY Our state of the art roasting facility is a coffee professional's dream. We currently roast coffee on five different roasters of various sizes and engineering. We have carefully collected these tools over the years to highlight different roasting techniques and accentuate different flavour profiles. Roasting highlights the qualities inherent in the green coffee. Coffee is a drupe, a stone fruit and just like grapes for wine, there are thousands of different varieties growing in various regions around the world. No two coffees are the same and the potential for flavour complexity is immense. Our goal as a roaster is to work with individual varieties and express them in a delicious, balanced cup, showcasing each coffee’s unique qualities and characteristics. QUALITY CONTROL TEAM Our focus goes far beyond roasting and preparation, to the source of the raw material: the green coffee bean. Every coffee comes from a farm, and we want to provide the most direct link between our customers and that source. We want the tasting experience to be built around the knowledge of who grew the coffee, what variety, where on their farm, when it was harvested and how it got here. Our offerings reflect the seasonality of coffee. Our in-house coffee buyer travels directly to farms to evaluate and select coffees. At cupping labs both at origin and in our roastery in Burnaby, each lot is carefully tasted and graded. Because we are working with seasonal harvests, each lot is limited in availability, and thus as fresh as possible. Our coffee menu changes throughout the year and each coffee is presented at its peak of flavour.

name: Pilot Coffee Roasters
aboutContent: www.cookiebot.com Last update: September 12, 2025 Your privacy is important to us. This Privacy Policy covers what we collect and how we use, disclose, transfer and store your information. I. NAME OF THE PERSON RESPONSIBLE The person responsible within the meaning of the GDPR and other national data protection laws of the member states as well as other data protection regulations is the Usercentrics A/SHavnegade 391058 CopenhagenDenmarkPhone: + 45 50 333 777Email: mail@usercentrics.comCompany registration number DK34624607 You may submit inquiries regarding personal data protection, privacy and security matters to privacy@cookiebot.com. II. GENERAL INFORMATION ABOUT THE COLLECTION AND PROCESSING OF YOUR DATA 1. Scope of processingIn principle, we process personal data only insofar as this is necessary to provide a functioning website and our content and services. The processing of personal data takes place regularly only with consent. An exception applies to cases in which prior consent can not be obtained for reasons of fact and the processing of the data is permitted by law. 2. Legal basisThe processing of your data is either based on your consent or in case the processing is necessary for the performance of a contract to which you are a party, or in order to take steps at your request prior to entering into a contract, or based on legitimate interest, cf. GDPR art. 6(1)(a)-(b), (f).If the processing is based on your consent, you may at any time withdraw your consent by contacting us using the contact information in clause 1. 3. Storage and deletion of your dataIn principle, we only store personal data for as long as is necessary to fulfill contractual or legal obligations for which we collected the data. After that, we delete the data immediately, unless we still need the data until the expiry of the statutory limitation period for evidence purposes for claims under civil law or due to statutory retention obligations.We delete or block the personal data of the data subject as soon as the purpose of the storage is fulfilled. It may also be stored if provided for by the European or national legislator in EU regulations, laws or regulations to which our company is subject (see details in sections 3.1-3.3). Blocking or deletion of the data also takes place when a storage period prescribed by the standards mentioned expires, unless there is a need for further storage of the data for conclusion of a contract or fulfillment of the contract. 3.1. Data Retention PolicyDue to tax regulations, Account Data will be retained for up to five full fiscal years from your cancellation of your Cookiebot CMP account. Configuration Data and System Generated Data will be erased immediately when you cancel the Cookiebot CMP account. End User Data will be erased on an ongoing basis after 12 months from registration, and immediately when you cancel the Cookiebot CMP account. 3.2 Data Retention for Compliance with Legal Requirements You may not require Usercentrics to change any of the default retention periods, except for the reasons for erasure pursuant to clause 3.3, but you may suggest changes for compliance with specific sector laws and regulations. 3.3 Data Restitution and/or Deletion No data except Account Data will be retained after the termination of the Agreement. You may request a data copy before termination. You must not cancel the Cookiebot CMP account until the data copy has been delivered, as Usercentrics will not otherwise be able to deliver the data copy. III. PROVISION OF THE WEBSITE AND CREATION OF LOG FILES 1. Scope of data processing Usercentrics processes personal data only if this is necessary to provide a functioning website and our content and services. The processing of personal data takes place regularly only with consent. An exception applies to cases in which prior consent can not be obtained for reasons of fact and the processing of the data is permitted by law. Any of the information we collect from you may be used for one or more of the following purposes: 1.1. To personalize your experience (the information will help Usercentrics better respond to your individual needs); 1.2. To improve our website (Usercentrics continually strives to improve our website offerings based on the information and feedback we receive from you); 1.3. To establish a primary channel of communication with you; 1.4. To enable you to scan your website for trackers; 1.5. To enable you to talk to an expert. 2. Data processed 2.1 Each time our website is accessed, our system automatically collects data and information from the computer system of the calling computer. E.g. this is information like – Information about the type and version of your internet browser, – The operating system of your computer or smartphone, – Your internet service provider, – Your IP address, – Date and time of your access, - Geographic location, – Websites from which you came to us, – Websites that you visit from our site; We collect such technical information in so-called “log files”, so that you can display our website correctly and we can identify the causes of any technical problems, for the technical optimization of our websites and for the purpose of the security of our computer systems and networks. For these purposes, the legal basis is legitimate interest in the processing of data according to GDPR art. 6(1)(f). The data will be deleted as soon as it is no longer necessary for the purpose of its collection. Typically, this technical information will be erased or rendered unrecognizable at the latest after seven days. The collection of data for the provision of the website and the storage of the data in log files is essential for the operation of the website. 2.2 Each time you use our Service to scan your website, your email address will be processed and definitions of the cookies found when the Service has scanned your website(s), including reports on the result of each scan. IV. CONTACT REQUESTS FOR PRODUCT INFORMATION, A DEMO OR OTHER CONCERNS 1. Description and scope of data processing On our website you can contact us via various options: e.g. book a demo, request a quote, request product information, request guides, contact request form, support tickets and our chat function. If you make use of these options, the data entered in the input mask will be transmitted to us and saved. In addition to the specific input macro data, the IP address and the date and time of the request are collected and stored. Alternatively, a contact via email address is possible. In this case, your personal data transmitted by email will be stored. In this context, there will be no disclosure of the data to third parties, unless this is necessary for the processing of the query (for example, demo booking tool). In any case, the data will be used exclusively for processing the conversation, unless agreed upon otherwise. 2. Legal basis for processing Legal basis for the processing of the data is in general the consent of the user, GDPR art. 6(1)(a). 3. Purpose of the data processing The processing of personal data from the input mask is solely for the processing of your request. 4. Duration of storage If you have booked a demo, requested product information or an offer, we reserve the right to store the data for two years to measure the profitability of our sales and marketing. Otherwise, we will delete the data as soon as it is no longer necessary to achieve the purpose of its collection. For the personal data entered in the contact form and those sent by email, this is the case when the respective conversation with you has ended. The conversation is ended when it can be inferred from the circumstances that the relevant facts have been finally clarified. 5. Revoking consent and removal possibility You have the possibility at any time to revoke your consent to the processing of the personal data. If you contact us by email, you may object to the storage of your personal data at any time. In such a case, the conversation can not continue. All personal data stored in the course of contacting will be deleted in this case. V. WEBINARS Usercentrics offers from time to time webinars, to which you can sign up from our website. In these cases the data put in the sign-up form during the sign-up process will be used by Usercentrics for the purposes of the webinar and communication regarding the webinar and other relevant topics. If the webinar is organized together with a partner, then the data might be shared with them. The data is processed on the legal basis of consent, Art. 6 para. 1 s. 1 lit. a GDPR. You have the right to withdraw your consent to process your data at any time by contacting privacy@cookiebot.com. VI. NEWSLETTER When signing up for the Newsletter, data entered into the input mask will also be stored, in order to provide the Newsletter. The legal basis for this processing is GDPR art. 6(1)(a). Your email address, time of...

name: Bean Around The World
aboutContent: Our Story We’ve been around for a while, and that’s a good thing The Bean was born in an era when we still listened to cassettes in our cafés. More importantly, it was also the era of Vancouver’s “second-wave” coffee boom. West Coast coffee culture is thriving, but it’s also relatively new – since we opened our flagship store in West Vancouver during B.C.’s coffee awakening in the ‘90s, we like to think we’re among “the originals”. We’re about good people and good coffee Since the beginning, we sought out the best beans and the best people that the coffee industry had to offer. People seem to appreciate that, and we’ve been growing ever since. In 1994, we opened up our roastery, which allowed us to provide that iconic Bean Around the World taste to an increasing number of shops. We’ve now got 23 locations around the Lower Mainland and a bounty of loyal coffee subscribers who get their beans by delivery.

name: Two Bears
aboutContent: Born to Be Ferocious Two friends. One a coffee roaster, the other a health nut. The story starts in Colombia, where we shook hands over a deal that would change everything. We weren’t just buying beans — we were aligning on a vision. To build something better. Something healthier. Something delicious.We founded Two Bears because we saw a gap in the market: high-quality, great-tasting drinks that actually do something for you. No added sugar. Real ingredients. Packed with protein. Convenient for real life.But more than that, we created Two Bears to prove that you don’t have to choose between health and taste. You can have both — and look good doing it.We’re proudly Canadian. Fueled by nature. Ferocious about crafting drinks that raise the bar.To us, “ferocious” means chasing what lights you up — whether it’s coffee, adventure, or building a life that makes you feel alive.So whatever you’re into, be bold. Be strong. Be ferocious.We’ve got the drinks to back you up. Joe, Co-founder: PRODUCT/CRAFT Not-so-average Joe. Family Man. A craftsman in the truest sense of the word. From brewing beer at home to making the perfect pizza, Joe’s unmatched passion and commitment to craft is Two Bears’ secret ingredient. Joe started a cafe a decade ago and brings his expert coffee knowledge to the craft of Two Bears. His days are filled with finding the best beans and tinkering with roasting, constantly innovating to bring you the best possible product. He truly puts his heart and then some into everything he does. Thanks for keeping us above average, Joe. David, Co-founder: BRAND/BUSINESS Our CEO and Co-founder David started Two Bears from the back of his van and has never looked back. His ambition, grit, ability to figure out any problem, and inability to take “no” for an answer moves our company forward. David is driven by self-improvement, meaningful connections, and a deep curiosity about the world — from road-tripping through Mexico to standing among 35,000 flamingos in Celestún. His spirit is truly what makes the Two Bears brand so special. He’s committed to helping others be the best they can be, and the way he conducts business is a complete reflection of that. From boxing, to learning Spanish, to making the perfect eggs, nothing David does is half-hearted – and we’re excited for our future because of it.

name: Dose Juice
aboutContent: Happy to serve your daily DOSE of wellness since 2013. Whether you choose a ginger shot filled with superfoods or super green juice, you're in good hands with our healthy products.Juggling with their busy schedule and their desire to consume more veggies, Gen & Raph first started juicing in their tiny Montreal Old-Port kitchen in 2013. Nowadays, the couple along with a bunch of cool humans work hard to offer you bottles of wellness. Feminism, a core value 1 It's featured in the employee manual and we ask every member of our team to share this value 2 We make sure we have at least 50% of women among our employees, directors and business partners 3 Our job postings(in French) are written in the feminine "by default" to attract women to come work with us 4 We support many feminist organizations by sponsoring events, participating in their projects and more Our products are certified organic Producing healthy products means choosing healthy methods. Here’s why we chose to create ORGANIC juices, shots, and smoothies. Wouldn’t it be counterproductive to offer you beverages that contain traces of pesticides and other chemicals like the ones used in traditional agriculture? Shop Now Ecocert Canada USDA organic Certification Kosher Locally produce All our products are proudly juiced in our Canada-based factory We also choose to work with local producers for most of our ingredients(we're still waiting for Canadian pineapples though...). Goodbye NEW plastic! Why not glass bottles?Did you know that glass bottles take 4,000 years or more before decomposing?!? So, reusing plastic again-and-again for single-use items such as juice bottle seems likethe best idea ever, no?At DOSE, it’s a tremendous step forward to reduce our environmental footprint.From now on, all our bottles will be entirely made up of PCR plastic (Post Consumer Resin). By using this eco-friendly material, no more NEW plastic will be created to manufacture our bottles. Cheers to greener green juices and a greener planet! Explore Products Cold-pressed, what does it mean? All ofour juices, smoothies and shots are cold-pressed, which means that they are not heated, notheat-pasteurized, nor chemically treated. By applying thousands of pounds of pressure, our cold-press juicer keeps all nutrients intact. Heat-pasteurized: what does it mean? Heat–pasteurization, no matter how “lovingly” or “gently” it is done, results in a juice that has been effectively heated(thus, cooked), killing essential vitamins, minerals, and live enzymes.We never, NEVER,apply heat on any of our products.

name: Revive Superfoods
aboutContent: GET 50% OFF YOUR FIRST BOX. USE CODE: REVIVE50 EAT BETTER LIVE BETTER “ I love smoothies but I hated the prep work. I’d get my smoothies from cafes near me but they were always packed with added sugar and unhealthy ingredients that left me feeling bloated and tired. So, my partners and I joined forces with a mission: to solve this smoothie dilemma for busy folks like me. Our solution? Frozen, pre-portioned smoothies that are not just tasty and packed with goodness, but also ready in seconds. NOUR KAISS, CO-FOUNDER + CMO “ Empowering people to build healthy eating habits Smoothies that are good for you and the environment Making healthy food accessible to everyone Always balancing taste and nutrition IT ALL STARTS FROM WITHIN What you put inside your body matters From the very beginning, our mission has centered around the profound impact of your food choices on your well-being and performance. That’s precisely why we’ve dedicated ourselves to crafting smoothies composed of the finest, vitamin-rich ingredients. Our goal is simple: to transform your life for the better with every sip. We don’t eat enough fruits & veggies According to the CDC, a mere one in ten individuals manages to meet the daily recommended intake of fruits and vegetables. At our core, we’re committed to making it effortless and convenient for you to embrace a broader spectrum of superfoods through our perfectly portioned smoothies. Frozen to lock in the good stuff Right from the start, our vision was crystal clear – we were going to craft our smoothies using frozen ingredients. Why the emphasis on frozen? Well, it all boils down to the supply chain. You see, the path that fresh produce takes from the farm to your table spans weeks, and during that time, fruits and veggies can lose over 30% of their nutritional goodness just three days after being harvested. By freezing produce right at the source, we lock in those essential nutrients and flavors, ensuring that every sip of our smoothies maximizes the benefits you reap from every delicious gulp. Building healthy habits with intention It all begins with your determination. When you set your mind to it, you take the first step toward cultivating healthier habits. Our goal is to help you maintain that consistency without the hassle of shopping, portioning, and prep work. We handle all of that so you can concentrate on what truly matters – a healthier, happier you. And it all starts with a sip of our nourishing smoothies. name: Wakewater
aboutContent: Share Link We recently shared some of the science behind sweat and electrolyte loss, highlighting the necessity and importance of replenishing key electrolytes (sodium, potassium, calcium, magnesium, chloride) after physical activity and exercise. Having a clear understanding of how we lose electrolytes was crucial when it came to formulating our own, and though we found that most electrolytes were lost through sweat, there was another contender: drinking alcohol. We had heard about the correlation between drinking alcohol and electrolyte loss before, but wondered how could we be losing electrolytes just by consuming a liquid? Is there any truth to the claims that electrolytes are a great hangover cure after a night of heavy drinking? The truth is, alcohol, regardless of its type, has a major impact on the absorption, elimination, efficacy, and concentration of essential electrolytes and minerals within the body. As a diuretic, alcohol consumption triggers diuresis, a condition characterized by increased urine output, and tricks our kidneys into flushing out water by blocking the release of natural hormones needed to control fluid and electrolyte levels. Generally speaking, the intensity of alcohols diuretic effect is largely determined by the strength of the alcohol consumed. This means that spirits with a higher alcohol content like vodka, whisky, and rum dehydrate us faster than drinks with a lower alcohol content like beer, coolers, and wine. However, drinks with a lower alcohol content tend to be consumed in greater volumes, and can quickly add up to have the same dehydrating effect that would occur when consuming a stronger alcohol. The more alcohol we consume, the more likely we are to experience its dehydrating effect, often being left with a headache, feeling tired, thirsty, nauseous, irritable, or in other words, hungover. Though hangovers may seem like an inevitable outcome of drinking alcohol, the truth is we can easily fight back by keeping ourselves hydrated before, during, and after consumption. A simple glass of water between each drink can go along way, but rarely provides enough hydration to fully counter alcohol effects. With WakeWater Electrolytes we wanted to change this, providing an electrolyte drink that can actually keep up with your electrolyte loss. With 800mg of sodium, 800mg of chloride, 400mg of potassium, 50mg of magnesium, and 50mg of calcium in each serving of WakeWater Electrolytes, you can say goodbye to hangovers and say hello to rapid rehydration! To learn more about WakeWater Electrolytes, visit the page below or send us an email to have any of your own questions answered! We’ve just introduced our newest WakeWater Electrolytes flavour, Blue Raspberry, and hope you enjoy it as much as we do! WakeWater Electrolytes - WakeWater Beverage Co Back to blog

name: Organika
aboutContent: About Us Home About Us Home About Us OUR HISTORY Firm believers in natural formulations. We started with a vision of making natural healing accessible to everyone and quickly became a proudly Canadian fan favourite. Everyone has the power to change their health and we’ve packaged the products that can journey you there. We’re committed to bringing you a variety of natural remedies and daily health supplements that provide long-lasting results and an enhanced sense of being. The Journey So Far 1980s A Remedy, A Revelation Our founder discovered the power of natural healing through their own homemade remedies and never looked back. 1990s–2000s Wellness in a Bottle From launching with just four products to earning a Good Manufacturing Practices certification before it was the norm, Organika set out to make wellness more accessible. We were first with melatonin, first with glucosamine and first to bring science-backed integrity to the supplement aisle. When new Health Canada rules emerged, we didn’t just adapt—we helped build the framework. Working alongside regulators, we shaped the NPN system and set the gold-standard regulations still used today. 2010s From Family Business to Fan Favourite Embracing the digital age, we launched some of our most well-known products including collagen and bone broth and introduced our natural wellness to a devoted fan following. Our small supplement business quickly became a trusted Canadian wellness partner and we’ve been growing ever since. 2020s Onward, Together From pandemic pivots to becoming Canada’s #1 in collagen, bone broth and spirulina, Organika has continued to innovate—introducing countless new products while staying true to our mission: helping people live healthier, every step of the way. 1980s A Remedy, A Revelation Our founder discovered the power of natural healing through their own homemade remedies and never looked back. 1990s–2000s Wellness in a Bottle From launching with just four products to earning a Good Manufacturing Practices certification before it was the norm, Organika set out to make wellness more accessible. We were first with melatonin, first with glucosamine and first to bring science-backed integrity to the supplement aisle. When new Health Canada rules emerged, we didn’t just adapt—we helped build the framework. Working alongside regulators, we shaped the NPN system and set the gold-standard regulations still used today. 2010s From Family Business to Fan Favourite Embracing the digital age, we launched some of our most well-known products including collagen and bone broth and introduced our natural wellness to a devoted fan following. Our small supplement business quickly became a trusted Canadian wellness partner and we’ve been growing ever since. 2020s Onward, Together From pandemic pivots to becoming Canada’s #1 in collagen, bone broth and spirulina, Organika has continued to innovate—introducing countless new products while staying true to our mission: helping people live healthier, every step of the way. MADE IN CANADA Made here. Trusted everywhere. Proudly made in Canada for over 35 years, our products are crafted with care and backed by rigorous testing—from raw ingredient screening to final product verification. We follow world-class Health Canada guidelines for safety, purity and potency, so what ends up in your hands is something we’ve taken ourselves and approved. That’s why we’re trusted coast to coast—for products that are clean, consistent and do what they say. Did you know? Canada’s Top Collagen Pick Organika’s Enhanced Collagen is the #1 collagen powder in Canada. Certified Before it Was Cool We were one of the first natural health companies in Canada to get Good Manufacturing Practices certified—10 years before it was even required by Health Canada—because quality and doing things the right way have always been part of our DNA. From British Columbia, With Love Organika’s proudly Canadian roots have gone global. You’ll find us in 20+ countries across North America, Asia and Europe—with more on the way. OUR MISSION Healthy doesn’t have to be hard. Our mission is simple: make wellness less confusing, more accessible and actually effective. We believe everyone deserves to feel their best—whether they’re new to supplements or swear by collagen. That’s why we make products that are clean, purposeful and backed by science. This is wellness that works for you—not the other way around. POSITIVE SOCIAL IMPACT CarbonNeutral® Certified: Year Two & Beyond We’re proud to celebrate our second year as a CarbonNeutral® certified company. To achieve carbon neutrality, we partner with carefully selected carbon reduction projects around the world—such as reforestation in Brazil, water filtration in Guatemala and forest protection here in Canada. These initiatives help reduce carbon emissions while also supporting the well-being of local communities. Our priority remains on helping people live healthier lives, in everything we do. That’s why we invest in projects that not only benefit the environment but also create positive social impact. CANADIAN IMPACT & PARTNERSHIPS Thriving, together. Wellness goes beyond the individual. When people thrive, communities thrive. That’s why giving back is core to who we are. Our Scholarship Program opens doors to health education, and with partners like BC Children’s Hospital, Backpack Buddies and Mamas for Mamas, we’re investing in a healthier future for everyone. Organika is proud to be the official hydration partner for Athletics Canada. This partnership isn't just about competition; it's about pushing boundaries, fuelling dreams, and celebrating excellence. WHY ORGANIKA Not your average wellness brand. We Turn Real Ingredients Into Real Results We skip the fads and get straight to the facts. Every Organika product is rooted in science, rigorously tested and formulated to actually do what it says. No nasties. No fluff. Just wellness that works. We Make Health Simple You don’t need a lab coat to understand our formulas. Whether you’re collagen-curious or an adaptogen devotee, our products are designed to be clear, effective and easy to use. We Care At Our Core From the very beginning, Organika has been committed to doing things the right way, putting people first. We don’t just talk the talk—we live it. From backing local charities to looking after our own team with real support, we show up every day with intention. name: Jamieson Vitamins
aboutContent: Jamieson Here For Your Health Since 1922 A lot has changed since 1922. In order to continue to provide consumers with the natural health solutions they need, we understand the importance of looking ahead, and leading the evolution of natural health.As a company, our shared Vision, Mission and Values are the guiding principles that ensure we continue to exceed the expectations of all stakeholders – our valued employees, our ingredient suppliers, our retail partners, and, most importantly, the Jamieson consumers who trust us to help them improve their health and wellness. Our Vision Our vision is to improve the world's health and wellness. Our Mission Grow our trusted brands based on quality and innovation. Over time, combine organic brand growth and future acquisitions to become the world’s most successful and trusted health and wellness Company. Our Values Our values are our guiding principles as to how we want to conduct ourselves and the behaviours we value as an organization: Accountability, Respect, Agility, and Excellence Previous slide Next slide 1 / 1 Our Products Jamieson is proud to offer a variety of natural health products for the entire family, including:Vitamins and mineralsHealth supplements including omega-3sDigestive health products and natural sleep aidsPrenatal vitamins & vitamins for childrenHerbal extracts and botanical solutionsNatural beauty and skin care products Relentless Pursuit of Perfection Our products have a worldwide reputation for purity and potency. Our 360 Quality Promise is our industry-leading commitment to quality. Through this commitment, we promise:Ethically sourced, pure & authentic ingredientsReliable and active formula potencyProduct safety and purityEffective products you can TRUST Our Quality Standards A History of Innovation A pioneer in natural health products, Jamieson leads product innovation in Canada. Our company holds an impressive list of “firsts” for both formulas and delivery systems:The first mega-potency vitaminsA family of shelf-stable, gastro-protected probioticsThe smallest and most potent calcium mini-tabletThe first one-a-day joint care supplement in Canada, proven to provide relief within 7-10 daysIn 2004, Jamieson helped establish the Natural and Non-Prescription Health Products Directorate (NNHPD). The NNHPD is the regulating authority for natural health products in Canada, and representatives from Jamieson continue to work closely with them on the development of policies to ensure Canadian natural health products are safe, effective and of high quality. Environmental Leadership At Jamieson, our dedication to improving the world's health & wellness naturally extends to our environment. Our environmental initiatives ensure that we:1. Meet all domestic and international environmental regulations and, to the extent practical, implement initiatives that exceed government requirements2. Consider the impact of new products, packaging, technologies and operational procedures on the environment3. Encourage conservation internally and externally through our business partners, suppliers and customer relationships A Global Brand From our offices in Canada, Jamieson touches the lives of consumers around the world. Our products are distributed in more than 45 countries, and we are committed to growth and new opportunities for distribution, acquisition and strategic alliance. A truly multinational, multi-local corporation, Jamieson offers a wealth of international knowledge and regional expertise to serve its customers.For a full list of countries where Jamieson products are sold, click here.If you are a distributor interested in export opportunities, click here to contact a Jamieson Worldwide Representative. name: Ilook Glasses
aboutContent: Why are eyeglasses SO expensive? The short answer is, monopoly. The giant in the industry dictates markup and pricing, operates many optical chain stores and supplies the independents. If you've worn glasses for years, chances are, you have purchased one of the brands (Rayban, Prada, Oakley) or shopped at one of its retailers (Lenscrafters, Sunglass Hut, Clearly, Eyebuydirect ....). We believe that we can do better than that. We can offer options. Real options. In 2012, we launched iLookGlasses.ca with one goal in mind: bringing premium-quality eyewear directly to Canadian consumers at accessible prices. How? We do so by cutting out the middleman and sourcing directly from independent frame & lens manufacturers. We do not run costly TV advertising campaigns or high-profile sponsorship programs. We do not have high overhead costs associated with running brick-and-mortar stores. By maintaining a lean and mean operation, we are able to offer competitive pricing and pass the savings directly onto our customers. What about quality? We uphold consistency in quality by developing and maintaining long-term partnerships with our suppliers. We stand behind our products with a one-year warranty program. We are confident that our customers will be happy with their purchases and come back to us when they look for their next pair of glasses. How about style? Do I get more style with designer frames? Well, don't take our words for it and have a look for yourself! We offer a wide variety of styles, from classic, everyday, retro to high fashion. Instead of having one pair of expensive designer glasses, you could own several pairs from iLookGlasses and have some fun switching things up. Everyone else will think that you paid much more than you actually did! Sounds good to you? We look forward to hearing from you! Your Stories I am very impressed with this company. I just received my three pairs of glasses and I was so nervous. This is the first time I ordered prescription glasses on line. I ordered prescription sunglasses and regular sunglasses progressive transitions and absolutely love them! I even love the free pair of aviator sunglasses I received. I cannot be any happier with this company right down to their chat line. I will definitely be ordering again. Sandra Victoria, British Columbia click HERE to view more testimonials

name: Maguire Shoes
aboutContent: Sisters Myriam and Romy are the founders of Maguire, an independent, direct-to-consumer fashion footwear company. With no connections in the fashion industry, Myriam and Romy’s entrepreneurial journey was propelled by sheer determination and grit. It all started with a desire to make high-quality shoes accessible for more people: “Everywhere we shopped, it was always a choice between quality or affordability,” the sisters recall. “I worked in fast fashion [as a designer for white-label brands],” says Myriam, President and Lead Designer. “I saw the way things were done: there are a lot of middle-men in the industry, driving up margins. I thought there could be a way to offer better products at better prices.” Myriam was always interested in footwear design, having obtained a Footwear Diploma at the prestigious Cordwainer’s College in London. Before founding Maguire, she would work at United Colours of Benetton in Treviso, Pajar and the Aldo Group in Montréal, and design for dozens of white-label clients including Opening Ceremony, Target, and Kohls. Romy, for her part, is no stranger to the world, having lived in Vancouver, Paris, and Sydney. A communications major with diverse interests, she worked with creative agencies and film festivals before joining her sister in the venture. As head of Operations and Marketing at Maguire, she brings a multidisciplinary approach and a fresh perspective to an age-old industry. The duo launched Maguire online in 2017 with a single product and $15k. Only five years later, Maguire has more than twenty employees and is incorporated in two countries with stores in Montréal, Toronto, and New York City. They have been featured in Forbes, WWD, Elle, and Bazaar, and won the Emerging Talent Award for Accessories at the Canadian Fashion Awards in 2022. Still proudly independent, Myriam and her sister Romy continue to grow their mission to bring transparency, quality and fair prices to women’s footwear. More news Maguire Shoes Careers - Read the article Jobs Maguire Shoes Careers August 8, 2021 Stores - Read the article Stores July 22, 2021
