name: Awake Chocolate
aboutContent: Gather ‘round friends, and hear the tale of how Awake was hatched. From the founders We’re big believers in taking the road less traveled. You must be, if you’re planning to shake up a market where the biggest brands are literally 100 years old! And that’s what we decided to do.It started in 2010 while working for PepsiCo (great company), when we saw an opportunity to solve a problem. You see, it turns out that a lot of people are looking for a pick-me-up to help them get through the day. But many don’t want to drink more coffee and refuse to try energy drinks. Why? Because they don’t like the taste. Bad taste is no fun. We thought, why not make a chocolate to deliver that pick-me-up? After all, chocolate tastes great, and great taste is fun. And why shouldn’t chocolate do more for you than just taste great? So we created AWAKE, the first functional chocolate brand. We even pitched successfully on Dragon’s Den (the Canadian Shark Tank). We risked everything and left corporate life to chase our shared dream. Truthfully, the road has been long and difficult – COVID nearly sunk our business. That hurt, a lot. But passion and optimism are a powerful combination, so we persevered and now, with the help of our amazing team (the best in the business), our brand is thriving. We’re a decade in, and things are really starting to happen!Adam, Dan & Matt Guiding Beliefs Taste is our north star We’re the only functional snack delivering on physical and emotional needs – because we put taste first. Obsess over ingredients Good enough is not part of our vocabulary. We believe that less is more, so we stick to simple ingredients that are truly delicious. Do what’s right We believe you’re never wrong to do the right thing. So, we insist on giving back to our customers, FAIR pay for our suppliers, and making responsible choices throughout our supply chain. Have fun We believe that mood matters and that smiles are contagious… so we do our level best to make our customers smile everyday. Wayne Gretzky Snowmobiling Peanut Butter Canadian, eh? Fun loving (and exceedingly polite), we’re proud to count AWAKE among the list of pretty great things to come out of the great white north. The Paint Roller Caffeinated Chocolate Austin Powers Owls don’t compromise. And neither should you. Fairtrade Certified Gluten Free Non GMO Verified 50 Mg Caffeine No Artificial Colors or Flavors 70 calories or less Dark Chocolate Bites Caramel Chocolate Bites Peanut Butter Chocolate Bites Mint Dark Chocolate Bites Milk Chocolate Bites Dark Chocolate Bites Caramel Chocolate Bites Peanut Butter Chocolate Bites Mint Dark Chocolate Bites Milk Chocolate Bites Dark Chocolate Bites Caramel Chocolate Bites Peanut Butter Chocolate Bites Mint Dark Chocolate Bites Adventures in awakeness Q&A with our founders AWAKE was founded in 2012 by Adam Deremo, Matt Schnarr and Dan Tzotzis. Take a look at the inside... Read more Own The Night with Britt, Rosemary & Monique Hear from three incredible nurses who are AWAKE & owning the night! name: Magic Oats
aboutContent: HEY, WE'RE MAGIC OATS!A women led Canadian business changing the way you think about oat milk Just add water and shake to enjoy fresh delicious oat milk in seconds. How awesome is that!? Plus our convenient, easy to use oat milk powders are less waste and travel friendly. We’re proud to use better for you ingredients that you can feel great about– make the switch and choose Magic Oats! FOUNDER STORYHello to all my oat milk lovers! My name is Lana. I am the creator of Magic Oats. As a child, I grew up strictly on soy milk. My mom was severely allergic to dairy so this was all I knew. As time passed, I developed a hormonal imbalance so I decided to dig deeper on making some changes. One day, I came home from a specialty store with yet another plant-based milk I spent way too much money on only to check the label and discover fillers, oils, added sugar and stabilizers that made my gut and taste buds cringe - cue trash toss and follow it up with inspiration! Fuelling my obsession with healthy plant based food products I knew I could offer something better made with nutritious functional ingredients, that offered convenience, was easy to use and tasted undeniably more delicious. My mission is to share the most delicious better for you oat milk without compromise. ​ Founder: Lana

name: Up North Naturals
aboutContent: Clean ingredients have always been our priority. Our formulations are not only filled with good products, they are also superstars for providing moisture and long lasting hold. Our Story Since 2015, Up North Naturals has grown from a small, kitchen-born passion project into a celebrated Canadian hair care brand – all because we believe no curl problem is too tough to fix.It started with one woman's journey: battling scalp irritation and damaged natural hair. In search of gentle, effective alternatives, she began carefully blending plant-based ingredients that would cleanse, hydrate, and revive curls — without harmful chemicals.Today, UNN’s proudly clean formulations work harmoniously across all textures — curly, coily, and kinky — to solve a range of challenges: from dryness and frizz to scalp concerns and style definition . We’ve made it our mission to deliver real results: clarify without stripping, nourish without greasing, define without crunch, and most importantly, restore confidence in every curl.Whether it's healing a flaky scalp, restoring moisture, or providing long-lasting style, UNN is here to support every individual’s Hair journey. For a decade and beyond, we’ve been the clean, inclusive brand that stands behind your curls—because every curl deserves care that understands its unique needs. WHERE TO FIND US IN STORES Our hair care products are available at select Target locations in the U.S. Walmart Canada in store and online, as well as independent salon and beauty supply shops across North America, UK and the Caribbean. To bring Up North Naturals into your salon or beauty supply outlet, contact us. See our retail locations See what people are saying about us! TESTIMONIALS Elisha Greene | NaturalFlow Salon Owner My passion is helping others love who they were created to be. As a salon owner and hairstylist, I don't make people beautiful - I just enhance what they already have and focus on who they are as an individual. I love working with curls and coils in natural hair. I've worked in the industry for 7 years using the best techniques and practices to help curly hair thrive and promote growth. The Up North Naturals hair care line is a great way to achieve hydrated and defined curls with all natural ingredients! Ella D. | Dartmouth, Nova Scotia OMG, thank you to Up North Naturals for doing my hair at an event last week! I know it was a section demo, but wow – I now have a new wash-and-go game! Monique A | Madison, Wisconsin Do yourself a favor and incorporate this line in your routine. I have 3C hair and it has never looked so good! I am a customer for life. Terry | Markham, Ontario These are honestly the best products I have ever used. My sons keep stealing my Go-2 Hydrating Leave-in Hair Milk and FreshenUp Hair Mist! I was using another popular brand and it just made my hair super dry. But I don’t have that problem anymore. Thank you, Up North Naturals! Nikki W. | Oshawa, Ontario Up North Naturals not only nurtured my heat damaged hair back to life - creating healthy, hydrated and defined curls with bounce - it also helped me regain my confidence. I used to wish my hair could look like other natural curly girls. Never in my wildest dreams did I think I could rejuvenate my curls! Diane Mary | Staten Island, New York Thank you so much for this line! Up North Naturals is the best hair line for my wavy and curly type III curls. My favourite products are the Freshen Up Hair Mist, Twist & Curl Hair Butter, TLC Replenishing Conditioner, 8-Oil Blend and Go-2 Hydrating Leave-in Hair Milk. Wait…I also really like the Styling Lotion too. See, I really do love this line! Faith and Curls Salon | Lake Mary, Florida We stock up on Up North Naturals in our salon and use it on all of our beauties with Afro-textured hair. We love it! Mbaka O. | Florida Up North Naturals has the BEST natural hair products I have ever tried. I’m a customer for life! My 4BC hair type loves it and has never looked and felt better. Linda | Ajax, ON My order arrived just in time for my wash day and I am in love. I noticed the slip my curls have right away after using the Clean Curls Hair Cleanser and TLC Replenishing Conditioner. Thank you for creating this line!

name: Wellness Monster
aboutContent: Nutrition Forward Snacks Who We Are We are a female-founded brand born from a passion for creating healthier snacks for kids and reimagining the sugar-filled snack aisle. Committed to quality, our nutrient-dense and delicious snacks are thoughtfully crafted with superfoods to nourish our tiny monsters while honouring Mother Earth.We believe better snacks spark better habits. With clean ingredients and earth-friendly practices, we’re here to help raise healthy, happy humans—one lunchbox at a time. Our Purpose We’re on a mission to create cleaner, healthier kids’ snacks that support their health and sustain the earth.We nourish kids to be their wild, curious, messy selves—with real ingredients, no junk, and snacks that fuel every adventure. Because thriving kids are a force of nature. Our Values Snack Mindfully We encourage kids to practice gratitude for the elements that grow our food and the farmers who make it possible. Uncompromising Clean Ingredients We are a company on mission to create cleaner, healthier kids food products that honour the health of our children, support their bellies and sustain our earth. name: Doodle Dogs
aboutContent: Home About Us About UsWELCOME TO DOODLE DOGS Thank you for visiting our online shop. The Doodle Dogs dream began in 2016, when a brother and sister duo had a plan to bring only the most CHIC | UNIQUE dog gear to Calgary. We discovered that the best way to build a beautifully unique pet store is to carry the beautiful handmade gear made right here in Calgary and across Canada (usually found at markets and on Etsy, etc). Here we are five years later with 20+ local brands - all handmade in Calgary and across Canada, most of which can only be bought direct from them on in our shops and our online boutique. OUR FOOD MISSION FOR YOU! - Only the Best. We do NOT carry 40 types of dry food, as we know that there are not 40 great brands. We carry specific brands that we know pass our test of greatness - so that we have full confidence you will get the best for your pup from us. Even better, we carry the best raw options on the market - as we truly believe feeding your pets fresh, unprocessed food is the WAY FORWARD, so we put a lot of emphasis on fresh option, OR helping each pet owner add fresh food to their bowl so that lifestyle and budget can be met while doing what’s possible to incorporate fresh. COREY CO-OWNER / CO-FOUNDER Corey's professionalism and ability to run a business comes from his years in oil and gas. A true pack leader, when Corey isn't helping out at Doodle Dogs, he can be found at local coffee shops, enjoying spin class, and of course cuddling his precious Staffordshire Bull Terriers Harley and Sadie. 🌈 Finnigan - Boston Terrier / Pug 2008 - 2018 🌈 Maggie - Boston Terrier (and our mascot!) 2009 - 2023 Favourite Breed: Bully Breeds MEGHAN CO-OWNER / CO-FOUNDER Meghan adores working with her clients and getting to know their furry family members. When not handing out snacks at Doodle Dogs, Meghan can be found advocating for stricter legislation around domestic animal sourcing and hanging with her pets Weechee Warrick (shih tzu) and her Persians Boop and NooNoo. Meghan enjoys spending time riding her Vespa in the summer months and traveling. 🌈 Mallzie - Persian / Himalayan 2009 - 2024 Favourite Breed: Squishy-faced fluffies Connect with Meghan on LinkedIn Our Mission: Our mission is to bring the best quality pet products and nutrition to your family. At Doodle Dogs we don't want you to have to worry about how your products were sourced, how they're manufactured or if they will be harmful for your pet. We ask the tough questions and source with integrity so you just have to show up, shop and spoil your pet. Our Food: We have a strong belief in dogs and cats' biological make up and their need for species-appropriate diets. Meat forward kibbles are what we focus on followed by air dried, freeze-dried, wet, fresh and raw. We DO NOT choose to have 200 different brands of kibble in our store to allow the best options and freshest products available. We look for brands that have integrity in their sourcing, their lack of corn and rice and foods that allow for meat to be the primary focus. At Doodle Dogs raw, cooked and fresh are what we believe are best. We believe every pet owner should have the right to choose for their family, lifestyle, and budget what they would like their pet to eat. After all, your pet doesn't have a say in the matter. Your breeder, your vet, even us aren't the be all end all for your decision making so ask questions, do your research and choose a food offering that works for you. We DO NOT stock anything made by Colgate or Nestlé as we personally do not believe their pet specialty branches focus on quality, sourcing or transparency. This does eliminate a number of large "brand names" that do not focus on quality products for your pets. We alternatively support, pet specialty brands making food exclusively for PETS! We do not nor will we ever sell dogs or any other animals. Customer Service is at the forefront of all that we do. If we have made an error or need to ensure your overall satisfaction we will always go above and beyond to do so. If you are out of line with us, our staff or asking for something outside of our written policies you will be asked to find another pet store to service your needs. Nods:

name: Saaboon
aboutContent: Skip to content Meet Joulian, founder of SAABOON. Discover the story behind Ottawa's vegan soap and skincare boutique, where every product is handcrafted with passion and plant-based ingredients. Handcrafted vegan soap & skincare, since 2012 Hi, I’m Joulian, the founder of SAABOON. In 2012, I started making soap in my kitchen to help with my own skin sensitivities and to create something gentle, natural, and entirely plant-based. What began as a simple experiment grew into SAABOON—a Canadian skincare brand built on ethical values, quality ingredients, and handcrafted care.From the very beginning, I’ve crafted every product myself—from soap made using the traditional cold-process method to balms, oils, and other skincare essentials—always in small batches to ensure consistency and attention to detail. As a one-person business, I handle everything from making products to packing orders and photography. SAABOON is more than my work—it’s a reflection of care, purpose, and the belief that from small beginnings, something meaningful can grow. I use only the best natural oils and don't use synthetic chemicals or foaming agents, artificial fragrance oils, artificial colourings, or any preservatives. And I am 100% against animal testing! Why buy handmade soap vs. commercial soap? The answer is very simple, with handmade soap, you get exactly that – soap. Commercial soap are not always true forms of soap – they are often detergents. Detergents are petroleum-based products, filled with synthetic, harsh chemicals that will leave your skin feeling dry, itchy, and irritated. Most manufacturers also remove a large percentage of the glycerin from their soap because glycerin contains a high resale value. The glycerin is sold to other companies to make lotions and creams. Glycerin is the natural by-product in the soap-making process. It is a humectant (helps moisturize your skin). With my handmade soap, all the glycerin is retained. Whereas with commercial soap the ingredients consists of animal fats and other chemicals that will often leave your skin irritated, my handmade soap are made with all-natural vegetable and fruit oils that not only clean, but leave your skin nourished and moisturized. Explore Your satisfaction is extremely important.My mission is to provide great quality products and excellent service. Come visit my brick and mortar shop at 595 Gladstone Avenue, Ottawa, Canada. Get in touch I am happy to answer any questions you may have about.

name: Toboggan Canada
aboutContent: Toboggan outerwear is an iconic Canadian brand, born from an appreciation of the Canadian outdoors. Each garment is produced with a commitment to best-in-class with great perceived value and excellent craftsmanship. A BRIEF HISTORY OF THE TOBOGGAN For most Canadians, tobogganing is a very popular winter sport. In modern times, a toboggan is used to carry one or more people down a hill or slope for recreation. However, this tradition dates back to aboriginal times when natives would use toboggans to transport their families and supplies across snowy tundra. Toboggans were often long and narrow to fit inside a snowshoe trail and were pulled by someone wearing a chest harness or by sled dogs. The word “toboggan” is said to have originated from the word for sled by the Ml’kmaq (Tobakun). With the arrival of the Europeans, who quickly adopted the use of the toboggan, recreational tobogganing was soon born! In 1881, the Montreal tobogganing club was founded. Since then, tobogganing as a recreational past time has evolved into some serious competitive olympic racing, such as bobsledding, luging and skeleton racing. LEARN MORE ABOUT THE TOBOGGAN ART_PRJKT CLICK HERE.

name: Yukon Soaps
aboutContent: Our Story So much more than soap.Indigenous owned and operated, The Yukon Soaps Company creates beautiful, handcrafted soaps, shampoo bars, essential oil blends, and so much more.Featuring wild rose petals, juniper berries, a Yukon-shaped press, and the artwork of Indigenous artisans, these soaps are literally infused and imprinted with the spirit of the Yukon. FAQ Page For over ten years, YSC has been supporting economic diversification, authentic relationships with customers, and bringing life to the heart of the Yukon.With their high-quality handmade soaps inspired by Yukon land, The Yukon Soaps Company has become a household staple and souvenir of choice for visitors—take a little bit of the Yukon home with you. Custom Soaps If you would like to learn how to make natural soap or other natural wellness products with Joella, you may request a workshop now! To learn more click the link below. We provide workshops to all ages and group sizes. The option to have Joella travel to your community is also available.Our workshop options include:Plant medicine bath salts, sugar scrub, room spray, bath tea, paper soap making, and of course, handcrafted natural soap. Learn How to Make Natural Soap Along with handcrafting soaps, Joella has worked to make her business a community-building, language-learning, Earth-connecting hub in the heart of the Yukon.When she took on the company, Joella was looking for a way to connect people to culture and to land. And she has done just that—from getting Elders and local children out on the land to gather wild botanicals, to offering soap workshops and a business development program. The Yukon Soaps Company elevates Indigenous cultures and connects you to the heart of the North. Natural Soapmaking 101 Book The mission of the Yukon Soaps Company is to empower, nurture and elevate Northern Indigenous cultures, communities and people. They invest in their community by hiring local, passionate people and honouring deep ancestral knowledge passed down from their Elders. Their team is encouraged to uphold the four Northern Tutchone values of caring, sharing, teaching and respect. In doing so, they hope to create a positive transformation for the community, economy and environment in Mayo. Blog meet joella hogan owner, the yukon soaps company Loving life in the heart of the Yukon. I come from a long line of strong, vibrant, Indigenous women. My matriarchs are teachers, healers, bush women, social advocates, and cultural leaders. They’ve taught me how to take action and make things happen. Through my line of handcrafted soaps, I work to share the talent of my family and community.When I moved to Mayo to live in my grandmother's community on our traditional territory, I envisioned reconnecting with the people of our community, land, and culture. Happily, I’ve been able to do all of that through The Yukon Soaps Company - from incorporating local plants in my formulations, employing community, sharing Indigenous beadwork and plant knowledge, and sprinkling in Northern Tutchone language wherever I can. The Yukon Soaps Company has allowed me to reach people in a meaningful, authentic way and empower our community.When beginning my soap making journey, it was when I came home to find local children had left baskets full of wild rose petals for my soaps that I knew I had made the right choice. Focusing on my community and young people, I chose to open my heart and mind and contribute my skills and experiences to do the heart work and the hard work. Promoting community wellness and supporting people along their journey through cultural programs, small business mentorships, as well as advocating for clean rivers and acts of resilience. The Yukon Soaps Company reflects our Dan Ke values and Indigenous ways of knowing and being. At the core of my business is the belief that traditional ways of knowing and being can create abundance. With the support of my community, Elders, and loyal customers, I have created a life and a business that brings joy, is regenerative and supportive.I am also a professional heritage worker who continues to bring Northern Tutchone culture and heritage to the forefront of life in northern Yukon. As an active advocate for my First Nation and a dedicated community builder, with the guidance of our Elders Circle, we've helped record Indigenous oral history and knowledge all with the over-arching goal of empowering Northern peoples and (re)connecting with the land. meet the team: Local Community HARVESTERS & HELPERSLocal community members help gather plants and assist in the workshop!Northern Tutchone Kwasen Reid SOAP STUDIO ASSISTANT Qualicum and Gitxsan First Nations Eileen Peter MARKETING & GRAPHIC DESIGNNorthern Tutchone Taiya Melancon SOAP STUDIO ASSISTANTNorthern Tutchone Geri-Lee Buyck SOAP STUDIO ASSISTANTNorthern Tutchone Taylor Ewing RAVENS LANDING MANAGERNorthern Tutchone Hailey Rough CARCROSS SHOP ASSISTANT Ashley Washburn-Hayden PACKAGING SPECIALIST AND ARTIST Danielle Hoogland YOUTH SOAP STUDIO ASSISTANTNorthern Tutchone Elder Circle: Walter Peter KNOWLEDGE KEEPERShares wisdom and Northern Tutchone language.Northern Tutchone Dorothy Profeit KNOWLEDGE KEEPERShares wisdom and Northern Tutchone stories.Northern Tutchone Donna Hogan TRADITIONAL HARVESTERGathers plants following cultural protocol.Northern Tutchone

name: Indogo Arrows
aboutContent: Indigo Arrows is an Indigenous-led Interior Design and Textile Studio based in Treaty One Territory. Founded by Destiny Seymour, Indigo Arrows takes a critical look at the representation of Indigenous cultures within the built environment. Destiny launched Indigo Arrows in 2016 to offer something unique in the world of interior design—artisan textiles that respectfully reflect the history of Manitoba’s Indigenous peoples. Indigo Arrows is more than just an interior design company; it's a journey to preserve and honor ancient craftsmanship. Our collections are inspired by patterns found on pottery and tools dating back 400 to over 3,000 years, connecting spaces today with the stories of the past.For thousands of years, Indigenous peoples in Manitoba, including her Anishinaabe ancestors, created beautiful patterns to adorn their pottery collections and host of bone tools. Most of the surviving pieces are held by museums now, but Indigo Arrows believes the world needs more than exhibition. We need these patterns in our homes provoking thought; we need them bridging gaps; and, we need them inspiring our loved ones. Indigo Arrows picks up where our ancestors left off – in the spaces we design and textiles we create. Seymour specializes in the design of Indigenous spaces. Her approach is anchored by community consultations; her designs are informed by local history, current realities, and the needs of future generations; and, her innovative finishes push her clients' spaces ahead of their regional competitors.Her design mission is to respectfully reflect local Indigenous cultures & identity within architectural forms, interior spaces, furniture, and textiles. This design process acknowledges community engagement, inclusiveness, and collaboration when creating new works. Spaces We Design Libraries | Schools | Community Centres | Daycares | Office Spaces | Gaming Centres | Hotels & Resorts | Tribal Council Offices | Museums | Cultural Centres | Retail Space Our design process Meet Our Team Destiny Seymour Owner, FounderB.A., M.I.D., LEED AP, PIDIMDestiny Seymour (Anishinaabe) holds a Master of Interior Design degree from the University of Manitoba and has 15+ years of interior design experience under her belt. Seymour is a member of Peguis First Nation. She lives in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada and works on both sides of the Canada/US border. Button label Fayanne Sayer Operations ManagerFayanne Sayer is a member of the Hollow Water First Nation (Anishinaabe). She joined the Indigo Arrows team in 2022. Fayanne has already had a huge impact on the growth of Indigo Arrows. She is also looking at expanding our products through new international markets and wholesale accounts. Button label Amanda Williams AssistantAmanda is a member of the Hollow Water First Nation (Anishinaabe). She joined the Indigo Arrows team in 2024. She manages all inquiries, orders, and inventory. She is currently in the last year of her Bachelor of Eduction degree. Button label Valdie Seymour Elder, Project Design SupportDestiny incorporates language and cultural knowledge support from her late father, Valdie Seymour. Through ceremony, Valdie helps guide the designs of textile patterns and use of Anishinaabemowin when naming new designs. New patterns are inspired by stories, history and language. Destiny will continue to honour his teachings on love, kindness, and community in her work. Button label Work With Us

name: Poppy Peonies
aboutContent: Our BrandAt Poppy & Peonies, we believe you shouldn't have to compromise style for function. Whether your day consists of board meetings or diaper duty, our products meet you where you are. We’re passionate about designing practical pieces that help lighten life’s load – often literally – so you can navigate your busy days with ease. Founded by Natalie Dusome, a mom determined to navigate modern motherhood in style. Poppy & Peonies is a Métis female-founded, cruelty-free, Canadian accessory brand. Meet Our FounderHi I’m Nat, the founder and designer of Poppy & Peonies. Growing up in small-town Ontario, I was a little girl with a big dream: to become a fashion designer. I would drive my parents crazy-making clothes out of vintage curtains and harassing the local shop owners to carry my wire handbags as a teenager. This passion led me to design school, and after graduating, I honed my skills designing for global brands across Canada and the U.S.Then, something magical happened. My sweet daughter, Poppy, was born, and everything changed. My pre-baby accessories no longer fit my new life as a mom – I needed lots of pockets and organization. When my search for functional fashion came up empty-handed, I had a feeling I wasn’t alone. So, armed with an idea, lots of determination, and a six-month-old baby on my hip, Poppy & Peonies was born.We’ve come a long way in five years – from filling orders in my basement to appearing on Dragon’s Den, and now, expanding into new product categories and collaborating with some exciting brands. I’d be lying if I said it’s been nothing but smooth sailing, but thanks to our incredible community who inspires me every day, we have never felt more loved and supported! Thank you for supporting a little girl’s dream! SustainabilityWe believe in the Indigenous teaching of the Seventh Generation Principle to guide our sustainability practices. This philosophy tells us the decisions we make today impact seven generations ahead. We have a duty and responsibility to care for our environment and we are passionate about preserving the health and welfare of our planet, and the animals that live on it. All of our bags are made from high-quality vegan leather, and our entire product line is vegan, cruelty-free, and PETA-approved. We ship our products plastic-free and we use a combination of recycled, compostable, and biodegradable materials to mitigate shipping waste, and we are constantly looking for new ways to make our products and supply chain more sustainable to reduce our carbon footprint. Giving BackAs a mom and Métis woman, empowering, uplifting, and giving back to women and children in need is incredibly important to us, especially those in Indigenous communities. In the last twelve months we've raised over $35K for the Indian Residential School Survivors Society and continue to support Indigenous and non- Indigenous women's shelters across Canada including Mamas for Mamas with donations, product, and calls-to-action. Giving back is one of our pillars and we couldn't do it without the support of you, our incredible community. Thank you for helping us share the love! Learn More

name: Ener Life
aboutContent: Skip to content A VITAMIN REVOLUTION Have you ever seen a good idea and known in your bones that you could make it even better? Here’s how a renegade multivitamin drink mix was born, and why we strive to do better and be better every day. OUR STORY – THE LITTLE RENEGADE BRAND THAT CAN!Our little OG Ener-C team was born of a desire to do something different: we wanted to provide choice. Choice in the form of a delicious, natural multivitamin drink mix option, made with the most bioavailable, pure and sustainably sourced non-GMO vitamins and minerals and real fruit and vegetable-derived flavors and colors. We may still be a little fish in the grand scheme, but we have the energy to keep swimming upstream, powered by the belief we have something better to offer you in your quest to choose healthy and live healthy each day. SOMETHING DIFFERENT. SOMETHING BETTER.Back in 2012, we found ourselves at a crossroads. Many of us had been part of a team distributing a different Vitamin C packet product in Canada for many years, until a large pharmaceutical company bought it, and changed the landscape for us all. We were faced with a choice: do we sit back, count our blessings and let the giants rule the earth… or do we band together and choose to create something different?At the daylight end of a dark night of our entrepreneurial souls, the answer came: SOMETHING DIFFERENT. SOMETHING BETTER. WHY, YOU ASK?Because we spent ten years collaborating with some very passionate and principled people and we didn’t want to say goodbye to the relationships we built with them and the knowledge we gained along the way. Because we knew in our bones that we could create something better. Because we knew we would eventually triumph over the “knock-off brand” association by choosing the purest, most bioavailable and planet-friendly ingredients and creating a incredible and delicious-tasting, convenient and truly healthy product. And finally, because our little team discovered we are made less of “cut your losses and move on” and a whole lot more of “shimmy-up-and-try”.That’s how a renegade multivitamin drink mix was born. We are so happy to have you here with us! TESTED & TRUSTEDEnsuring Purity and Safety Making Ener-Life involves a rigorous testing process to guarantee quality and purity, including checks for the absence of any heavy metals or pesticides. We test Ener-Life’s raw materials before blending and again after the formula is mixed to ensure the highest standards. Third-Party AssuranceAll testing is carried out by independent third parties. This step is crucial to consistently meet our high standards and deliver the best possible results, ensuring that every batch of Ener-Life upholds our strict quality criteria. Certified Non-GMO IngredientsAll our ingredients and formulas are certified non-GMO by the Non-GMO Project, making Ener-Life the only vitamin mix brand to exclusively offer certified non-GMO products. We are committed to not just talking about quality and safety, but actively demonstrating it through our certifications. Meet the Fam Behind the Fizz Ener-Life is part of the Martin & Pleasance crew — a 170-year strong wellness family that believes feeling good should be simple and natural. Alongside our powerhouse siblings Vital (your daily all-in-one nutrition hero) and Schuessler Tissue Salts (the mineral support OGs), we’re here to help you feel your best, every day. name: The Brick
aboutContent: Your browser does not support the video tag. About The Brick Since 1971, Canadians have trusted The Brick to furnish their homes. Our head office is proudly located in Edmonton, Alberta, and we operate more than 209 stores across Canada – including The Brick, The Brick Mattress Store, The Brick Super Store and The Brick Outlet. We are known nationwide for selling high quality household furniture, mattresses, appliances and home electronics at great prices. Our friendly and professional people work hard for our customers every day, both in-store and online. Saving You More is all about value. At The Brick, our value comes from our diverse and multi-talented team. To stay on top, we are always trying to recruit friendly and energetic team members who reflect the communities we serve. We’re highly motivated to remain the best in the business, and we show it every day by… Hiring exceptional people Choosing products that we’d be proud to own ourselves Negotiating the best low prices from our vendors Designing our stores to be friendly and easy to shop Delivering products right to your door At The Brick, we're dedicated to saving you more. The Brick Group Our company is a family of subsidiaries, including MidNorthern Appliance, a commercial and residential appliance supplier, and First Oceans, which sources furniture and other products for our business. Also part of The Brick Group is TransGlobal Service, which provides after-sales support to customers, and TransGlobal Insurance, which sells property and life insurance across Canada. TransGlobal Warranty Corp., meanwhile, administers our extended warranty programs. Our Employees Whether they work at one of our stores, in distribution centres or at our head office, our employees are driven by providing great customer service. This dedication is the foundation upon which The Brick's staff build long-lasting and meaningful careers. Home Is Where The Heart Is Canadians know they can find perfect places to turn their houses into homes at The Brick. Our friendly associates are experts on our extensive product lines and are always ready to help. They can find the perfect product package, so you get exactly what you need for your home without paying for products you don't want. Our Stores From British Columbia, to the Northwest Territories, to Newfoundland, there is a Brick team focused on saving you more. Find your store Giving Back In 2014, we begin our partnership with Children’s Miracle Network. Since then, The Brick has raised over $10.6 million for Canadian charities, including Habitat for Humanity and Breakfast for Learning. Learn more 1971-2021: The Brick Turns 50! The Brick started in 1971 as a single furniture store in downtown Edmonton, Alberta. 50 years later, you can shop with us from coast-to-coast. We serve Canadians from Victoria to St. John’s and operate over 209 locations and seven distribution centres. We are proud to have maintained the charitable and customer-first attitude we had when we first opened 50 years ago. Without you, our valued customer, we couldn’t have achieved this remarkable milestone. Thank you for your continued years of support! Our 50-Year Timeline The Brick has many fond memories to reflect on, and we would like to share some of them with you. 1971197619781982198319841988199019992004200420052013201420162018202020212021 1971 The Brick Warehouse opens. 1976 The first distribution centre opens. 1978 Drawing inspiration from the store’s red-brick facade, we name ourselves “The Brick Warehouse,” later shortening it to “The Brick.” 1982 First store expansion outside of Edmonton to Fort McMurray, then later to Calgary. 1983 The Brick makes its way to Eastern Canada for the first time, with two stores opening in Toronto Ontario. 1984 The Brick launches Trans Global Insurance and Warranty Divisions. 1988 Team Appreciation Day at West Edmonton Mall’s Waterpark with musical guests, The Beach Boys! 1990 The Brick’s first annual Invitational Hockey Tournament attracts up-and-coming young hockey enthusiasts, with hundreds of players going on to play professionally since the event began. 1999 The first Brick Franchise opens in Hinton. 2004 Expansion into Quebec. We open five stores and a clearance centre on the same day! 2004 The Brick purchases United Furniture Warehouse. 2005 The Brick launches its specialty banner “Sleep Better” later named The Brick Mattress Store. 2013 Leon’s Furniture Limited acquires The Brick. Together, we become Canada’s largest home furnishing retailer operating in every province. 2014 Brickley is introduced to raise awareness for The Brick’s corporate charities, including Children’s Miracle Network. 2016 The Brick launches "The Brick Field" partnership with The CFL's Edmonton Football Club and Brickley’s Club House is born. A place for families to enjoy the game at "Knothole Corner". 2018 Working to lessen our carbon footprint, we divert 70% of our waste from landfills, saving the equivalent of 75, 742 trees and 659, 928 litres of oil. 2020 The Brick is named Children’s Miracle Network’s “Corporate Partner of the Year” for our fundraising efforts and contributions to life-saving medical research, equipment and more. 2021 Our first state of the art distribution center opens in Dartmouth, NS, providing inventory and service to all Leon’s Furniture Limited Brand customers in Atlantic Canada. 2021 The Brick turns 50! We couldn’t have done it without you!

name: Serendipity Soy Candles
aboutContent: About Us As we enter our 21st year in the candle-making journey, we’re filled with gratitude and excitement at Serendipity Soy Candles. Since 2003, we've been dedicated to crafting candles that bring warmth, joy, happiness, and serenity to homes across Canada and beyond. Each candle we create is a little spark of inspiration, lovingly made by hand and designed to evoke a sense of calm and happiness. My journey began in beautiful Nelson, British Columbia, with stops in Manitoba and Ontario before life led me to Nassau, Bahamas. It was on this enchanting island that my love for candle-making was born. Inspired by the natural beauty around me, I became passionate about creating candles that were pure, environmentally friendly, and free from any harmful ingredients.Our commitment to pure, all-natural candles deepened with my mom's cancer diagnosis. This experience opened my eyes to the hidden dangers in everyday products, and it inspired our mission: to create pollutant-free, clean-burning candles that are safe for you and your home. Though we lost my mom in 2013, her spirit continues to guide us, inspiring everything we do.Today, our journey has brought us back to Collingwood, Ontario, where we pour each candle with meticulous care. We're proud to be local and Canadian, creating products that are local, sustainable, and crafted to perfection. At Serendipity, we’re not just about production but about preserving the art of handmade craftsmanship—ensuring every candle is an expression of quality, intention, and love. Our amazing team hand pours each and every candle with care and commitment.Our all-natural, pure soy candles are made with the utmost dedication to quality, using cotton wicks and timeless scents like lavender and eucalyptus that invoke peaceful memories and provide a sense of calm and comfort in every room. These candles are created with purpose, and each one is our promise of warmth and wellness to you.As we celebrate this incredible milestone, we want to extend our heartfelt thanks to you, our wonderful customers. Your support and loyalty have been the foundation of our success. Together, we’re making choices that not only bring joy and warmth to your spaces but also support a cleaner, healthier environment.Thank you for being part of our Serendipity family. Here’s to spreading even more "Soy Joy" and to many more years of handcrafted quality and care! Warm regards, Jenn Ageeb Founder & Owner Me with my family. My boys with my late mother.

name: Clay By Ally
aboutContent: Hey, I'm Ally! I'm the creative force behind Clay by Ally. Art has always been a huge part of my life, from my early days working with polymer and air-dry clay to my more recent explorations in painting, hand lettering, and graphic design. When I'm not creating, I'm a third-year Computer Engineering student at Memorial University. Despite my tech-focused studies, my passion for creating has never faded; It has actually fueled it. I am always striving to find the perfect balance between my creative side and my technical side. This sparked the birth of my business in 2020 during the COVID-19 lockdown. I've been on a mission to merge my engineering skills with my artistry to produce pieces that are not only works of art but also meticulously crafted for quality and precision. Throughout my work, you will find common themes of bold colors and playful designs. My creations are more than just accessories, they're expressions of individuality and invitations for others to find pieces that resonate with their own identities. Whether you're drawn to bright colors, fun designs, or simply seeking a unique way to express yourself, I create with you in mind. Every piece I make is a labor of love, and I hope you can feel the time, effort, and passion I pour into each and every creation. Find us on socials

name: Local Laundry
aboutContent: Nice to Meet You: Our Story, Woven in Every Stitch Imagine slipping into a garment that not only feels good on your skin but also warms your heart. A piece of clothing that carries a mission, a story, and a sense of belonging. That’s Local Laundry. Founded in 2015 by Connor Curran and Dustin Paisley, Local Laundry began not in a fashion studio, but over a conversation about what community means, and how clothing could bring people together. The lightbulb moment came, quite literally, out of a broken laundry machine and a desire to make clothing that meant something. What if our shirts, hoodies, and hats were more than just garments? What if they were a celebration of where we’re from, a tribute to who we are, and a catalyst for giving back? From that moment, Local Laundry became more than a clothing company. We make clothing that builds community. Our mission is to build a stronger Canada, one garment at a time by supporting local manufacturing, giving back to causes that matter, and celebrating the people that make this country what it is. Proudly Canadian Made. It’s not the easy path, but it’s the right one. Every purchase supports Canadian workers, fair wages, ethical labour practices, and lower environmental impact. Read more

name: Ergogenics
aboutContent: Ricky Mehta (RNC, CNP) Founder/ Nutritionist Our humble beginnings I am Ricky Mehta, founder of Ergogenics Nutrition. I have a formal education in the field of nutrition and I'm an avid snowboarder and hiker. I started this company in 2006 with the goal of making a positive change in the sports supplement world. As founder of Ergogenics, I know how hard it is to find good quailty products. I understand customers like yourself are looking for clean supplements that are free from artificial sweeteners, additives, preservatives, colours, fillers, gums, and binders. That you don’t want to see junk food flavours, you want real food ingredients that are healthy for you and your family. Ergogenics was developed to meet the needs of athletes and conscious shoppers like yourself. That’s why we operate our company with the highest degree of integrity and our products contain only carefully selected organic and non-gmo ingredients. The goal of our company is to become successful as you see success in your own well-being through the regular use of our products. We are committed to listening to our customers and delivering high quality products to help you perform your best and help with your general wellbeing. Health and Happiness, Ricky Mehta

name: Mccoy Teas
aboutContent: Behind the Blend Based in Mississauga, Canada, McCoy Teas brings a passion for tea that blends timeless tradition with modern sophistication. Our teas are directly imported from Sri Lanka, known worldwide for producing some of the finest, most flavorful leaves. Inspired by a rich global heritage, we craft each blend to reflect quality, expertise, and sustainability. Rooted in fair trade principles, we foster lasting partnerships, uplift communities, and protect the natural environment. With every sip of McCoy Teas, you experience authenticity, excellence, and a touch of Canadian charm. name: Vancouver Candle Co
aboutContent: Who we areWelcome to Vancouver Candle Co., where each candle is a work of art and every scent tells a story. Founded with a passion for craftsmanship and creativity, our company is now led by Kathy Lee, our former production manager, who has transformed her expertise and vision into owning and guiding the brand.Kathy, with her background in fashion design and jewelry making, brings a distinctive flair to our creations. Alongside her team of skilled artisans, she meticulously handcrafts each candle and diffuser in Vancouver. This dedication ensures that every piece is not just a product but an experience—one that captivates and inspires.Our commitment to exceptional quality and unique scent compositions has earned us a devoted following, and we take pride in producing each candle with the same care and passion that started it all. At Vancouver Candle Co., we celebrate the artistry of candle making and honor the vibrant city that is our home. Discover our collections and let us light up your world with elegance and enchantment.

name: Bush Berry Tea
aboutContent: Our forward-thinking approach to packaging is a testament to our commitment to sustainability. We have eliminated all plastics from our packaging and shipping, and our 100% backyard compostable materials are leading the way in the disposable packaging industry. We strive to be more responsible and want our products, branding, and packaging to reflect that. As a small, Canadaian, female-owned, independent business, we're proud to craft tea blends that reflect our commitment to clean, fair, and healthy living. When you choose Bush Berry, you're not just enjoying a cup of tea—you’re supporting a movement for sustainability, thoughtful sourcing, and mindful living. Thank you for being part of our journey. Together, let's create a more sustainable future, one cup at a time.-Christine Riediger, Founder114 2nd Ave NW Nakusp, BC EMAIL | info@bushberry.ca@bush.berry.tea

name: Loon Kombucha
aboutContent: In April 2016, Gabe Johnston founded Loon Kombucha in the cottage built by his grandfather in the 1960s, located on Otty Lake just south of Perth, Ontario. Knowing that almost all commercial kombucha has a harsh taste caused by hot-brewing demineralized city water, Gabe wanted this kombucha brewing company to be different, producing a pure and refreshing kombucha using high quality water and an innovative cold-brewing technique. Inspired by the purity of the Loons on the lake, who would sing as he brewed those first batches, he decided to name the kombucha brewing company after them: Loon Kombucha.With a desire to run an environmentally-friendly business, Loon was first sold exclusively in refillable bottles at local farmers’ markets in the Ottawa-Kingston area. The brand quickly developed a cult following. By June, so many grocery stores and cafes were requesting Loon Kombucha that Gabe had to move production to the Two Rivers Food Hub in Smiths Falls in order to increase capacity. Within a year, Loon outgrew the not-for-profit kitchen and made the move to Balderson, a small farming community north of Perth. This is when Loon Kombucha stopped using spring water and began brewing with Balderson's high quality, alkaline, and fully mineralized well water. Loon’s quality improved even more. The whole team knew they had accomplished something really special. Kombucha had never tasted this good.With kombucha brewing company growing and sales surging, Loon Kombucha broadened its reach and started distributing to Toronto, opened up refill stations as far as Kitchener, then expanded out as far as Collingwood and Parry Sound. Loon now ships nationally across Canada. Even though we’re expanding quickly, we still value our roots. We started as a local brand, introducing people to a kombucha inspired by the cottage country it was brewed in – pure, refreshing, and delicious. That’s what Loon will always be about. Gabe Johnston, President and CEO Gabe Johnston comes from a long-standing tradition of beverage fermentation. His family runs By Chadsey's Cairns, a fabulous and scenic winery where they grow and produce classic fine wines in Prince Edward County. Gabe launched Loon Kombucha Brewing Company in 2016. He was a single employee and slowly built an incredible team to help grow the business. As President, Gabe sets the standard for making Loon. Sarah Mackenzie, Brewery Manager Sarah oversees brewery operations. President of the Perth Farmers Market and partner at Hollyhock Grange Farm, Sarah brings culinary and agricultural expertise to the brewery. She monitors fermentation, develops new flavours and manages staff. SQF trained, Sarah oversees the food safety program for the entire kombucha brewing company, and also led the effort to achieve Organic Certification in 2021. Way to go Sarah! Last but not least - she is also the forklift boss! We are proud to bring jobs to a tiny rural community like Lanark County. We want to thank our current and former occasional staff living in Perth, Smiths Falls, Ottawa, Kingston and Toronto…And to all our Loon Fans - You’ve helped us so much to get to where we are! Thank you so much!

name: Good Vibes Juice Co
aboutContent: ABOUT US goodvibes juice co. is a cold-pressed juicery in kitchener waterloo ontario that creates beverages that harness the natural benefits of fruits, vegetables, teas and herbs. our goal is to provide our customers with convenient access to nutritious and delicious options that save time and energy and allow them to re-invest that time and energy exercising or enjoying with family and friends. among our most popular products was the powerhouse shot we call SICK DAY. first introduced in 2016, SICK DAY became a fan favourite with its amazing natural ingredients including echinacea and ginger and customers kept coming back for more and more… we knew we had to introduce this product to the wider market, which led us to introduce goodvibes shots and expand our offering with GET WELL and TURMERIC DAILY. simply put, we believe in and promote the mantra, "LET FOOD BE THY FRIEND" in reference to the famous hippocrates quote, "LET FOOD BE THY MEDICINE AND MEDICINE BE THY FOOD". our natural beverages in shot form make adding holistic ingredients with natural benefits into your day as a shot or tea easy, convenient and delicious. enjoy! name: Myni
aboutContent: your cleaning and personal care products don't have to be trash we found the solution! we use science to find alternatives to commonly used products Myni means... Myni (pronounced mini). A bit in the essence of the proverb "Small but mighty", we want to contrast the great impact of small green actions. before everything real people doing the real work . Our Myni story Marie-Hélène David founded the company in 2020 with a goal of making safe, natural products accessible to families and the planet. The idea came to her the day she realized that her sink pipe had been corroded by the toxic fumes from her cleaning products. At that time, she undertook a journey to learn about the nature of the ingredients found in traditional cleaning products. The conclusion was clear: most cleaning products are harmful to the health of our families as well as our beautiful planet. All too often, traditional products contain carcinogenic ingredients. Also, in addition to making the consumer pay for water, transporting these liquids all over the planet has a very negative impact on CO2 emissions. What’s worse is the number of plastic bottles that are used once and then discarded. It was for this reason that Myni was born with the mission of reducing the environmental impact of the household and personal products we use, while offering a product safe for the whole family. We hope you have as much fun using our product lines as we had creating them! Marie-Helene David, Founder Since 2020 we’ve been working to create meaningful impact. This is our biggest milestones... april 2020Launch of the company with the first 2 products, the all-purpose product and glass and mirrors. november 2020Two extraordinary products are added to the collection: stainless steel and bathroom cleaner. decembre 2020A hundredth point of sale has been added. Wow, how lucky we are to have so many people who want to save the planet with us! april 2021Broadcast of our passage in Dans l'oeil du Dragons, where Marie-Hélène concluded an agreement with Isabèle Chevalier. may 2021Launch of our hand soap. may 2022Filo becomes Myni. Myni (pronounced mini) highlights the smallness of our products, with great positive powers on the environment and the human.Launch of dishwasher and laundry tablets. Two products that quickly become favorites. october 2022Myni is broadcast on Dragon's Den where a deal is signed with Michele Romanow and Manjit Minhas. Nothing more to say than GIRL POWER! 💪 december 2022Launch of our body care line (shampoo, conditioner, shower gel and 3 in 1), a product patented by our team. This was an extremely complex project. Our largest and most innovative products ever launched. Our certifications Leaping bunny rePurpose 1% for the planet learn about our certifications

name: The Unscented Company
aboutContent: Get to know us Our purpose The Unscented Company redefines the notion of clean by offering a full line of natural home and body care products that are exclusively unscented, efficient, and designed to reduce plastic and water by offering refills and solid options. “I’ve said it before, and I’ll say it again: The Unscented Company is more than a soap company. It's a driving force for change that simplifies our lifestyle by minimizing our choices, as well as our collective environmental impact.”Anie Rouleau Anie Rouleau Founder & CEO Anie Rouleau is a pioneering leader reshaping the future of sustainable business. As the founder of The Unscented Company, Anie redefines the notion of clean with innovative, natural home and body care products. With a dedication to sustainability and social impact, Anie champions refillable packaging and waterless products, combating single-use plastics and protecting waterways. An advocate for the B Corp model, she promotes local sourcing, ethical leadership, and equal opportunity employment.Anie's achievements include appearances on Dragons' Den Canada, Canada's Top Growing Company for four consecutive years, and recognition with the Young Phoenix Prize and the Trudeau Medal. An influential speaker at institutions and organizations such as BDC, C2 Montreal, UQAM, Concordia, McGill, ETS, and the University of Ottawa, she's committed to mentoring young female entrepreneurs. Anie leads a B Corp Certified and Women Owned business, a role she's held since 2011. Learn more about Anie's vision The Brand is Female – Anie Rouleau, The B Corp Entrepreneur Committed to True Purpose Apple Spotify Avoir su – Anie Rouleau, Concilier entrepreneuriat et parentalité Apple Spotify Histoires d'hypercroissance – Certification B Corp et engagement sociétal des entreprises Apple Spotify The Pop Up Report by Ethan Song – Inside the Scent-Free Revolution with Anie Rouleau Apple Spotify Manifesto Let's redefine the notion of clean Watch the video Our philosophyWhy unscented products?We decided to challenge the conventional notion that fragrances signal cleanliness by showing instead that powerful cleaning can be fragrance free.Our products are a breath of fresh air in a world overwhelmed by fragrances. They support a healthier home and work environment because they’re comprised of only the essential ingredients, which are all natural and plant or mineral based. Our visionWe want to encourage consumers to adopt a more sustainable lifestyle by changing their consumption habits and raising industry standards. Our values TransparencyFor us, transparency means providing our customers with all the information they need to make informed choices. It's a way of being and acting that’s reflected in everything we do, from ingredient listing right down to our product packaging. InclusivityWe’re committed to ethical and female-led governance and to ensuring that everyone has an equal opportunity to make their greatest dreams come true. Socially responsibleA company rooted in its local community is a company that helps everyone to be better off. Whether it's helping a neighborhood school, working with community-based organizations, or mentoring other women entrepreneurs, there are endless opportunities to get more involved. Environmentally responsibleIt means deciding that, from now on, being clean means leaving the smallest environmental footprint possible throughout a product's entire life cycle—from manufacturing, to consumer use, to end-of-life. Our team Our job opportunities Communications & Social Media Manager Read the job description Sourcing & Supply Chain Specialist Read the job description Head Accountant Read the job description Spontaneous application Send my cv Company timeline November 2011 Incorporation of Baléco Inc. Baléco, the company behind The Unscented Company brand, was launched in November 2011 by Anie Rouleau. Her vision, right from the outset, was to offer B2B businesses a turnkey solution to reduce their plastic footprint. August 2012 Launch of OH Brand + First official sale! Our goal: Making it simple for our customers to conveniently refill from the office to their home, hence OH. Our first customers were daycares, yoga centers, offices, and schools. Quickly, our customers wanted to purchase our products from retail stores. May 2015 Officially Leaping Bunny Certified Our commitment to never test on animals was made early on in the business. We chose the well-known Leaping Bunny Certification as a seal of approval. September 2015 Officially B Corp Certified From the very beginning, B Corp values were at the heart of the company. Choosing to become B Corp Certified was a natural step in building the business with a solid foundation, enabling us to set the highest standards for the future. July 2016 Launch of The Unscented Company OH was great and allowed us to test our business concept. Secretly, The Unscented Company had always been in the back of Anie’s mind just waiting to happen. A bold name that would always ensure we remain who we are: unscented and unstoppable! February 2017 Welcome to the office, Patch! The one and only Patch officially joined the company in February 2017. And he made quite the entrance too! After 2 years of R&D, he also launched his very own Dog Shampoo Bar in 2020. June 2017 Our First National Customer OMG! Our first BIG order: The Unscented Company products were launched in 280 Bulk Barn stores across Canada. January 2019 Goop Feature Gwyneth Paltrow & The Unscented? Yes, that happened. Our products being featured on Goop in January 2019 was a stepping stone for our company and gave us quite a bit of media coverage, both locally and in the US. April 2019 Launch at Lufa Farms If you live in Montréal and love local food, you probably already know about Lufa Farms, and likely order from them. Their mission? Build a better food system. How do they do it? By building and farming on rooftop greenhouses, partnering with local farmers and food makers, and delivering baskets as quickly and efficiently as possible to the growing community of Lufavores. The perfect fit with our brand and mission; we’re proud partners! September 2019 Dragons’ Den Appearance + Launch at Canadian Tire The Unscented Company on national television! Anie Rouleau appeared on Dragons’ Den with the brand and did a refill on live TV. In collaboration with Dragons’ Den, Canadian Tire then surprised us by listing our product line in Canadian Tire stores across Canada. As Anie Rouleau said it at the time, ‘‘My business took a major shift in 15 seconds!’’ November 2019 Freshness as far as the eye can see. Launch of our TUC Body collection, our first addition to the product line since the launch of the company. Our inspiration came from the mountains, their calm, peacefulness and overwhelming feeling of well-being. The idea for the design came from a trip to Vancouver. We decided that our new products were the perfect place to pay tribute to the immense beauty of Canada’s nature with a truly inspiring packaging. We set out to create a breathtaking mountain image and reached out to Valérie Derome-Massé. She loves nature as much as we do and especially likes photographing sunrises in the fall when fog is created by the evaporation of the warm lakes. She went out to Lac Ouimet in the beautiful Laurentians with her drone and captured this amazing shot that is now on our products. December 2019 The team is growing! It’s December 2019, and The Unscented Company now has 8 employees and a loyal customer base. Our concept is proven and we’re very excited for big projects in 2020! April 2020 Dans l’œil du dragon Airing Anie is back on television, this time at Dans l’œil du dragon, the QC version of Dragons’ Den. Filmed months before, little did we know that we would have our first Zoom watch party, in the comfort of our own homes! We received a huge wave of support from across the province, and the whole team was packing orders in the warehouse! May 2020 The Unscented Company x Cirka Distilleries The beginning of the pandemic was a huge shift in priorities at The Unscented Company. The world needed soap and sanitizer, and we were on a mission to help! We teamed up with our neighbours Paul and Victoria at Cirka Distilleries to create a hand sanitizer that was Health Canada approved and made from only 3 ingredients. A unique collaboration we could have never of dreamed of, that allowed us to provide our local community with sanitizer in a time of need. The rainbow branding reminded us that ‘‘everything would be OK’’. June 2020 The all-new Smartbox! A smart cardboard box? Designed by our in-house architect and self-proclaimed box expert Manhal Alkhalil, our 10L refill box was completely redesigned to make it the coolest refill box on the market.It’s made in Canada from 100% recycled cardboard and glue-free, just like origami. It has a handle for easy transportation and, what’s more, it even has an integrated feature that tilts the bag to increase refill speed and reduce waste. It’s strong and meant to be shipped across the country, allowing more and more Canadians to refill at home and in store. Now that’s smart! July 2020 TUC makes its entry in the USA And what a better way to...

Targeting cookies These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on other sites. They do not store directly personal information, but are based on uniquely identifying your browser and internet device. Getting Started Find a registry Manage your registry Create a registry The benefits Book an Appointment Checklist, don't forget Login Account Cart Registry Free Shipping on All Orders Over $249* Free Shipping on All Orders Over $249* Free Shipping on All Orders Over $249* Free Shipping on All Orders Over $249* Free Shipping on All Orders Over $249* Free Shipping on All Orders Over $249* Free Shipping on All Orders Over $249* Free Shipping on All Orders Over $249* Free Shipping on All Orders Over $249* Free Shipping on All Orders Over $249* Free Shipping on All Orders Over $249* Free Shipping on All Orders Over $249* Free Shipping on All Orders Over $249* Free Shipping on All Orders Over $249* Free Shipping on All Orders Over $249* Home Registry Find a Registry Manage Your Registry Create a Registry The Benefits Book an Appointment Checklist, don't forget Gift Ideas Gift Guide Holiday Entertaining Under $100 For Him For Her For Baby Tableware Vases Bar Kitchenware Candles Decorative Objects Entertaining Judaica Frames Collectibles Gift Cards Teuscher Chocolates Gift Certificates Corporate What's New Events Contact Us Newsletter Facebook Pinterest X/Twitter Instagram YouTube Our Story Home / Our Story Our Story William Ashley is Canada's most celebrated and recognized retailer for tableware, home décor and gourmet kitchenware. Established in 1947, we opened our brand-new home on Toronto's prestigious Bloor Street West in the Colonnade in April 2018. William Ashley’s 15,000 square foot retail store creates an immersive customer experience, where customization and curation go hand in hand with phenomenal service. It is a place where heritage brands meet cutting edge technology, and High Design meets functionality. William Ashley's flagship store is an epic journey in tabletop, home décor and gourmet kitchenware excellence. Created by Design Agency, William Ashley features two shining stories in the Colonnade heritage building which boasts 23-foot-high ceilings and dazzling architectural features, providing a spectacular home for over 200 world renowned prestigious brands. From the minute guests step through the door, they are immersed in a unique environment with access to experts who are ready to transfer critical knowledge on the craftsmanship, heritage and stories behind the world's most coveted luxury brands. The William Ashley team takes great pride in being a leader in exemplary customer service, providing clients with personalized consultations accompanied by the next generation of retail technology. Ashley's lounge is a welcome addition. The designer décor creates an oasis where guests can enjoy custom blended tea by Kusmi and coffee by Nespresso in an ever-changing selection of contemporary china tailored to the Ashley's experience. The lounge is an experiential destination where events, such as crafting a vintage cocktail, creating a stunning floral arrangement and participating in a VIP wedding registry event ignites our customer's creativity. It's a feature we like to call EDU-TAINMENT! William Ashley's consultants work one-on-one with customers creating customized table settings and accessorizing their homes to reflect their unique lifestyles. With this personalized attention and a range of complimentary registry services, William Ashley continues to be a Toronto institution and the destination for newly engaged couples for many decades and is now offering an 'all-occasion' gift registry. William Ashley’s flagship store is the backdrop for quality brands, curated for today's ever-changing lifestyles and diverse demographic. World-renowned brands include Alessi, Baccarat, Beatriz Ball, Bernardaud, Christofle, Costa Nova, Degrenne, Denby, Deshoulieres, Ercuis, Georg Jensen, Herend, Juliska, Lalique, Le Creuset, Lenox, Lladro, L'Objet, LSA International, Michael Aram, Moser, Nambe, Narumi, Noritake, Orrefors, Portmeirion, Puiforcat, Raynaud, Riedel, Robbe and Berking, Rogaska, Rosenthal, Royal Crown Derby, Royal Doulton, St. Louis, Stelton, Villeroy & Boch, Waterford, Wedgwood, Wolf; and designer brands include, Jasper Conran by Wedgwood, Kate Spade New York, Sophie Conran by Portmeirion, Vera Wang by Wedgwood, and Versace By Rosenthal. William Ashley is proud to be Canada's exclusive destination for world-renowned Teuscher Chocolates of Switzerland, which are prepared and flown in from Zurich, Switzerland. Handmade with the finest ingredients, the signature Dom Perignon Champagne Truffle is world famous. Some of our History William Ashley was launched in Toronto in 1947 by Tillie Abrams, fondly known by staff and customers alike as ‘Mrs. Ashley.’ Though Mrs. Ashley passed away in 2010, her legacy lives on. Claudia Truchan, the current President, continues the tradition and original vision of William Ashley – to bring the best selection of quality tableware and giftware to the Canadian marketplace, setting the bar as the trendsetters in the industry. At a young age, Tillie managed her family’s paint and wallpaper business while her parents attended business trips. She always took great interest in the tableware section of the family business and used her great sense of style to choose the next cutting-edge sensations in dinnerware. With her passion for quality tableware, Tillie opened her first store in Toronto’s Danforth neighborhood in 1947. At the time, it was an unusual act for a woman to own a business, yet Tillie had confidence – a true renaissance woman of her time. A few years later she chose to relocate to Bloor Street, believing it to be Toronto’s up-and-coming shopping district. As she travelled the world to source the best selection of tableware and gifts, the business continued to grow. Tillie was also revolutionary. On a visit to Chicago, she realized that Canadian stores had not yet tapped into the latest trend in the United States: the Wedding Registry. Thus, in the early 1970s, William Ashley became the very first store in Canada to offer a Wedding Registry Service. When William Ashley was located in the Manulife Centre, 55 Bloor Street West, the Great Wall of China became a cultural landmark, and was Instagram-worthy, before Instagram even existed. During the summer months, the Water Bar with its complimentary Perrier Water was a welcome place to pick up some refreshment while shopping for tableware, kitchenware or picking a Registry gift or creating a Registry. In the present Flagship store, the Colonnade - 131 Bloor Street West, customers are welcome to enjoy a complimentary coffee or Kusmi tea. William Ashley has always been at the forefront of the tabletop and home décor industry, and to this day proudly maintains the largest selection of tableware, home décor and gourmet kitchenware in the world. It is to William Ashley that the industry has always looked, because of our unique heritage and continuing legacy. We look forward to welcoming you to our store, or visit us 24/7 at www.williamashley.com Privacy Policy Copyright 2025 William Ashley China Corporation. All rights reserved.131 Bloor Street West, Toronto, Canada M5S 3L7

name: Monsieur Cocktail
aboutContent: Our storyIn 2015, Patrice Plante had one thing in mind when he founded Monsieur Cocktail: to create a syrup that would bring the cocktail world to your home. Whether as a restaurant critic, as a chef or as a barman, he’s always been driven by a boundless passion for food and drinks, the quality and origin of ingredients, and the art of creating a delicious dishes and drinks with the simple aim of putting smiles on faces.His fascination with food and travel led him on an unsuspected adventure: the world of cocktails. The cocktail allows for an incredible rapport between individuals. Contrary to food, cocktails are not a necessity. They're an excuse to socialize and to spend time with loved ones.When Patrice got behind the bar, he was surprised to see that the ingredients didn’t match the quality and standard of what was done in the kitchen. He found odd fluorescent containers of bar mix, pasteurized juices and syrups made with fructose and artificial flavors. This was not how he wanted to convey his stories and enjoyment. Quickly tired of these mass-produced, soulless ingredients, he wanted to craft simple, natural and genuine replacements. After several years of passing on his passion and making his own homemade syrups to fill the gap, he made it his mission to make mixology accessible to everyone. In 2015, Patrice founded Monsieur Cocktail with the aim of creating the world's best cocktail syrup. A syrup made with real juice and natural sugar. A syrup with no artificial flavours or preservatives. A syrup that makes a great cocktail every time, and that is available everywhere. A syrup to make it simple. To add pleasure to your drinks, whether it’s sparkling water, iced tea, coffee, lemonade or something a little more complex. Today, you’ll find Monsieur Cocktail syrups and products everywhere: at neighbourhood BBQs, at parties, at romantic evenings with a special someones and at family camping trips. Cheers!About PatriceRegular guest on Salut Bonjour! and Rouge FM, Patrice also writes a weekly column every Saturday in Le Soleil.

name: Duchess Cocktails
aboutContent: About FOUNDER & CEO, OLIVIA LOVENMARK-HAY Olivia loves creating beautiful products and memorable experiences — two things that Duchess brings together. Prior to Duchess, she was a fintech marketer working with California and New York-based startups. In 2022, Olivia co-founded Repose, a community platform that is home to the Duchess Club. She attended Kwantlen Polytechnic University and the British Columbia Institute of Technology and holds her Canadian securities designation (CSC). HOW DUCHESS COCKTAILS STARTED “In June of 2019, I was on a flight home from New York thinking that a cosmo would be great, and too bad they don’t serve those on flights. I thought, ‘someone should bottle cosmopolitans’.” Coupe Beverages Corporation was soon created and our first cocktail launched in December 2020. In 2022, we built out our own factory in East Vancouver to bring all production in-house — and Duchess Cocktails remains a self-funded, independent producer in Canada. Our cocktails offer a unique perspective; they’re not sweet, always made with real juice, and are stylishly packaged. BUT WE WEREN'T DONE INNOVATING In the fall of 2023, we launched DuchessDry to provide a real non-alcoholic experience, where taste and mouthfeel replicates that of a spirit-based cocktail, not just a juice and soda mocktail. ENJOY DUCHESS COCKTAILS Duchess Cocktails are ready-to-serve bottled cocktails, best enjoyed chilled, straight from the bottle, poured over ice, or in your favourite coupe.

name: Rosso Coffee Roasters
aboutContent: Who is Rosso Coffee? At Rosso, we believe the ritual of coffee is not merely a routine, but rather an act intertwined with a sense of romance and richness. Each cup is a deliberate gesture marked by the beauty of a place, a lust for unexpected flavours, a passion for partnership, and the pleasure of good company. For 16 years, we’ve challenged conventional coffee practices and forged our own way to honour nature and the hands that tend to it. Our award-winning beans are a result of considered sourcing, meticulous roasting, and an insatiable curiosity for the potential of coffee. Our cups are acts of love, brewed to perfection for you. And don't worry if you're not sure how to describe what you taste—we all have different palates and that's the beauty of it all. Embrace the ritual and savour in the delight it brings to our lives. Let us fill your cup.

name: Kingdom Coffee
aboutContent: 0CARTOUR STORYFrom heroin, crack cocaine and homelessness to REDEMPTION!Jim was homeless, hooked on drugs and suicidal. Four strangers shared a conversation which led to Jim checking into a recovery center. Jim was able to find sobriety after a 30 your addiction, find his identity and went from being an angry violent man to a man his family adored. Jim was helping others get off the streets and into recovery, when he tragically passed away in a workplace accident. We have since become those strangers, we offer up hope with a cup of coffee and conversation to the homeless every week. A portion of every bag sold goes to helping people off the street, into recovery and finding them a place to stay. Jim was my Dad and this is his story. ​ ​ Jesse & Steph Singleton ​ ​Click here to see a CTV News Story on Kingdom Coffee

name: Phil Sebastian Coffee Roasters
aboutContent: In specialty coffee, there’s no shortage of “world’s best” roaster lists. Most of them are built on reputation, social reach, or popularity. That’s fine, but for us, the real test has always been how a coffee tastes in the cup, with no preconceived notions attached. That’s why the Global Coffee Awards caught our eye. It’s a blind competition that evaluates every coffee on a level playing field, judged purely on quality. No branding, no bias, just coffee. There aren’t many competitions like this in the world, which makes it all the more exciting. This was the first year of the event, with thousands of coffees entered from across Canada and the U.S. From that massive and talented field, we’re humbled and proud that our coffees stood out. Our Jose Joaquin Bolaños Geisha has been awarded a Gold Medal in the Filter/Washed Category at the Global Coffee Awards US & Canada, 2025! Sharing the news with Jose Joaquin was a special moment for us, marking the culmination of years of dedication, experimentation, and exceptional craftsmanship on his part. This coffee is available for a limited time, and can be found here. Our Candy Cloud Espresso, featuring Bekele Yutute Natural, also made a strong showing: • Silver Medal in Espresso – Single Origin/Experimental Processing • Silver Medal in Flat White / Alternative Milk • Finalist in Flat White / Dairy Milk We rounded out the competition with additional Finalist placements: • Espresso / Decaf – Lights Out Decaf • Filter – Single Origin / Traditional Processing – Lilac Dream, featuring coffee from the Danche (Gerba Dogo) site in Ethiopia. This recognition highlights both our team’s work and the incredible quality delivered by our producing partners. We’re thrilled with how our coffees performed. Back to Blog Journal See all entries Our Jose Joaquin Bolaños Geisha Won Gold at the Global Coffee Awards 2025 We're Honoured to be Bringing Home the Gold!
