name: Big Mountain Coffee Roasters
aboutContent: Passionate about outstanding coffee Explore our full range of coffees, featuring more than 18 varieties of single-origin and custom blends, including our signature Espresso of the Canadian Rockies™. The Big Method For Smooth, Rich Tasting Coffee Use Freshly Ground Coffee Beans.Brew Methods Fine/Medium/Coarse/Espresso/Drip/French Press Measure 15 mL (1 Tbsp.) of freshly ground coffee for every 180 mL (6 oz.) of cold filtered water. Brew using your preferred method. Repeat often in your journey through life. Espresso of the Canadian Rockies™ Our master roaster and blending specialist have created four unique espresso blends, each with a specific flavour and taste pairing in mind. This skillset allows Big Mountain Coffee Roasters to offer a distinct individuality to each espresso blend, creating a spectrum of flavour. Big Mountain Coffee Roasters has a perfect espresso for everyone’s personal preference. Blended and Single Origin Drip (North American Style) Coffees Drip coffee is a simple, elegant way to enjoy coffee both at home and on the go. The key to great drip coffee is exceptional beans, the proper grind and proportion for your method, and good water. Explore over 13 varieties of our single-origin and custom blends, including some special seasonal roasts. Swiss Water Process Decaf Decaffeinated coffee requires a Master’s touch to roast properly. Big Mountain Coffee Roasters uses only Swiss water process decaffeinated beans rather than using beans treated chemically. The difference in taste is incomparable. Big Mountain Coffee Roasters produces a full-bodied, flavourful, fragrant roast. You will love the full flavour of our decaffeinated coffee.

name: Qe Home
aboutContent: Canada’s Home for Comfort Since 1992 Our Story It all started in 1989, in Vancouver, Canada. Inspiration struck when our founders, Howard and Jixin, came across a simple, yet exceptional product: a well-made, well-priced duvet. From there the mission was clear: to bring better sleep to all Canadians, with high-quality, affordable bedding. And the rest is history! In 1992, they opened their first two stores as ‘Quilts Etc’ in Clearbrook and Nanaimo, BC. Over three decades later, QE Home has evolved from a small family business into a Canadian household name. Though we’ve done some growing up, we’ve stayed true to our roots, putting family, comfort, and our communities first. Today, we have over 70 stores across the country, from Vancouver Island to the tip of Newfoundland. Whatever your style and however you sleep, our team of in-house designers and experts are dedicated to creating products you’ll love — using sustainable, high-quality materials that offer deeper, healthier sleep. No middlemen, no markups, just quality linens. Our Goal Your best days start with better sleep. When you wake up rested and rejuvenated, cocooned in soft linens, wrapped in a warm, cloud-like duvet — there’s no better way to greet the day. Your bedroom is a personal sanctuary—it should reflect who you are, from style to comfort. At QE Home, our goal is to help you create a space that celebrates your unique take on the world — that makes you feel both comfortable and at home. How do we do it? With thoughtfully designed bedding and accessories that bring healthy, natural comfort and unique design to every home — and every budget. Our Evolution Howard and Jixin come up with the name 'Quilts Etc' and open their first two stores in Clearbrook and Nanaimo, BC. Though cobbled together with second-hand fixtures and holding little product, Quilts Etc draws a crowd. Our founders are on the right track. The digital boom is in full swing, and we get our very first website! The early 90s were a time of rapid growth. Now, the family business spans the nation, with stores in Calgary, Alberta to Mississauga, Ontario. We bring in our first line of eco-friendly textiles, made of ultra-soft, natural bamboo fibres. Thinking ahead, we launch version one of our e-commerce site. For the first time ever, our products are available for purchase online! We begin building out our in-house design team and creating whole new lines of bedding every season. We rebrand! Quilts Etc becomes QE Home. "QE" as a nod to our past. "Home" to better represent the variety of products we offer and carry us into the future. We face a year unlike any other. To succeed, we focus on offering new services to our customers with safety in mind, like same day pick up. With over 70 brick-and-mortar stores and a well-established e-commerce site, we're proud to serve Canadians across the country. We hope we can help you find comfort for years to come! As a child, I used to spend time in our stores with my dad. What I remember most was the way we made people feel. The joy when guests walked out of our store with fresh linens, and the gratitude people expressed for the comfort we provided. The way I see it, QE Home doesn't just provide bedding. We provide well-being, delight, and memories for Canadians of all ages and generations. - Christina Xu, COO Our Approach Expertise We've got over 30 years of experience specializing in bedding, perfecting comfort, and elevating your sleep. Fashion It's no secret, our designers have great taste. They travel around the globe to cultivate a keen sense of style and bring home the latest fashions. Craftsmanship No detail is too small. No technique too new. From sourcing sustainable fabrics to testing the latest textile technology, high-quality craftsmanship is the core of who we are. Service Shopping should be simple and enjoyable. We do our utmost to make it so, with personalized advice for every sleeper. Our team of sleep experts is here to help — in-stores, by phone, online chat, or virtual consultation! Our Core Products Signature Bedding Designed in-house in Vancouver, BC. Every season, discover beautiful new collections in palettes, fabrics, and styles to suit every sleep style. Shop Bedding Luxury Sheets Bamboo Cotton | BeechBliss | Eucalyptus Luxe Natural, healthy, and ultra-soft, you'll never go back once you’ve tried our sheets. Upgrade your sleep and experience the breathability, coziness, and lustrous feel of luxury sheets. Shop Sheets Top-Performing Duvets Fabricated with certified responsible materials. Explore our lineup of top-performing duvets for every sleeper in every season. Shop Duvets Our Certifications The Downmark® certification ensures that down and feather products bearing this mark are genuine, high-quality, and finished in Canada according to strict ethical standards. STANDARD 100 by OEKO-TEX® ensures a textile has been verified in an independent laboratory, and is free from more than 100 substances known to be harmful to human and environmental health. The GOTS certification ensures organic textiles follow world-recognized environmental and ecological standards throughout production (from harvesting the raw materials to manufacturing, labeling, and more). Fun fact: GOTS certified products are pesticide-free and require lighter water irrigation! The RDS certification ensures that best practices for animal welfare are followed throughout the entirety of a product’s supply chain, and that a product contains only certified material. My Offers My Offers

name: Mrs Greenway
aboutContent: Mrs Greenway evolved from a passion to create a better future for our children and grandchildren. Who are we? We are a Mother-Daughter duo who had a vision of bringing planet friendly living to our communities. A place that would make living a low-waste lifestyle just a bit simpler. A spot where all individuals, no matter where they were on their sustainable journey, would feel welcomed. A safe place to ask questions and a way to be part of the solution. In 2014 we opened the doors to our first location in Dundas. That tiny little shop on a side street has since grown and so has the communities that we serve. A second location was opened in Grimsby in 2015 and in 2020, our 3rd store was added in Elora - a beautiful spot close to the hometown we are originally from. We have a passion to do better for our planet and encourage others to do so. We not only source items that are gentler to our Earth, we also put an emphasis on Canadian-made goods wherever possible. We spend countless hours sourcing incredible makers, researching materials and ingredients and verifying how and where products are made so you can feel confident that your purchases will make a difference. Our priorities are: Sustainability, Education, Accessibility and Community. Our goal is to ensure that living a low-waste lifestyle is accessible to all members of our community. Whether you are shopping in our store or online, we want to be there to help educate you and be a part of your journey. We truly feel that no change is too small and that every step you make helps better our Earth for future generations. Always remember “progress over perfection” is a perfect place to be! Our stores are a welcoming space to allow you to discover your own role in protecting our planet, a place to come ask questions and seek clarification and an opportunity for all of us to work collectively towards a more sustainable future. We thank each and every one of you for your incredible support and being part of such an important goal! Mary Lou & Christine

name: Organic Traditions
aboutContent: The OTFounding Story Our story It all began with a search for healing Over 30 years ago, our founder Jerry Zeifman struggled with digestive issues until he discovered the power of enzymes. That simple change transformed his health and set him on a lifelong mission: to share nature’s most powerful foods as strategies for wellness, prevention, and vitality. Organic Traditions grew out of my desire to nourish people with the most nutrient-dense superfoods on the planet. My passion has always been to inspire others to discover a new level of wellness by harnessing the power of traditional foods from around the world. Jerry Zeifman Founder Rooted in tradition, crafted for today. From Ayurvedic herbs and Japanese tea rituals to Peruvian cacao ceremonies and Traditional Chinese Medicine, Organic Traditions brings ancient wisdom into modern life, making superfoods simple, accessible, and transformative. A family-led legacy. What began as Jerry’s passion is now carried forward by his daughter Ally, who joined in 2017 to write the next chapter. Since then, we’ve developed 20+ unique blends and expanded Organic Traditions internationally, while staying true to our mission of purity, innovation, and empowerment. This brand has always been about more than just food—it’s about helping people feel their best every single day. I’m proud to carry forward my father’s vision, while reimagining what superfoods can mean for a new generation. Ally Mamalider President & Second Gen Founder The next chapter of wellness. For over 25 years, we’ve been Canada’s superfood pioneer. Today, we continue to grow globally, staying true to the same belief that started it all: real food can give you superpowers, every single day. Our mission We make superfoods super simple. So you can live, feel, and be your best every day. Organic Traditions’ DNA Where Ancient Wisdom Meets Modern Wellness 01. DNA Rooted in Healing Traditions For centuries, cultures have used nature to heal. Organic Traditions brings this ancient wisdom—like Ayurveda and tea or cacao rituals—into modern wellness to help you thrive. 02. Obsessed with Purity Purity is our promise. Every ingredient is clean, high-quality, and third-party tested to meet the highest standards. We treat our customers like family, serving only the superfoods we’d want on our own tables. 03. Empowering People Our mission is simple: to help you thrive. Through thoughtfully crafted formulations and meaningful education, we empower you to live a healthier, more vibrant life, every day. 04. Making It Simple Superfoods don’t have to be complicated. Instead of filling your pantry with dozens of powders, our nutrient-rich blends deliver everything you need in a form that seamlessly fits into your routine. Wellness, simplified. Our Impact Every bag purchased. One tree planted. 94,500+ Trees planted It's simple. You shop, we plant. Sustainability is at the core of everything we do. Get involved

name: Yupik
aboutContent: Home About Us About us Our Story At Yupik, we are a family-owned Canadian company dedicated to providing you with ingredients & snacks that cater to your tastes & needs. We carry an extensive range of organic to conventional products, including nuts, dried fruits, superfoods, snacks, mixes, candies, chocolates & cooking ingredients. Many of our products are labeled “Prepared in Canada”, which means the product was processed (roasted, mixed, and/or seasoned) & packaged at our Montreal facilities. Our Philosophy We strive for the customer’s experience, both in our store & online, to be as fulfilling as possible. We aim to satisfy & leave customers happy to have spent their time with us. High-Quality We source our amazing ingredients from over 55 countries, all while prioritizing Canadian-grown products. Our priority is to offer high-quality products. Our Values At Yupik, we strive to give our customers the best quality products without compromising value. We believe in offering fair prices without compromising on quality. You’re invited to join our family, because your smile is our greatest reward! Commitment Our goal is to deliver quality products in an efficient and timely way. We ship across Canada & right to your doorstep so you can begin enjoying our products as soon as possible. You’re invited to join our family, because your smile is our greatest reward!

name: Genuine Tea
aboutContent: Serve Third Wave Tea Our wholesale partners are on a mission to serve tea that stands front and centre, not as an afterthought. We support passionate operators to build beverage programs that deliver consistent quality, profitability, and excitement for your team as they serve every cup. Apply for a Wholesale Tea Account Why Genuine Tea? One-Stop Tea ShopFull tea programs, from direct-trade matcha, loose leaf, RTDs to essential tools and accessories. Partnering with us comes with full training and support. Ethical & SustainableSourced from personal relationships with farmers, and Ethical Tea Partnership & Fair Trade gardens. Compostable packaging made in Toronto. Lightning Fast FulfillmentOrders ship in 1 business day. Free shipping on orders over $250 across Canada & the US. Premium Whole leaf tea Whole leaf, whole flavour. We're proud to deliver farmer-direct and organic leaves that steep with uncompromising flavour. Hand-blended & packed in Ontario, we never use any artificial flavourings or additives.Brew better, leaving nothing behind. Made with the same whole leaf tea, our compostable pyramid tea bags deliver full flavour with consistency & speed. Made from plant-based poly-lactic acid, they break down in commercial compost in under 90 days and never leach microplastics.Both bulk, retail and individually wrapped packaging available to suit every context. See Pricing Direct Trade Matcha Program Forget the shortage! For over a decade, we've been working with the Katō Family to bring you ceremonial-grade, single-origin matcha grown in Uji, Japan. Shade-grown under bamboo and stone-milled in small batches, each harvest is selected for balance, clarity, and umami. Our direct relationship allows for consistent matcha supply.Three harvests, one farm. Spring and summer harvests of the Yabukita cultivar, and an organic spring harvest of the Okumidori cultivar. Rich in L-theanine and clean caffeine, Katō Matcha delivers calm, focused energy in its purest form. Sourced with transparency and crafted with care. Wholesale Matcha Barista-Approved Microground Latte Powders Silk in a cup. Our Microground Latte Powders are stone-milled from carefully selected loose leaves and botanicals into full-flavour powder that dissolves instantly and creates rich, lasting foam. Classic café favourites like London Fog, Chai, Turmeric Gold, and Lion’s Mane Cacao: reimagined for silky consistency and speed.Made with pure, whole ingredients, meaning no fillers, no dairy. Microground Teas Ready-to-Drink Sparkling Iced Tea Summer is a mindset! Our Sparkling Iced Teas are crafted by baristas, for baristas. Brewed from award-winning loose leaf and perfectly carbonated for a crisp, summery finish. With simple, certified organic ingredients, including real fruit juice that provides 3g of naturally occurring fruit sugar, they deliver vibrant, full-flavour tea with no added sugar. Sparkling Iced Tea Complete Support, Tools & Training We don't just box and ship tea. As your tea partner, we're here to make you the spot in town for tea. You'll have access to our TEAm's expertise, with a dedicated account manager to help you build profitable tea programs based on years of data and experience.Barista-approved gear. We can set you up with all the essential tea brewing tools including made-in-Japan matcha whisks, bowls, steepers, cups and more. Train like an athlete. We'll make your team tea experts with brewing guides, virtual and live training, and quarterly seasonal recipes with our wholesale newsletter. Get Started Today Ready to up your beverage game? Register to become a Wholesale Tea Partner and place an order for bulk tea today. Our wholesale account manager Ramy will be happy to assist with any special purchase inquiries. Register for a Wholesale Tea Account Frequently Asked Questions What's the minimum order quantity? There's no minimum order! We believe in letting you order what you need, when you need it. How quickly do orders ship? All in-stock items leave our Toronto warehouse within one business day.Standard ground reaches most Canada & US locations in 5-7 business days.Toronto and GTA area cafes can receive packages in 1-2 business days, with priority shipping available. You can also pick up from our Scarborough HQ.Rush shipping available for urgent needs. What are the payment terms? We accept all major credit cards, e-transfers, and offer NET 30 terms for established accounts. Volume discounts start at 5kg orders. Are Genuine Tea’s compostable tea bags certified biodegradable? Yes. Our plant-based pyramid sachets are made from non-GMO PLA and carry DIN EN 13432 and ASTM D6400 certifications, which means they break down in under 90 days in commercial compost—no micro-plastics, ever. Do you Offer Free Shipping? Yes. Free shipping on orders $250 CAD or more anywhere in Canada & the US. Sub-threshold orders have a $15 flat rate. Can I request free tea samples before placing a bulk tea order? Absolutely. Fill out the Wholesale Account form and tick “Send Samples.” We’ll ship a curated tasting kit—loose-leaf, compostable pyramid tea bags, microground latte powders, and a couple of Sparkling Iced Tea Cans—on the house. Can I buy Genuine Tea wholesale outside Canada? We currently ship wholesale orders to the UK, EU, and Asia-Pacific via DHL Express. Duties and VAT are calculated at checkout so there are no surprise fees on delivery.USA orders are shipped through Canada Post– free shipping over $250 or a flat $15 rate. Are all Genuine Tea products organic and ethically sourced? Over 80 % of our catalogue—loose-leaf, matcha, microground powders, and RTD cans—is certified organic. Every origin is farm-direct, with transparent pricing and traceable lot numbers. Still have questions? Email our Partnerships & Account Manager Ramy at ramy@genuinetea.ca for any further wholesale inquiries!

name: Tease Wellness
aboutContent: Blends with Benefits. Tea & botanical essentials for better rituals. DISCOVER TEASE We believe wellness rituals shouldn’t be complicated. That’s why we create functional tea + botanical based essentials that compliment each other and your goals without compromising convenience, sustainability, or impact. the worlds firstFully Biodegradable & Refillable Tea CollectionOur flavour & function filled tea blends are each formulated to support your wellness rituals. From sleep, to calm, focus, and more - We've got you covered.From the outer tube packaging to our plant-based pyramid tea bags, our collection is 100% biodegradable and refillable.We call it kinder to the planet & your wallet. Live & Lead Consciously.Tease creates functional tea and botanical based essentials that support you to live and lead consciously through supporting intentional wellness rituals to create long lasting, positive impact.All formulations are co-created in partnership with an ethical supply chain with inspiration driven by our Tea Sommelier & Herbalist. "I've always been ambitious and I want everyone to have the tools that I found to help reach their full potential."-Sheena Brady, Founder & Tea Sommelier Starting my career in luxury hospitality, I was out to build something big. As a professional wine sommelier and service leader, it was my dream to own a successful restaurant one day.That journey required long hours, sleepless nights, working nights, weekends and holidays.At the time I was surviving off of 5-6 cups of coffee a day which did little to help my already existing anxiety, insomnia, digestion and sleep challenges.I knew I couldn’t keep up at the pace forever, but I wasn’t going to give up. I had to learn new ways to take care of myself so that I could reach my full potential and continue building a career and life that I loved.That's when I was introduced to tea. I found rooibos for sleep,maté for energy, botanicals like moringa to calm my nerves,matcha to give me a boost of antioxidants to keep colds at bay, the list goes on. Each blend I discovered felt like a piece of a puzzle to building my ultimate life.I began sharing my experience, and formulating my own blends with herbs and ingredients that would further enhance the results of the base blend. It was during this time, I became a certified tea sommelier, falling in love with the intersection of functionality & science between tea and botantics.I’m still that same ambitious person I was when I started my career in hospitality, and I want you to have the tools that I found to reach their full potential. In work, in family, in partnership. Everyone deserves the support to live and lead their ultimate lives. That's why we create functional tea and botanical infused essentials at tease.-Sheena Brady, Founder & Tea Sommelier Our impact is rooted in our mission to create Blends with Benefits. Our impact pillars are to: -> Benefit you-> Benefit the Planet-> Benefit Women EntrepreneursVisit our sustainability & impact page to learn about our why, and impact measured within each pillar. Find us IRL Proudly stocked in 600+ retail doors Store Locator Wholesale Program Certified Benefit Corporation:Tease is the first tea company in Canada to become a certified benefit corporation, meeting the highest standards in verified social and environmental impact. learn more Benefiting YouFrom sleep support to focus, energy, confidence, calm, and more. Whatever your goal, we've got you covered. Benefiting the PlanetOur tea packaging is 100% biodegradable + refillable & our pyramid tea bags are made of plant-based fibres, plastic-free, and also fully biodegradable. name: Lovenote Bride
aboutContent: Hey, we're Lovenote We’re the team behind Truvelle, Laudae, and Aesling — and the flagship where you’ll find the complete collections, along with Lovenote exclusives. With boutiques in Vancouver, Calgary, Winnipeg, and Ottawa, our story begins in our light-filled Vancouver atelier, where every gown is designed and handmade. We round out our boutiques with accessories made in-house and sourced from independent, women-owned makers. We celebrate individual style. We put the comfort and confidence of our brides first. And we believe wedding dress shopping should be fun. It’s so good to meet you. Our Brands In 2013, Gaby Bayona founded Truvelle, a bridal line that has since grown into one of Canada’s most beloved names. LAUDAE followed in 2016, bringing a modern edge to Truvelle’s romance, and in 2019 came Aesling, defined by clean lines and architectural simplicity. What began as a solo venture in Gaby’s apartment has, collectively, grown into one of Canada’s largest bridal companies — and one of the few remaining fashion houses that still creates everything in Vancouver. In our 8,500-square-foot atelier, a talented team of cutters, sewers, and checkers bring each gown to life. Through it all, our ethos has stayed the same: bride first, quality first, design first — always. Say Hi We’re not just here to sell you a wedding dress — we’re here to get to know you and celebrate finding "the one". From first visit to final fitting, we’re all about making the experience effortless, personal, and unforgettable. locations Calgary 1211 KENGSINGTON RD NW UNIT #301A — CALGARY AB, T2N 3P6CALGARY@LOVENOTEBRIDE.COM403.475.4177 Book Appointment > Vancouver 235 CAMBIE STREET, MEZZANINE — VANCOUVER BC, V6B 5A4VANCOUVER@LOVENOTEBRIDE.COM604.602.0498 Book Appointment > Winnipeg #130 - 25 FORKS MARKET ROAD — WINNIPEG MB, R3C 4Y3WINNIPEG@LOVENOTEBRIDE.COM204.421.6040 Book Appointment > Ottawa 115 PINHEY ST — OTTAWA ON, K1Y 2Y2OTTAWA@LOVENOTEBRIDE.COM613.680.2310 Book Appointment > Get in touch General Inquiriesinfo@lovenotebride.com Media Inquiriesinfo@oremony.com Careersinfo@lovenotebride.com SocialInstagramTikTokFacebook

name: Eight Ounce Coffee
aboutContent: About Eight Ounce Coffee Eight Ounce Coffee is a company of coffee people passionate about specialty coffee and all the fun gear and equipment that go with it. We started in 2011, mostly selling AeroPress and KeepCups to an emerging crowd of specialty coffee baristas and home coffee enthusiasts. As the market grew, we expanded our line of products considerably. We soon realised that it was difficult for Canadian cafes and roasters to bring in the high end specialty coffee brands that were so easy to get in larger countries. Buying smaller amounts and paying for freight and import made it not worthwhile for them. By bringing in large volume amounts of great quality coffee gear and taking care of the import and logistics, we made it possible to get the best coffee brands into Canadian hands. We're very picky about the brands we sell. We only sell the best quality product in every category - never selling knock-offs or imitations. We support those who innovate, not those who copy. We're now the biggest specialty coffee equipment distributor in Canada, selling to almost four thousand cafes, roasters, hotels, kitchen and lifestyle stores across the country and in America. We also distribute to some of the biggest and best names in specialty coffee around the world. We operate out of a thirty thousand square foot warehouse in Calgary, with team members in Calgary, Montreal and Toronto. We're a huge part of the growing specialty coffee scene in Canada - we help organise and sponsor barista competitions, AeroPress competitions, Brewers Cup and Cup Tasters, and are co-founders of the Prairie Coffee Collective. Nothing makes us more excited than the anticipation of a new cafe opening. We love the community of coffee in Canada - and wouldn't be where we are today without it. These are the awesome people that make up the Eight Ounce Team: Jennifer Farnell - Co-Founder - Wesley Farnell - Co-Founder - Lindsay - Head of Business Development - Josh- Head of Special Projects - Ameya - Head of Operations Optimization - Jason - Head of Procurement - Dale - Head of Online - Dina- Marketing Manager - Nikki- All Things Money - Bjorn- Experiential Marketing - Kolter- Senior Customer Experience Manager - customers@eightouncecoffee.ca Geraldine- Head of Coffee Program - coffee@eightouncecoffee.ca Lakshya- Executive Assistant to Senior Leadership - Mandi- Warehouse Supervisor - Michael- Coffee Program - James - Warehouse Supervisor - AJ- Inventory Manager - Jake - Social Media & Content Creator - Katie- Ontario & Manitoba Wholesale Relationships + Team Lead - katie@eightouncecoffee.ca Nick- Pacific & Prairie Wholesale Relationships - nick@eightouncecoffee.ca Heïdi- Quebec & East Coast Wholesale Relationships - heidi@eightouncecoffee.ca Andrea- Custom Branding Specialist - Ryan- Social Media & Digital Content Administrator - Bailey- Digital Content Creator - Andy- Technical Lead - Tyler- Inventory Manager + Repairs - Jordan- Warehouse Crew & Receiving - McKinnon- Warehouse Weekend Shift Lead - Jesse- Front of House Specialist - George- Front of House Specialist - Felipe- Front of House Specialist - Rachel- Front of House Manager - Lucas- Inventory Control - Maya- RMA Returns - Krystal- Warehouse Crew - Christina- Warehouse Crew - Jenna- Warehouse Crew - Avery- Warehouse Crew - Denys- Warehouse Crew & Storefront Delivery Driver - Darienne- Coffee Program - Bernadette- Warehouse Crew -

name: Blair Nadeau
aboutContent: About Us Blair Nadeau Bridal Adornments was established in 2009, born out of our love of bridal and fashion. We believe that every bride is unique and deserves adornments that are as beautiful and unique as she is. Combining bridal and fashion, we create curated collections of modern and yesteryear inspired accessories. Crafted by hand in our atelier just outside of Toronto, we use the finest and highest quality materials sourced from around the world. Utilizing traditional techniques applied in a modern fashion, we create inspired adornments for the modern bride. All of our designs are made to order, allowing each piece to be given the love and attention it deserves. Every romance has a story and we are so honored to have our adornments play a small part in your story. Thank you for supporting handmade. Our work has been worn by Canadian actresses, gifted to celebrities including Gwen Stefani, Drew Barrymore, Scarlet Johannson and Kortney Wilson from Masters of Flip. We have been featured in British Vogue & Harper's Bazaar, Vogue Italia, and has graced the covers of magazines, newspapers and hundreds of editorial features, in addition to countless top wedding blogs and style blogs. Our work has been staple accessories on all four seasons of the hit CW Television show Reign, Riverdale and Charmed. Blair Nadeau is an award winning designer as Top 10 Bridal Accessory Designers in the World by Wedding Industry Experts and a Top 3 Finalist for the 2014 Canadian Accessory Designer of the Year from the Canadian Wedding Awards. Please visit our Etsy Shop to read our 5 star glowing reviews from our beautiful brides! ♥ "She leaves of path of glitter wherever she goes....." Photo Courtesy of Khristel Studios

name: Honey Candles
aboutContent: Honey Candles is a proud Canadian company that is family owned and operated. With a small staff of skilled employees, we have been perfecting our craft for more than 30 years and are a leading choice for premium handmade 100% pure beeswax candles.Our workshop and office are nestled between the Purcell and Selkirk mountain ranges, just north of Kaslo, on Kootenay Lake. The current owners, Alecia and Stephen, purchased the business from Alecia’s parents in 2016 and have grown the business while maintaining the highest quality standards for both the raw materials and finished products.There is an abundance of opportunities for outdoor recreation right on our doorstep and our staff enjoy being outside during their spare time, whether it’s a scenic hike or puttering in the garden. At Honey Candles we support small business by purchasing supplies locally whenever possible. Our beeswax is sourced from apiaries in Western Canada, and most of our packaging and displays are made in British Columbia using recycled materials.Beeswax candles have long been coveted for their inherent honey scent, and naturally long burning qualities and we pride ourselves on making beautiful candles that you can be proud to own and burn. Meet our team Community Locally we are a member of the Kaslo Chamber of Commerce and a proud... Read more Why Honey Candles They are made only from 100% pure beeswax – the only naturally occurring... Read more Handmade & Sustainable At Honey Candles we believe you shouldn’t have to sacrifice quality and beauty to... Read more

name: Fern Petal
aboutContent: pure, all-natural essential oilslocally blended and packaged with love in Vancouver Hello, from Fern & Petal! We’re a small, family-run business born out of our own fruitless search for high-quality, all-natural products made close to home. We never found what we were looking for, so we created what we wanted! Our products are carefully sourced from sustainable international growers, and handmade and packaged locally in Vancouver B.C. Canada. We want you to feel safe knowing our products are all-natural and of the highest quality. We also believe in sustainability and giving back. That’s why we fund planting one tree for every Fern & Petal order. We’re here to help you feel good, in every sense of the word.Our goal is to create products that are truly natural in every sense. From packaging to ingredients, our products come from nature and must return effortlessly.Katie Derrick, FounderZero dyes. No preservatives. And perfume-free — simply all-natural aromas and highest-quality ingredients. Fern & Petal’s small-batch essential oils, blends, and luxury products come in 100% recyclable packaging, from pulp-paper labels and boxes to refillable and reusable glass rollers and jars. As we harvest Mother Nature’s bounty, we aim to replace what we have taken through our One Tree Planted initiative, where one baby tree is planted every time you make a purchase.

name: Chayle Jewellery
aboutContent: made with loveOur Story“An everyday art piece.”Handmade in Ottawa, Canada Our DesignerChayle Bowen completed her BFA at NSCAD University (Halifax), specializing in metalsmithing, printmaking, and book arts.After graduation, she worked in the jewellery industry as a goldsmith and designer, became a sessional jewellery instructor at the Ottawa School of Art, and completed artist residencies at the Estonian Academy of Arts (Tallinn), Sparkbox Studio (Picton), and Art Engine (Ottawa). Additionally, she completed an internship with Estonian jewellery artist and MA professor Tanel Veenre (Tallinn). Her artist jewellery has been exhibited nationally and internationally in juried shows.Currently, she is owner and designer of “Chayle Jewellery Studio”, established 2013 in Ottawa. Ethics & SustainabilityOur PhilosophyWith a sense of minimalist elegance and ethical vision, Chayle Jewellery is handcrafted in Ottawa, Canada, using only recycled and conflict-free sources of gold and silver, ethically sourced gemstones, and Canadian diamonds. Learn More Made with loveOur StudioEach piece of jewellery produced by Chayle Jewellery, goes through our studio with care and attention to detail. We choose to use a selection of traditional goldsmithing techniques, combined with new technologies like 3D printing, to create a balance between handmade aesthetics and contemporary precision. Artist StatementMy work as an artist goldsmith combines my passions for traditional metalsmithing and minimalist design. I use hammering techniques to create jewellery which flows naturally with the body. The shapes I use are often bold, capturing the negative spaces and contours of the body. For me, it is important to consider the wearer within the design process of my pieces. I enjoy the challenge of creating beauty and elegance while maintaining wearability and sentimentality. With my material choices of precious metals, colourful patinas, and rustic hammer textures, I hope to capture a feelings of ancient jewellery and the romantic notion of a genuine handmade treasure. My current work seeks to create a playful dialogue between traditional and contemporary jewellery, and has become a driving force for my curiosity and creativity as an artistic goldsmith. ~ Chayle Bowen ottawa style magazine"Elegant meets Edgy jewellery" “Capturing the simplicity and modern elegance of hammered precious metals.” Design Inspiration"Influenced by the negative spaces between branches, and the curling and overlapping growth of lichen, I am interested in the geometric qualities and structured chaos within these natural forms. My work in jewellery, uses colour, contour, and layering to emphasize these types of forms and spaces.""Edges and shadows describe, contain, and shape the spaces in my work-- revealing the spaces and the structures that hold them as the subject matter of my work.""The forms and aesthetic in my work are derived from natural inspirations. I have worked to distill the elements of natural forms, searching for the chaotic happenstance of their growth patterns. My current work has become a playful exploration of these form and geometry." SHOWROOM & MEETINGSOur OfficeFilled with natural light, cozy seating, and a cafe, our office is a perfect spot for us to meet with our clients to discuss custom jewellery designs, show samples and gemstones, and for our clients to pickup their finished jewellery. We are located in the westend of Ottawa, in a co-working space called "Head Office". 430 Hazeldean Road, Unit 6 Kanata, ON K2L 2E9Mondays-Fridays 10-4pmSaturdays 10-4pm Book a Meeting

name: Bluboho
aboutContent: our-origin-storybluboho's journey started in 2010 when a pair of determined women were inspired to make a difference in the world of fine jewelry. their vision was inspired by the desire to offer deeply-meaningful jewelry paired with a beautiful, nurturing experience.bluboho's journey started in 2010 when a pair of determined women were inspired to make a difference in the world of fine jewelry. their vision was inspired by the desire to offer deeply-meaningful jewelry paired with a beautiful, nurturing experience.driven by their passion for sustainable jewelry rich in storytelling and a desire to encourage conscious consumerism, they dedicated themselves to crafting something extraordinary. the result is bluboho: raw, refined, sustainable fine jewelry that would mark the most significant milestones in our lives.part of this journey led us to create beloved by bluboho: engagement and wedding jewelry designed for every moment from popping the question to saying “i do”.we specialize in unique sapphire engagement rings and diamond wedding bands, all of which are thoughtfully designed and handmade.our namebluboho: blu as the sea and sky, imparting the notion of endless possibility, boho to celebrate the free-spirited lifestyle our pieces embody.our name is an emblem of who we are and what we do—handmade fine jewelry steeped in storied meaning, grounded in the natural world, alive with spirit and personality.over the years, bluboho has evolved from a name into a love story. it is a brand, a collective, and an experience that finds meaning in connection— to the earth, to each other, and to ourselves— through the moments that define our lives.a note from our founder: the bluboho ethos"we are cosmic beings on a human journey and our lives are created through a series of moments. we believe these moments are our legacy, and we exist to ensure they live on.bluboho was born from a desire to bookmark life's moments. we believe in the magic of connectionand shared experience— that through our jewelry we can celebrate, mourn, share our stories, contemplate the world around us, and connect deeply… because ultimately, that is why we're here."— maggie auroccoenvironmentalismour process is led by a love for the earth: the source of our deepest inspiration and natural materials.we have a deep reverence for the natural world. we have always been inspired by the beauty and magic of nature. we set out to find ways to honour mother earth by telling her stories.our environmentalism is an ongoing practice and conversation, and we are always seeking new ways to innovate. we are always working hard to minimize our impact through all of our actions, big and small.artistry + contemplationeach bluboho piece is designed to embody a symbolic story that inspires a moment of contemplation.between the vendors who source our materials, our in-house designer, gemologist, creative team and production team, and the expert artisans who handcraft each piece, our jewelry is a labour of love born out of creative collaboration.we want our jewelry to become the accent notes that capture your precious memories and tell your life story, adding personal details and nuances to your self-expression.

name: Poppy Finch
aboutContent: In a world overflowing with excess, we believe you should know the origin, the makers, and the meaning behind the jewelry you wear. That’s why we craft pieces that are as intentional as they are beautiful — jewelry made to be worn every day and treasured for a lifetime. Everyday Fine Jewelry, Redefined Founded in 2014 by designer Amanda He, Poppy Finch was created from a desire for fine jewelry that feels modern, timeless, and personal.We keep our entire process close to home. Every piece is designed, crafted, and packaged in our Vancouver head office, allowing us to stay connected to our craft and the community that shapes us.We believe fine jewelry should carry meaning. Our commitment to ethical sourcing, sustainable materials, local craftsmanship, transparency, and enduring design guides every choice we make—from how each piece is created to how it’s meant to be lived in.Poppy Finch began when Amanda couldn’t find a jewelry brand she truly resonated with. Instead of compromising, she reimagined what fine jewelry could be: modern, thoughtfully designed 14K and 18K gold pieces that feel luxurious, approachable, and deeply personal. Amanda is deeply involved in every stage of the process - from initial sketches to final polish - ensuring each design reflects her commitment to quality, sustainability, and modern elegance.Today, Poppy Finch is carried by leading retailers and cherished by jewelry lovers everywhere. LEARN MORE Our Process OUR SERVICES PF CIRCLE

name: Hestia Jewels
aboutContent: Hestia Jewels embodies artisanal craftsmanship and everyday timeless essentials. The name of the brand – Hestia – is named after the ancient Greek goddess of the hearth, architecture, home and family. We are committed to producing beautifully crafted, affordable fine jewelry for women and men to cherish and pass down for generations to come. Proudly Canadian, we design and conceptualize each piece at our Toronto studio and work with leading suppliers to ensure that our unique fine jewelry is accessible without compromising on quality. Staying true to the integrity of our product, we only use graded conflict-free diamonds and precious stones and thrive on representing the ethically responsible fine jewelry industry. Our core value is to capture the happiness and joy that comes with owning a piece of jewelry. We believe that when you wear a Hestia piece, you are representing the feelings, celebrations, and milestones within your life. Empower yourself or surprise a loved one; it is important to us to help capture these treasured moments with a special piece of luxury from our collection. From our heart to yours, we invite you to explore our collection online or to book a private appointment for an intimate shopping experience. CREATIVE DIRECTOR Turkish-Canadian designer Yasemin Mutlu is focused on leaving a mark in the fine jewelry world. Deeply inspired by her Mediterranean roots, family heritage, and the ever surprising nature of precious stones and gems; she has transformed her passion for jewelry collecting and curating into creating timeless pieces that embody sentimental value and everyday wearable luxury. Each piece is a unique yet essential representation of every client’s milestones, celebrations, and lifestyles. Driven to pursue her love of fine jewelry, Yasemin has evolved from being in a advertising and communications background into the world curating and creating fine jewelry. She has studied Gemology and Diamonds at the Gemological Institute of America.

name: Attic
aboutContent: ATTIC BELIEVES IN SIMPLE, TIMELESS DESIGNIt was at goldsmithing school where co-founders Melissa Gobeil and Susan Shaw first forged their dream to build an ethical jewellery brand. Today ATTIC is proudly run by a small team of women goldsmiths and designers in downtown Toronto.ATTIC specializes in creating Unique and natural Canadian diamond engagement rings, modern wedding bands and a collection of timeless solid gold New Classics. Explore ATTIC's sustainability initiatives or book your private appointment today. name: Dean Davidson
aboutContent: Dean Davidson jewelry is constructed with just as much passion and attention to detail as it’s conceptualized. Every piece is meticulously handcrafted and made from the highest quality materials, with a warranty that promises a lifetime of wear. Celebrate every unique corner of the world with DD, where style has no limits and jewelry is always one-of-a-kind. ABOUT DEAN Creating timeless jewelry with a global perspective, Dean Davidson is known for careful craftsmanship, hand-cut gemstones, and a signature brushed finish. Rooted in Canada and inspired by world travels, the brand’s story is as remarkable as the designs themselves.Dean spent his early life on Canada’s vast farmland, surrounded by natural beauty and gifted the freedom to explore. Straying from the norm to follow his innate creativity and knack for entrepreneurship, Dean shifted from a career in agriculture to founding his own jewelry brand. This choice would lead him to travel the globe and adorn prominent figures in his designs.Travel is at the very heart of the Dean Davidson brand -- Balinese basket weaving, the bamboo forest of Kyoto, and Brazil’s otherworldly sand dunes have all served as inspiration, resulting in pieces that encapsulate the wonder gained from Dean's experiences. BEHIND THE ART Dean Davidson jewelry is designed in our Toronto studio. Every piece is hand-sketched in-house and sampled to perfect each design, producing iconic, signature features. Dean partnered with a family-owned workshop of artisans early on in the brand’s foundation. Located in Jaipur, India, a global hub for jewelry manufacturing, the multigenerational workshop specializes in fine jewelry and has created jewelry for the royal family of Jaipur. They cut every gemstone by hand according to Dean’s original designs, marrying time-honored tradition with forward-thinking aesthetics. “What sets us apart is our dedication to creating timeless, classic pieces that transcend trends and age.” - Dean Davidson, CEO + Creative Director SHOP DEAN'S PICKS Plaza Ring Plaza Ring Tiger's Eye $300.00 CAD 375.00 20% OFF 13 colours available Mara Hinged Bangle Mara Hinged Bangle $260.00 CAD Mara Hinged Cuff Mara Hinged Cuff $350.00 CAD 2 colours available Mara Ring Mara Ring $185.00 CAD 2 colours available DOUBLE-SIDED Ipanema Pendant Ipanema Pendant Tiger's Eye $316.00 CAD 395.00 20% OFF 3 colours available Nairobi Statement Chain Nairobi Statement Chain $375.00 CAD 2 colours available View Collection EXPLORE MORE

name: Anne Sportun
aboutContent: Our Story The Designer Meet Anne Seeking a medium for her creativity, Toronto-born artist Anne Sportun began making jewellery as a teenager. She deferred her archeological studies to enroll in a jewellery arts programme where she acquired her formal goldsmithing skills. Anne founded her brand with the opening of her first atelier in the late 1980’s. This was the beginning of a prolific career which continues to evolve. Carrying on the legacy Meet Haley For her daughter Haley, jewellery has been a lifelong inspiration, nurtured by her mother's creativity. Surrounded by the beauty and passion that defined Anne's collections, Haley found herself drawn into the world of fine jewellery by working in the retail store and at trade shows. She admired her mother's craftsmanship and the stories woven into each piece, sparking a curiosity and deepening her interest in the business.Anne entrusted Haley with more responsibilities working with clients for bespoke jewellery including the cherished task of crafting one-of-a-kind engagement rings, a testament to Haley's growing expertise and commitment to excellence. A Mother Daughter Duo Today, Anne and Haley stand together as co-owners of Anne Sportun Fine Jewellery, blending their distinct talents and shared passion for design. Together, they embark on a collaborative journey, drawing inspiration from nature and each other's ideas to create core collections that reflect their combined vision.

name: Pilgram
aboutContent: Sorry, your browser doesn't support embedded videos. From Denmark to Canada The Pilgrim Journey Pilgrim began in 1983 at the heart of Denmark’s vibrant festival scene. Founder Annemette Markvad, driven by her love for art, music, and human connection, created handmade jewelry that reflected her passion for storytelling. Festivals became her canvas—a space to share not just her designs but meaningful exchanges, weaving bonds with every piece sold.What started as a small, heartfelt endeavor quickly grew into something extraordinary. Pilgrim's designs, rooted in Danish minimalism and crafted with care, resonated with people seeking pieces that carried personal meaning. Today, Pilgrim has evolved into a global brand, celebrated for its craftsmanship, authenticity, and commitment to empowering individuality—all while staying true to the values that began under festival skies.The next chapter for Pilgrim began in 2014, when Robert P. Hayes, a Canadian with Gaspésien roots and an upbringing in Ottawa, encountered the brand during his time in Denmark. Inspired by its design and meaningful approach to craftsmanship, Robert brought Pilgrim to Canada, establishing a connection between Danish artistry and Canadian sensibilities. What Makes Pilgrim Extraordinary At Pilgrim, we believe in the extraordinary power of storytelling and craftsmanship. Every collection we create is a testament to artistry and meaning, drawing inspiration from Nordic landscapes, vibrant urban culture, and rich folklore. These influences breathe life into our designs, making each piece more than jewelry—it’s a symbol of connection and expression.The journey of each design begins with a spark of inspiration, evolving through thoughtful sketches and meticulous handcrafting. With over 1,000 unique creations produced annually, each piece is infused with purpose and care. Our "hand & heart-made" philosophy ensures that every item is crafted not only with skill but with genuine emotion, making it extraordinary in its ability to empower individuality and inspire confidence. On A Quest For A Better More Beautiful Tomorrow Sustainability and ethics shape every step of our process. Guided by the "hand & heart-made" philosophy, we focus on creating with care for both people and the planet. As proud members of the UN Global Compact, we align our actions with principles of human rights, responsible production, and environmental stewardship, working towards a greener future.With over 75% of our collections incorporating at least 75% recycled materials, we continue to lead with innovation and responsibility. Sustainable materials and packaging, including recycled plastics and FSC-certified paper, reflect our drive to minimize impact and inspire industry-wide change.Transparency remains at the heart of our efforts, with openness in sharing progress and challenges as we strive for continued improvement. Empowering Individuality Every Pilgrim piece is a celebration of self-expression. Designed to connect with our customers’ stories, each item encourages you to be bold, authentic, and true to yourself. Whether in-store or online, we strive to create personal, thoughtful experiences that inspire. Pilgrim North America Inc. A Proud Canadian Operation Headquartered in Montreal, Pilgrim North America is 100% Canadian-owned, blending Danish artistry with Canadian passion. With operations built on three pillars—wholesale, retail, and ecommerce—we bring our designs to life across the nation.Wholesale partnerships with 260+ independent businesses showcase Pilgrim in 550 retail locations across Canada.Retail stores—nine and growing—provide immersive environments where customers can explore our collections fully.Our team of 96+ dedicated employees is the heart of our operations, ensuring that our values of craftsmanship, sustainability, and connection remain at the forefront.Through strong partnerships with independent retailers and wholesale clients, Pilgrim uplifts local businesses, bringing communities together while staying true to our mission of creating beauty with purpose. A Shared Vision Pilgrim North America Inc. is more than a jewelry company. It’s part of a global movement to celebrate individuality, sustainability, and craftsmanship. With every piece, every story, and every connection, we stay committed to making a positive impact—one hand & heart-made design at a time. OUR JEWELLERY HAND & HEART MADE LEAD & NICKEL FREE DESIGNED FOR SENSITIVE SKIN RECYCLED MATERIALS THICK 14K GOLD & 925 SILVER PLATING RESPONSIBLE PACKAGING SUSTAINABILITY PRODUCTION NORDIC-INSPIRED DESIGN DISCOVER OUR BEST SELLERS OUR SUNGLASSES MADE FROM RECYCLED PLASTIC FROM THE OCEAN EQUIVALENT TO 2.5 PLASTIC BOTTLES PER PAIR UV400 PROTECTED AND POLARIZED PROTECTS FROM 100% OF ALL UV RAYS Shop SUNGLASSES OUR ACTIONS Making a difference is at the core of who we are. Each year, we proudly partner with Doctors Without Borders (Médecins Sans Frontières) to design a special jewellery item that embodies hope and compassion. This annual collaboration helps raise critical funds to support MSF’s lifesaving work. For every MSF jewelry piece sold, $21 is donated directly to MSF, ensuring that your choice makes a tangible impact. Thanks to your support and dedication, Pilgrim has globally donated over $3 million CAD to this extraordinary cause. Through initiatives like our MSF Days in Canada and this annual partnership, we come together as a community to create meaningful change—one piece, one person, and one generous act at a time. LEARN MORE

name: Pearlory
aboutContent: Our Story: Jewelry That Lives Life With You At Pearlory, we craft beautiful, durable jewelry designed to complement every aspect of daily life. We believe high-quality, beautiful jewelry should be accessible without the excessive markups. Like many, we were frustrated with jewelry that couldn’t keep up—favorites that tarnished, faded, or broke from constant wear, and pieces that were too precious to risk wearing every day. Now you can say goodbye to care instructions—our pieces are designed to be worn everywhere. In the shower, at the gym, at the office, by the pool, and even while sleeping. Built to last through every moment, each piece is hypoallergenic, waterproof, sweatproof, and cosmetic-friendly. Our mission is simple: worry-free jewelry for every moment. We are a Canadian-owned business, with fulfillment centres in both Canada and the U.S. to help our customers avoid fees and duties. Made to Last, Made for You We’ve taken inspiration from the durability techniques of Swiss watchmakers to create jewelry that lasts. Using advanced PVD real-gold plating—the same process trusted by luxury brands like Chanel—we make highly resilient pieces that won’t fade or lose color. Pearlory’s PVD real-gold plating ensures longevity without compromising our planet’s health. Our jewelry is crafted from hypoallergenic, medical-grade stainless steel, so you can say goodbye to rust, tarnish, and irritation. Unlike other brands that rely on copper or brass, Pearlory’s stainless steel is as sweatproof as it is rust-resistant, designed to be worn every day, everywhere. Our mission is simple: to bring you affordable, long-lasting jewelry you can rely on, whatever your style or budget. THE BASE Instead of cheap, corruptible metals like copper and brass that corrode and tarnish, we use premium, hypoallergenic, 100% recyclable stainless steel—extremely resistant to moisture, chemicals, and heat. THE COATING Crafted with an eco-friendly PVD gold plating process trusted by renowned brands like Rolex and Chanel—our jewelry is made to last. The result? Hypoallergenic, fade-resistant, waterproof, and sweatproof pieces you can rely on every day. THE COMMITMENT Our plating process avoids harmful chemicals, reduces water use, and minimizes waste. By focusing on durable, hypoallergenic materials and eco-conscious packaging, we’re helping to break the cycle of fast fashion with jewelry that’s gentle on the planet and made to last. Shop Now

name: Suetables
aboutContent: Our Story At Suetables, we believe jewelry is more than just an accessory-it's a way to tell your story. Each piece marks a moment, a memory, a milestone. Whether it's a quiet reminder of strength or a celebration of who you are, our designs are made to be worn with meaning. Our collection is curated to house Suetables-branded original jewelry designs, product collaborations with like-minded creators, and soulful brands with whom we share a philosophy of delivering happiness, connection, and support for self-expression to our community- one charm at a time. Proudly Canadian and independently owned, Suetables is a testament to the creative spirit of women in business. We are here for the storytellers, the seekers and those who embrace life on their own terms. From small wins to big moments, your jewelry should reflect you. Our Founder Suetables began in 2005 as a passion project by founder + CEO Sue Henderson, a stay-at-home mom looking for a creative and meaningful outlet. What started as hand-stamping words onto vintage spoons for baby gifts soon evolved into something more personal—etching her sons' initials onto pendants to keep them close to her heart. As friends began requesting their own personalized pieces, the vision grew. From simple hand-stamped charms to a full jewelry line, Suetables was built on the idea of using words and symbols to tell stories and express personal truths. Today, Suetables has grown from a home-based business into a thriving retail brand with multiple storefronts and a global e-commerce presence. Suetables have been worn by icons like Meghan Sussex and are featured in FASHION, Marie Claire, Harper's Bazaar and People Magazine. While the brand has expanded, our mission remains the same: to create quality jewelry that helps people share their stories and carry meaning in a beautiful, wearable form.

name: Vitaly
aboutContent: Your browser does not support the video tag. ENGINEERED ACCESSORIES Genderless Staples and Contemporary Statements. Made for the Future with Recycled Stainless Steel. Established in 2011, Vitaly is an experimental accessory design studio based in Toronto. With a future-looking approach to design, Vitaly produces engineered staples and contemporary statements constructed from stainless steel - the most recycled material on the planet. Vitaly’s genderless collection is inspired by nostalgic clubwear and the industrial manufacturing process itself. With close ties to club music and the subcultures that surround it, Vitaly’s unique brand of bold statement pieces are tools for self-expression. Shop Now

name: Par Ici
aboutContent: Eve Tobolka and Alynne Lavigne first bonded over a shared obsession with vintage jewellery at parties and running into each-other in elevators at their university co-op building. Together, they collected and sold vintage jewellery in Toronto, New York and LA. Very naturally, the amassed vintage helped inspire the first jewellery collection Eve and Alynne designed together, PAR ICI is a Toronto based jewellery brand that values versatility, individuality, fun, and quality. All pieces are made in Toronto, and some of them have found their way to the pages of international Vogues, W Magazine, Elle, among many others.PAR ICI is grateful to live and work on the Treaty Lands and Territory of the Mississaugas of the Credit and the traditional territory of the Anishinaabe, the Wendat, and the Haudenosaunee.

name: Mackenzie Jones
aboutContent: Our Story Megan Mackenzie Jones was born an artist. There was never a doubt, even from a young age, that she would imagine her own path and follow her creative spirit. In her formative years she travelled across Canada and fell in love with every corner of our nation. Her creative spirit led her to attend the Alberta College of Art + Design and major in Jewellery + Metals where she graduated with honours. Inspired by Canadian flora and fauna, Megan was set on a path to start her own business after graduation. While working as a landscaper Megan balanced work and creativity. Slowly growing her tools and studio into a small workspace in the basement. Hard work and the great out doors have been two constants no matter where life takes her. While playing around in the studio, Megan made the first mountain ring. Inspired by the need to capture that feeling of home, and to carry it with you always. This changed the trajectory and everything started to fall into place. The first Mountain Maid came to be. Megan fulfilled her dream of having a full in house casting studio, by building it from the ground up. The studio became a safe haven and made room to expand the team. We call it our little slice of heaven, complete with everything one needs to create. Growing the team was our biggest adventure. Sharing in passions, dreams and creativity has been one of the most fulfilling parts of Mackenzie Jones. One can always be inspired when surrounded by such powerful and beautiful souls. Mackenzie Jones has grown through an amazingly supportive community. This has allowed us to follow our dreams and to give back to the community. We pride ourselves in fostering positive progress within ourselves, our business and our community.

aboutContent: Sustainable Jewellery With Meaning SHOP TALISMANS Sterling Silver Collection SHOP NOW 14k Gold Collection SHOP NOW Pyrrha x Wicked: For Good SHOP COLLECTION MADE IN CANADAWe create talismans that carry deep personal meaning for those who wear them. name: Freshfield Supplements
aboutContent: Born for the Outdoors. Built to Protect It.Freshfield was created for people who’d rather be outside—riding, surfing, hiking, or just soaking in the view.We believe performance nutrition should help you go further without trashing the planet.Most brands don’t get it. We do. That’s why every Freshfield product is:100% plant-basedPlastic NegativeCarbon NeutralPackaged in plant-based (and often compostable) materialsFueling your body shouldn’t come at the planet’s expense. Not Just Better Products. A Better Way. Built for Every Kind of AdventurerWe’re here for everyday adventurers—weekend riders, sunrise surfers, after-work hikers—not just pro athletes. No gatekeeping, no hype, just performance fuel you’ll actually use. Omega-3 Without the CatchOur omega-3 supplements come from algae, not fish—because protecting your brain shouldn’t mean overfishing our oceans. Good for your body. Better for marine life. Planet-Forward ProteinWe turn upcycled barley and rice into a protein powder that actually tastes great, mixes smooth, and helps you recover faster—without trashing the places you love to explore. Packaging That Won't Outlive the GlaciersWe skip fossil fuels wherever possible, opting for plant-based (and often compostable) packaging. It's not perfect yet, but we're committed to progress, transparency and reducing our impact. Tested Outdoors, Supported by ScienceFreshfield formulas aren’t just made for the lab—they’re built for muddy trails, salty waves, and gritty weekend adventures. Field-tested by people like you and backed by real science, they work in the wild places you actually explore. A Movement, Not Just a Supplement BrandFreshfield isn’t just something you buy—it’s something you join. Every product supports a bigger mission: protecting the outdoors, fighting plastic pollution, and lowering your footprint. For the Dirtbags, Dreamers, and Weekend WarriorsFreshfield isn't here for the influencer hype or the clinical wellness crowd. We're here for people like you:Mountain bikers chasing sunset lapsSurfers paddling out before sunriseTrail runners who run out of trailCampfire philosophers and creek-jumpersEco-conscious explorers who actually give a damnIf that sounds like you, you're already one of us. A Letter From Our Co-FounderTo the adventurers, explorers and athletes out there who want to help save the planet but feel hopeless or powerless: We hear you because we are you.Reflecting on the past few years living with my family in a mountain town in British Columbia, we've seen heat records broken, friends houses lost to forest fires, and are wrapping up a winter season with historically low snowpack. With mountain bike season approaching, we are anticipating another tough summer. It has been weird to say the least. Is this the future I want for my 2-year old son? Not at all. I never thought that I'd have to tell him that we can't go outside today because the smoke is too bad but this seems to be what people are calling the "new normal".Is there hope? It is hard to feel hopeful when it seems like us humans can't even agree on "Is climate change real?" Here's the thing. I know that you care (you've read this far!) and I know that I care so we're not alone in our concern for the future. Let's take action and make what seems impossible possible. Can we stop what’s coming? Hopefully. If you and I and all our friends who give a shit work together — like actually work together on these hard things — I believe we can protect the places and activities we love. Freshfield is here to help you and I do the fun stuff and the hard stuff: Adventure, explore and perform while radically lowering our impact on the planet for the sake of future generations.Michael Mazur, Co-founder (March 25, 2024) Supplements May 26, 2025 0 comments Plant-based, Fish-Free Omegas, Two Ways: Which Softgel Fits Your Life? Can’t decide between Freshfield’s Vegan Omega 3 and Ocean Saving Omega? Both are algae-grown and planet-positive, but they diverge in potency and how your body absorbs them. This guide breaks down rTG vs EE (burp-free comfort vs high-octane dose), clarifies who should take which, and gives you a no-BS rule of thumb—so you can fuel your brain and protect the ocean in one smart swallow. Read more BrainwashingSupplements May 23, 2025 0 comments From Brewery Waste to Breakfast Shake Breweries worldwide generate ≈ 39 million t of brewer’s spent grain (BSG) every year; the beer industry’s largest by-product stream. Most of it becomes low-value cattle feed or landfill, even though BSG still contains 15–26% protein rich in essential amino acids. Read more Brainwashing May 06, 2025 0 comments Yes, you really can help save the ocean. Ditch the dolphin-destroying myth. We reveal how nearly 20 % of the world’s wild fish become fish-oil pills—and how swapping to algae omegas lets you fuel your brain while feeding whales, not factories. One tiny switch; seriously massive ocean impact. name: Big Bear Trading Company
aboutContent: Locally owned and operated, a mountain lifestyle premier shopping experience.Located in the Canadian Rockies, we created an experience to reflect the great outdoors and awe inspiring setting in which we are located, with the philosophy that we are more than just a store. Each detail and design feature are curated to stand out from the crowd, but most importantly to capture the the beautiful mountain surroundings that we call home. We’re proud to call ourselves a premiershopping experience, and we'd love for you to come and see why. MEET THE FAMILY BEHIND BIG BEAR TRADING COMpanyChelsea and Jon moved to Canmore in 2014 and quickly fell in love with the community and mountain culture. Inspired by the magnificence of the Canadian Rockies and its wildlife, we opened our first Big Bear Trading Co location in Banff in June 2021, during the pandemic. After an incredibly strong response, we brought a second location to Canmore in October 2022. Not only are we locally owned and operated,we’re also a family business. The Cudmore family has been in retail for 111 years! Originally from Prince Edward Island, the family business began with Thomas Roy Cudmore, Chelsea's great grandfather, as a Haberdashery and followed with her grandfather, Brian. The business continued with Chelsea’s parents,Chris and Beryl Cudmore, who pivoted to resort retail in 2001. Now Chelsea, and her brother Devon lead the family business. Curated Collection of Mountain INspired Apparel & GiftsWe’ve carefully chosen a collection of products that reflect the mountain lifestyle of the Canadian Rockies. With our merchandise and product selection we believe our guests will take their travel memories home, whether that be from our local artists' selection, mountain inspired gifts, or our Big Bear Trading Co branded apparel. We truly have something for everyone. Take a seatRelax in front of the fireplace. Whether you are exhausted after a great hike, or just waiting for your shopping partner to choose their favourite new hoody, our fireplace seating area is a great spot to take a break. the outdoors, inLike many of our design features, we want you to enjoy the natural surroundings even when you're indoors.At every turn, features like our antler chandelier, river stone fireplace and our favourite bear greeting you at the door. designed to stand outOur Big Bear Trading Co designs featured alongside our complete range of mountain inspired apparel and gifts.Curated to stand out from the crowd, whilst reflecting the beautiful surroundings that we call home, there's adventure in everything we do. Where to find usBanff & Canmore, Alberta209 Banff Ave, Banff, Alberta837 Main Street, Canmore, Alberta Directions Testimonials Wow. Popped into this new shop in Banff and was blown away. Treasures everywhere and practical fun items I haven't been able to buy locally. Beautiful beeswax wrap. Fabulous washcloths and great household style gifts I always like to have on hand. Make this a stop while you shop Banff. Local love, owned and operated by a young local family who have done a great job in serving the needs and must have for residents and visitors.Nancy DaDalt This is an incredibly cute store! After shopping around in downtown Banff you quickly realize a lot of the stores sell the exact same items so shopping gets boring really fast. However, this store sells very cute products. They have awesome designs on their shirts and sweaters and they’re very soft and comfy to wear. They come in preshrunk cotton so you don’t have to worry about buying a size up either. This store is also dog friendly so feel free to bring your pups in. While browsing I encourage you to check out their fitting room. The hanging chair is so fun. They also have great mugs and dish towels, along with notebooks and other accessories.One impressive thing to note is how the employees stock the store. Everything is meticulously folded and organized from xsmall to xlarge. You will definitely leave with something when you come here.Trucchi Retail Council of Canada 2023 Excellence Awards FinalistWe're proud finalists of the Retail Council of Canada 2023 Excellence Awards for In-Store Experience & Design.

name: Centex
aboutContent: How we purchase the fuel helps us provide our customers with great prices. At Centex, we keep fuel prices competitive, offer convenient locations, and deliver services for people on the go—making us a refreshing alternative to the big brands. As an independent chain, we’re free to shop around daily and find the best deals on fuel, so we can pass those savings on to you. Starting from a single location in Inglewood in 1986, Centex has grown to more than 150 locations across Canada What’s in your Tank? At Centex, we’re committed to bringing you high-quality, Canadian-refined fuel designed for all driving conditions—especially the tough Canadian winters. Our fuel meets or exceeds all federal and provincial standards, so you can trust you’re fueling up with quality. Premium Fuel: Enjoy high-performance fuel with an octane rating of 91 or higher, just like major retailers but at a better price! Compare and see the difference in your wallet. Diesel: We offer ultra-low sulfur diesel for all on-road diesel vehicles, from passenger cars to commercial trucks. Our clean fuel is free from additives that can clog injectors or harm diesel engines, ensuring smoother, more reliable performance. Fuel up with confidence at Centex!

name: Milk And Memories
aboutContent: Our Story Hi there! My name is Magan, I am the owner, founder and creator behind Milk and Memories. Thank you so much for visiting our website! We would love for you to join our community on Facebook, Instagram, and TikTok! Who are we?I am a wife to an amazing husband and father, we have two beautiful children. I have always been a bit of an entrepreneur, I’ve dabbled in a few small businesses and finally found my love in creating. I have had a successful crafting business since 2017. I am also an Educational Assistant with my local school board. When I am not working I can be found enjoying time with my family creating as many memories as possible. How it all startedAs most breastfeeding mothers my journey was a rollercoaster of emotions. With my son I had goals of exclusively pumping for a year. It was a lot of work and unfortunately, I ended up losing my supply when he was 3 months old. When I had my daughter, we were able to latch! I was determined to make it much longer. We powered through mastitis more than once, low supply, and other hurdles along the way. We made it to two years of breastfeeding! When it was time for her to wean it was such an emotional struggle for me to stop. I heard of breastmilk jewelry and new I wanted a piece made one day to commemorate this empowering and emotional chapter. I kept a bottle in my freezer for when I could afford to buy the perfect ring.Four years after my breastfeeding journey ended my husband decided that he was going to surprise me with a breastmilk ring. Unfortunately for him the plans fell through. Luckily, for me I have been a crafty person with a successful crafting business for the past 5 years and his thoughtfulness set the plans in motion for my researching how to make my perfect ring! After some extensive research I finished my ring, and it was more beautiful than I had imagined! I then got to work on making myself and my family a few beautiful memorial pieces. I decided to offer these special keepsakes to others as I just cannot keep these meaningful pieces to myself. What we doHere at Milk and Memories we help you to preserve your precious memories by encasing them into beautiful jewelry pieces. We use a variety of inclusions from breastmilk to ashes and so much more in between. Let me help you create your special keepsake, I promise to treat your inclusions with the highest of respect and love while creating your piece and in the packaging of your completed keepsake. Subscribe to our emails Subscribe to our mailing list for insider news, product launches, and more.

aboutContent: The vision of 2UNDR™ was simple. Inspired by the kangaroo pouch, we set out to create a high-performance men’s athletic underwear, with the versatility of everyday use.
