name: Kerrs Candy
aboutContent: Kerr’s was founded in 1895 by brothers Edward and Albert Kerr. After emigrating from Scotland, they opened a candy shop in St. Thomas, Ontario. Known for its quality and rich heritage, Kerr’s is an industry leader in Canadian confectionery. Today, Kerr’s products are still manufactured in Ontario at the head office in Oakville. Our team focuses on creating candy suitable for all Canadians. The Kerr’s factory is peanut free, tree-nut free and gluten free. We also produce many products that are suitable for kosher or halal diets, as well as sugar reduced diets.

name: Ganong
aboutContent: Ganong Bros. Limited is proudly located in St. Stephen, New Brunswick, Canada. Our modern facility is state-of-the-art with both nut and nut-free operations. We welcome inquiries from wholesale customers, retailers, and representatives of companies interested in contract pack manufacturing. Bryana Ganong – President & CEO Bryana joined the family business as a Marketing Assistant in 1997. She rose through the ranks and has held numerous management positions at Ganong Bros. Limited, exposing her to many facets of the business. In 2014 she moved into the role of President & CEO, and is the fifth generation of her family to hold this position. Bryana is active in the community with her children. She has volunteered through the P.A.L.S. mentoring program and is currently a Board Member of the Food & Consumers Products of Canada, Wallace McCain Institute Advisory Committee, member of the New Brunswick Business Council, and has also participated in the Agri-Food Economic Strategy Table as a Table member. Nicholas Ganong – Chief Operating Officer For the past 16 years, Nick, a fifth-generation family business member, has held many positions at Ganong spanning many aspects of the business. Nick joined the Company in 2003 after completing his Business degree and has worked in HR, production planning, supply chain management, Operations and VP Sales & Business Development. He is a former member of the AHSC Region 2 Health Board; conference member for the 2008 Governor Generals Canadian Leadership Conference and a former Vice President of Enterprise Charlotte. Nick is currently the Co-Chair of Economic and Social Inclusion Corporation. Joe Lacey, CPA, CA – Chief Financial Officer Joe is a Chartered Professional Accountant, who joined Ganong as the Director of Finance in October 2015. Prior to Ganong, Joe worked in the public accounting practices of Deloitte and Grant Thornton, was a facilitator and tutor for CPA Canada’s In-Depth Tax Program, and also held the position of Tax Audit Manager with Irving Oil. Joe is a proven leader with a history of mentoring and building strong teams with a focus on continuous improvement. Heather Estey, Chief Experience Officer & Corporate Secretary Heather joined the Ganong team in September 2015, holding a number of increasingly senior roles since that time, joining the Executive Team in 2021. Heather has a proven track record of building solid relationships with internal and external partners. She takes pride in providing the best experience possible for Ganong Staff and Consumers through her responsibilities leading the HR & Safety Team, overseeing direct-to-consumer sales through the Chocolatier and online stores, and Corporate Governance in her role as Corporate Secretary. She is a Trustee of the Ganong Shared Risk Pension and represents the company as a Board Member on the local economic development agency ‘Future St. Stephen’. In addition, Heather is active in her community, representing Ganong as the Chocolate Museum Chair, Chocolate Fest Chair, and Co-Chair of the Fall Fair at Ganong Nature Park. Sales Offices Head Office Ganong Bros., Limited One Chocolate Drive St. Stephen, New Brunswick Canada, E3L 2X5 Tel.: (506) 465-5600 Fax: (506) 465-5610 Office Hours: 8:30 to 5:00pm (AST), Monday – Friday Modern Slavery Act Report Our Commitment to Ethical Practices At Ganong, we believe in maintaining the highest standards of integrity and transparency in all aspects of our business. As part of our dedication to ethical practices, we are committed to ensuring that modern slavery and human trafficking do not occur within our operations or supply chains. This report outlines the steps we have taken and continue to take to combat these serious issues, reflecting our ongoing commitment to ethical business conduct and social responsibility. Read our full Modern Slavery Act Report We do not sell directly to our consumers through our sales office. If you would like to place an order for any of our confectionery, please do so through the Ganong Chocolatier or visit a retailer of Ganong products near you.

name: Peace By Chocolate
aboutContent: MEET THE FAMILY BEHIND PEACE BY CHOCOLATE This is Our Story FROM SYRIA TO ANTIGONISH For nearly 30 years we created and shipped our specialty treats all over the Middle East and Europe.Like much of our homeland, in late 2012 the original Hadhad family chocolate factory in Damascus, Syria was destroyed in a bombing that forced our family to leave everything behind and flee to Lebanon.For three years we found ourselves as refugees with little opportunity or hope. Our lives had been forever altered and we dreamed of being able to once again live lives we could love. When our family was invited to Canada, our dreams came true. REBUILDING With the support of our new community of Antigonish and the people of Nova Scotia, we have rebuilt our chocolate company and are once again doing the work we love. Since Peace By Chocolate was founded at the beginning of 2016, we have been fortunate to share our passion for chocolate with new friends in our community of Antigonish, with people all across the province of Nova Scotia, and now around the world. PEACE BY CHOCOLATE TODAY Our desire for excellence is apparent in every piece of chocolate we produce. We passionately combine a blend of Syrian fillings and ingredients, including nuts, fruit, and spices, creating a little taste of heaven in every sweet.Inside each Peace By Chocolate product is uncompromising quality, with each chocolate a little work of art in and of itself, exuding sophistication, style and excellence. We encourage you to try our chocolate soon because, after all, One Peace Won't Hurt™. View Theatres and Movie News WORDS FROM OUR CEO Tareq Hadhad VISIT US IN PERSON Artisan Chocolate on the Halifax WaterfrontIf you’re craving locally made chocolate, look no further than The Queen’s Marque on the Halifax Waterfront!In Antigonish you can visit us where it all started after we arrived in Canada. FIND A LOCATION

name: Mordens Chocolate
aboutContent: About A Sweet Family Tradition Handcrafting the finest chocolates and confections since 1959 Creating Memories Since 1959 At Mordens’ of Winnipeg, we are passionate about providing top quality, delicious products to our customers. As a family-owned and operated business, we pride ourselves in selecting premium ingredients and producing the finest chocolates and confections. We would like to thank all of our loyal customers for making Mordens’ of Winnipeg a family tradition for 60 years and counting. Timeline 1959 Mordens’ of Winnipeg opened its doors in 1959, when Blake and Shirley Morden founded Winnipeg’s first chocolate-making business. With a little training, a lot of hard work and endless determination, Blake and Shirley built Mordens’ into a beloved confectionary destination. In the early days, the entire Morden family worked side by side to build the business. Blake and Shirley were supported immensely by Blake’s parents, Fred Sr. and Lily. Blake and Shirley’s children, Cara, Shannon, and Fred, joined the family business as soon as they were old enough to fold a peanut brittle box. 1984 The Mordens’ passion for quality drove them to innovate. In 1984, Mordens’ Signature Russian Mints won top prize for Best Chocolate Piece at the World Fair in New Orleans. The Mordens’ were among the first candy manufacturers to produce chocolate covered jujubes and chocolate covered ginger, both of which are customer favourites to this day. 2007 Mordens’ of Winnipeg won the Excellence Award by the North American Packaging Association for the superior design, uniqueness and functionality of their cube box packaging. 2019 Mordens’ of Winnipeg celebrated their 60th anniversary and won Company of the Year for Industry Excellence by Food and Beverage Manitoba. Today Four generations later, the innovation and passion for quality continues. The Morden family now produces over 70 varieties of chocolates, confections and nuts.

name: Penningtons
aboutContent: Our Story Proudly Canadian since 1948 Penningtons is Canada's premiere destination for plus-size fashion, ranging from sizes 12 to 32. At our core, we believe that women deserve to experience the freedom that comes with feeling confident in their clothing. For over 70 years, we've honed our craft resulting in an incomparable fit found only at Penningtons. Experience the signature Pennfit expertise through our extensive selection of wide-width footwear, denim, lingerie, activewear and much more. What We Stand For Join us in championing body diversity and size inclusivity as we empower one another. Because when women feel free to be themselves, the world is always better for it. #PennGals Women who support, uplift and advocate for one another. Through our social media platforms, we've built a safe space that welcomes you to be your most authentic self. Join the community The Penn Project is all about our collective efforts to support and strengthen the communities we’re part of. Big or small, it is a means to empower and inspire. name: Lustre
aboutContent: About Lustre Lustre is an atelier in Montreal QC, established in 2006. Yasmine Wasfy, designer and founder, creates her clothes with a focus on body positivity, size inclusivity, sustainability, and ethical practices. Lustre provides custom garment creation for brides and wedding parties (mother of the bride, mother of the groom, bridesmaids, wedding guests), evening and event wear, cocktail dresses, loungewear, tops, pants, skirts, and jumpsuits. Whether you’re looking for something to wear every day (at home or the office) or to a special event, Lustre offers well-tailored and fabulous fitting clothes. A small and intimate company, Lustre has a team of eight people. On the clothes-creation side, you have Yasmine, the designer; Alex, studio assistant (Yasmine’s right-hand-person for 13 years, give or take); Hy, a sewer (who’s been with us for 10 years); Christina, a sewer; and Chiakoun, our newest member and second studio assistant. On the online-creation side, there is Rin, the photographer; Jess, the makeup and hair artist and artistic visionary for the front window installations; Katherine, the copywriter, website designer, and head of outreach. (Want to know more about our stellar team? Click here!) We also have three part-time workers for extra support when we need it. Just because we’re small doesn’t mean we’re not mighty, and the quality of our output speaks volumes about the skills, work ethic, and passion of every person on the team. Everything Lustre is made here in Montreal by people earning a living wage. In looking through our photos, you might notice the veritable variety of bodies. We want people of all shapes, colours, and abilities to feel good in our clothes. Body-positivity and size-inclusivity are pillars of Lustre designs. Standard sizing in fashion excludes many, and Lustre always strives to be an open, welcoming, and safe space for one and all. Ready-to-wear items are made in a wide range of sizes, while we will always work with you to create a custom-fit piece. Yasmine has built her size chart based on years of experience with real people tailoring to her clients. Please take a look at our size chart and measurements for a clear idea of what off-the-rack sizes are available. Custom options and tailoring are always available if the size chart doesn’t speak to you.

name: Biko
aboutContent: About THE BRANDBIKO is a modern jewelry brand designed and handcrafted with love by a small team in Toronto, led by founder Corrine Anestopoulos. Inspired by nature, contemporary art, architecture and travel, BIKO is known for its high level of craftsmanship, luxe materials and timeless, sculptural aesthetic. Since launching BIKO in 2005, Corrine has collaborated with retailers such as Nordstrom and Hudson's Bay Company, celebrities such as M.I.A. and Bianca Andreescu, and international corporations such as Mattel for Barbie's 60th Anniversary. BIKO has graced the pages of Vogue, Rolling Stone, ELLE and InStyle, and remains focused on giving back through ongoing partnerships with charitable organizations, such as RETHINK Breast Cancer and Second Harvest.BIKO is honoured to be nominated for the (CAFA) Canadian Arts & Fashion Accessory Designer of the Year Award for the last six consecutive award years - 2018, 2019, 2020/21 and 2022, 2023, and 2024. THE DESIGNERBorn and raised in Toronto, Corrine is inspired by contemporary design and exotic heirlooms from around the world. Behind the brand for eighteen years, Corrine has become an inspirational entrepreneur, mentor and colleague to many creative businesses in North America. Corrine graduated in 2005 with a Bachelor of Design in Image Arts from Toronto Metropolitan University. Her artistry marries symbolic design elements and a keen attention to detail with sleek mixed metals, hand-cast forms & natural stones, creating high-quality, versatile pieces that share a story.As Corrine continues to expand BIKO to retailers worldwide, she hopes to feed her love of the hunt for exciting new sources and inspiration by travelling often. With every piece she creates, both modern and timeless, she looks forward to continuing to share her artistry and bring everyday beauty to her customers' lives.

aboutContent: WELCOME TO LA VIE EN ROSE WELCOME TO LA VIE EN ROSE Experts in lingerie, swimwear and loungewear since 1985. BRAND MISSION BRAND MISSION We celebrate women through products that provide comfort to their everyday moments while making shopping for lingerie, sleepwear and swimwear easier. BRAND PROMISE BRAND PROMISE We offer a complete selection of carefully crafted intimates that feel good to wear, with a bit of real talk on the side.​ BRAND PROMISE We offer a complete selection of carefully crafted intimates that feel good to wear, with a bit of real talk on the side.​ BRAND BELIEF BRAND BELIEF We believe that each woman is unique and that attention to detail is what makes a product high quality.​ BRANDPURPOSE BRAND PURPOSE A place where lingerie fits both your body and spirit. Where comfort is felt in every fiber, and in the heart and mind. Together, we can get through the hard days, brighten the slow days, and celebrate your best days. Because buying a bra, a swimsuit or pajamas should be a treat, not a task. We will make it easier and more enjoyable for you. So, pull up a chair and stay a while. Let's be comfortable talking about it. There's no need to hold back. Here, we will always get it.Here, we will always get you. We are la Vie en Rose,Simply closer to you. name: Kotn
aboutContent: For Lasting Ways of LifeA world of timeless designs that honour the people who make them and the places they’re made.Kotn started with a simple—and in retrospect, naive—goal to create the perfect t-shirt. A shirt that didn’t compromise on quality, price, or the integrity of the people who made it. Today, we’re a certified B Corporation voted Best for the World™, with the fourth-highest B Impact Score of apparel brands in North America. With each order, we invest in the creation of jobs, infrastructure, systems, and education to alleviate poverty and create shared, sustainable growth for the communities we are part of.Video by Adrian AssoufiThe idea for Kotn was dreamt up during a hot New York summer by three friends, our Co-founders, Ben, Mackenzie, and Rami. Spurred on by the thought, Rami took a trip back to his familial home of Egypt where he found himself living in a cotton-farming community in the Nile Delta for six months. There, the first real seed of Kotn was planted.

name: Naked & Famous Denim
aboutContent: Our story No washes. No distressing. Just raw denim from Japan, cut and sewn in Canada, built to last — and fade on your terms. vision We're a bit obsessed with denim—okay, maybe a lot obsessed. But that's because we are committed to sourcing and crafting only the most unique and exceptional denim fabrics from prestigious Japanese mills. These mills aren’t just fancy—they’re legendary. They blend old-school heritage with modern methods and practices. So much culture and history is poured into the fabric so that it can be appreciated by the denim purist. Our approach is straightforward: we keep denim raw, authentic, and free from unnecessary embellishments or treatments. That means no pre-distressing, no flashy embroidery, and no fancy washes. We skip the celebrity endorsements and expensive ad campaigns, investing instead in quality fabrics and precise construction to deliver the best denim at accessible prices. And here’s something we’re super proud of: every single pair of our jeans is cut, sewn, and finished right here in Canada. Always have been, always will be. That's the gist, but if you're curious to know more about our journey, our roots, and what makes us tick—keep reading. We are not a normal denim brand And we never will be. We develop crazy things and fabrics no one asked for — but everyone talks about. Cut, made, and sewn in Canada. Our history2008: LAUNCHWe launched to challenge the premium denim industry—no celebrities, no gimmicks, no washes. Just the world’s best Japanese selvedge, made in Canada, and priced honestly. Brandon Svarc, a third-generation garment maker from Montréal, set the tone: obsessive about fabric, allergic to nonsense, and ready to have fun. Our history2011: First StoreWe launched our first store, Tate + Yoko, right here in Montreal—where the garment industry shaped the city and our roots run deep. Our head office stands in the heart of what was once the needle trade’s core. While most of the industry faded, we stayed. Every product is still made in Canada, and this space lets us share the full Naked & Famous Denim lineup alongside other brands we admire. Our history2012: World RecordWe launched the 32oz Super Heavyweight denim—the heaviest jeans ever produced at the time. Woven in Okayama, Japan, on vintage shuttle looms, this denim used yarns as thick as those found in carpets or sailboat sails. The production was so demanding that only two pairs could be made per day, each requiring the skill of three machine operators. Brandon Svarc, joked, “Guaranteed uncomfortable or your money back.” Our history2015: NIPPON BLOOMIn 2015 Naked & Famous Denim launched the Made in Japan series and with it a new logo. This logo dubbed “Flower of Carnage” is a Japanese Manga-esque rendition of the original Naked & Famous Denim “Tragic Blond” pop art logo. Our history2018: Hello SohoWe needed a U.S. home that could carry everything we make—every fit, fabric, and experiment—and SoHo was the obvious choice: high traffic, denim-literate customers, and global visibility. We built our New-York City flagship store our way, with Japanese raw denim floor tiles that fade underfoot, indigo-dyed counters, and boro-lined change rooms. There’s even a secret door behind antique Kokeshi dolls. Our history2025: HEAVIEST EVERFrom the start, we’ve chased heavyweight denim—18oz, 19oz, 21oz, 24oz, 26oz—culminating in our 32oz record-breaker. When others went heavier, we went all in: the 40oz Super Heavyweight Selvedge. Woven in Okayama on modified shuttle looms, it was so dense it took multiple operators days to sew one pair. Finished with 30oz cowhide patches, elk sinew stitching, copper rivets, and WALDES zippers. OriginsNaked & Famous Denim - Why though? The backstory behind our nameWe're a fun, tongue-in-cheek name, poking fun at 'Hollywood' and 'Glamour' celeb brands! from a to z Raw denim find your perfect pair Fit Guide Flagship & Stockists Our stores Discover our Collections accessories Staff Picks OTHER BRANDS Subscribe for stories, offers, and news.By signing up, you agree with our privacy policy.

name: Jillian Harris Design
aboutContent: JHD Mission Statement To be a daily escape and place where people can come to laugh, to learn and to be the best version of themselves while building an inspired and supported community that celebrates the art of creative living. We would like to respectfully acknowledge that we work on the traditional and unceded territory of the Okanagan syilx people. In whatever way we can, we are determined to use the platforms we have for good. That is why we are thrilled that this is the first year we are officially a benefit corporation and therefore are sharing our benefits report, here! (opens in a new tab) Our Vision To become a globally respected and loved lifestyle brand that prioritizes giving back and feel good practices while continuing to bring together all that life has to offer in a beautiful and creative way. Core Values Community Our mission is to not only be a daily escape where our community can come to laugh, learn and celebrate the art of creative living but to share businesses, brands, and products with our community that we stand behind and truly love. Team We are proud to be a certified Living Wage Employer and are committed to paying all employees a living wage for our region. Here at Jillian Harris Design Inc. and the Jillian Harris Family of Brands, we are determined to build and maintain an equitable and inclusive workforce for all team members. Social Impact We are passionate about reinvesting in our local communities and aligning with organizations that reflect our core values. Our focus is on uplifting and contributing to underrepresented and marginalized folx in addition to organizations that help provide access to basic needs and mental health initiatives. B Corp Certified At the heart of both of Jillian’s businesses has been a central why: to do good in our local and broader communities. After YEARS of hard work… both The Jilly Box and Jillian Harris Design Inc. are officially B Corp certified!! The B Corp Certification is a designation that a business is meeting high standards of verified performance, accountability, and transparency on factors from employee benefits and charitable giving to supply chain practices and input materials. More simply put, B Corp is “a business that is a force for good.” About Meet Jillian Jillian Harris is a mother, fiancé, storyteller, and quintessential busybee who pours her heart and soul into every endeavour. She is the Founder of Jillian Harris Design and The Jilly Academy, Co-Author of Fraiche Food Full Hearts and Co-Founder of The Jilly Box. Jillian is passionate about love, family, philanthropy, advocacy, fashion, food, decor and much more. Jillian’s signature style is both classic and feminine, and her eye for design and decor is enviable. As a former co-host of HGTV’s Love It Or List It Vancouver, she loves bringing her designs to life through fresh and inspiring refreshes to homes needing love. At the heart of everything she does is a desire to invest in her local and surrounding communities and inspire positive change. To learn more about Jillian & Team Jilly’s give-back initiatives, visit their Social Impact page. (opens in a new tab) As seen in: Style at Home W Network Cityline The Bachelor The Bachelorette HGTV The Today Show US Weekly Love It Or List it Vancouver Love It Or List It Too Jillian and Justin Show Extreme Makeover Home Edition Frequently Asked Questions How do I shop your home decor and your closet? You can visit my SHOP page or better yet, download the LiketoKnow.it app and follow me here so you can stay up to date with all of my favourite finds! Where are your eyeglasses from? I love my glasses and love accessorizing and changing up with look with different pairs! I get mine from clearly.ca (opens in a new tab). What steps have you and your team taken to be more diverse and inclusive? This is a great question and it’s something we’re working hard on! We’ve all taken time to learn and unlearn and while we are still striving to be and do better, we have implemented a few things recently, make sure to check them out here! How do you keep your sheets so white? Probably my most frequently asked question!! The answer is for the most part… we don’t! We have a two boxers named Nacho and Peaches (opens in a new tab), and while they are pretty ‘clean’ dogs and don’t shed, they definitely love to rub their dirty paws on my beautiful white bedding while running in and out of the house all day. We wash our sheets and duvet cover every week (with bleach!), and if you’re seeing crisp, smooth, and clean sheets on my Instagram feed there is a high likelihood I used a little app called FaceTune to get rid of those muddy paw prints 😉 What was your experience like on The Bachelor & The Bachelorette? AMAZING! I’m so thankful for that time in my life because it led me to SO many opportunities and helped shape me into who I am today. I’m so happy that things didn’t ‘work out’ for me in the love department because I met my amazing fiancé and father to my two kiddos, Justin! How can I get my photos to look so bright and airy like yours? With the touch of a button! LOL! We have developed a number of presets to fit a variety of different colour scenes, lighting situations, styles, and occasions. So, with the touch of a few buttons, you really can have photos that are bright and airy like mine! Check out the JH Preset collection, here (opens in a new tab)! Work With UsPartnerships + Collaborations HEY YOU! Is your brand the perfect fit for a partnership or collaboration? We’d love to chat! If you’re interested in working with us, make sure to send us a message below! Send Us a Message Contact Team Jilly Let Us Know About Your Inquiry All partnership and charitable requests must be submitted through the appropriate forms. Visit our Partnerships or Social Impact pages to find the appropriate form for your inquiry. Contact Team Jilly Send Us a Note We’d love to hear from you! Please fill out the form below or send a note directly to info@jillianharris.com.

name: Endy
aboutContent: Our StoryEvery Canadian Deserves A Better Night's Sleep.It Started With a Simple Belief:In 2015, we launched Canada’s first mattress-in-a-box—redefining comfort, quality, and convenience to make great sleep accessible to all. What began as a bold idea has grown into Canada’s leading online mattress brand, trusted by over a million sleepers from the Rocky Mountains to Rocky Harbour.At Endy, we don’t just help you fall asleep—we help you Rise to Shine.Every Endy mattress is proudly crafted in Canada using thoughtful and responsible manufacturing practices. From the first layer of foam to the final stitch, each mattress reflects the care, precision, and craftsmanship Canadians are known for.Made with CertiPUR-US® certified foam—free from harmful chemicals and emissions—our mattresses meet the highest standards of safety, durability, and comfort. It’s our way of ensuring you sleep soundly on a product that’s as responsibly made as it is comfortable, night after night.2015Endy is Founded in TorontoIn January, driven by a shared vision to help every Canadian sleep better, entrepreneurs Mike Gettis and Rajen Ruparell launched Endy, making high-quality sleep more accessible from coast to coast. Not long after, the very first Endy Mattress was delivered in March, marking the beginning of redefining and revolutionizing the way Canadians sleep.2016Benchmark for InnovationEndy was named one of Techweek’s Top 100 Innovators, an early sign that we weren’t just delivering better sleep, but challenging industry norms and setting a new standard for what Canadians could expect from their sleep.2017First Launch to First MillionMay marked our first product expansion with the launch of the Endy Pillow, designed to pair perfectly with our bestselling mattress. With the momentum continuing to build, November marked an extraordinary milestone: securing a $1 million investment on Dragon's Den, the show's biggest deal to date.2018Levelling UpIn September, Endy was named Canada’s fastest-growing retail startup and earned a spot on the Startup 50 list. Just a few months later, in December, we reached another major milestone by joining the Sleep Country Canada family in one of the country’s largest e-commerce acquisitions.2020Comfort for Frontline WorkersIn a year defined by uncertainty, we turned our focus to care. With our Healthcare Heroes Giving Campaign, Endy delivered new mattresses to frontline workers at more than 80 hospitals nationwide.2022Say Hello to HybridIn August, we introduced our second mattress, the Endy Hybrid, combining our signature Endy foam with durable pocket springs to deliver even more personalized support and comfort.2023From Online to In-StoreIn November, we opened our first retail store in the GTA, giving customers a chance to see, feel, and experience our products in person.2024Big WinsFrom our Adjustable Bed winning Product of the Year in February, to the launch of our most expansive product line, the Endy Bedroom Collection, in October, customers gained more ways than ever to build their dream sleep setup. We also opened stores in Halifax and Edmonton, and in November, we were named a Great Place to Work® for the sixth year in a row.2025A Year of Game-changersWe celebrated our first decade, partnered with iconic Canadian brand Tim Hortons for Roll Up To Win, and expanded our reach with the WNBA and Canadian star Aaliyah Edwards. It was a year that deepened our national roots and celebrated where we came from. As we grow, our promise stays the same: to help Canadians get a good night’s sleep—today, tomorrow, and all the years to come.We've Donated Over 24,000 Mattresses to Canadians in NeedAs a proudly Canadian company, we're here to make great sleep more accessible for everyone, from coast to coast.For over 10 years now, we've partnered with charities and non-profits nationwide to donate new and gently used mattresses to refugees, survivors of domestic violence, and newly housed youth. In 2025, we committed $25,000 in Endy products to Canadian Connections, a Toronto-based charity helping newcomers in need set up their first homes in Canada.Explore By Categorymattressesfurniturepillows

name: Douglas
aboutContent: Our Story Douglas: the Mattress Made for Canadians Canada First In 2009, we launched what would become Canada’s largest independent online mattress company. GoodMorning.com is a company of firsts: the first 100+ night trial; the first online luxury mattress brand in North America; the first to offer 100% free returns; and the first to offer zip-in adjustable firmness. We’ve seen many competitors come and go, most of them designing their products for the USA and treating Canada as an afterthought. With Douglas, we decided to put our focus on Canadian sleepers first and foremost. Douglas has been designed, crafted, and tested for Canadians from the beginning. Based in Western Canada, our co-founder, Sam Prochazka, spent many months combining the best high-performance foams and textiles from Canada’s top manufacturers, and the results are breathtaking: we have created one of Canada’s best sleep products for a simply unbeatable price. Andy (left) and Sam (right) Prochazka, co-founders of Douglas and GoodMorning.com. *Shipping fees may apply for some remote regions. name: Novosbed
aboutContent: FROM ONLY $999 + 120-NIGHT SLEEP TRIAL Cart - 0 1-844-456-4506 The NovosbedPremium, high-density memory foam mattress, 3 firmness options, washable cover. FoundationQuality woodframe mattress foundation made with North American pine. Frequently Asked Questions Guides Comparisons Contact About Us We live to design elegant solutions to hard problems and, by doing so, to improve people's lives in clear ways. Sam Prochazka Founder & CEO, GoodMorning.com A new idea. Buying a mattress had become one of the most confusing, time consuming, and frustrating experiences. Sam and his team spent more than a year designing a single high-end mattress, techniques to ship it efficiently, and invented the concept of a 120-night risk free trial. In 2009, he launched Novosbed to be the first totally risk-free mattress buying experience. Novosbed Today Today, Novosbed has grown from a single premium mattress brand into GoodMorning.com, an online collection of highly rated sleep products. We continue to deliver thousands of mattresses across North America each year. Our Toronto-based manufacturing partners help us produce and deliver mattresses to our Canadian customers while our US-based facilities allow us to serve our American clientele. Every day we work with dozens of engineering, manufacturing, and logistics partners across the continent to make buying, receiving, and owning a mattress easier than ever. But we don't stand still. At our core, we are designers and inventors who exist to find elegant solutions to hard problems. What is Novosbed? Great product, for less We don't cut corners to cut the price. We strive to provide a quality product at a lower price. Customer care We aim to deliver spectacular service to our customers from the moment they order and well beyond. Lower eco impact We strive to keep our mattresses out of landfills and we never use harmful materials or chemicals. Donating mattresses to those less fortunate. Before Novosbed, most companies sent returned mattresses to land-fills, or would re-sell them. We decided to think differently about returns. We built a national network of charitable organizations, moving companies, and logistics partners to make returns not only incredibly easy, but also to put returned products into the hands of less fortunate people. Since our founding in 2009, we have given thousands of mattresses to people who need them, diverting mountains of waste from landfill, and have watched our practice become the new standard in the industry. In the press. "... deliver[s] to your door in a snap... this is the future of mattresses." Listed: "13 Cheaper Alternatives To Life's Expensive Necessities" Profiled: "After frustrating mattress buying experience, twins launch own brand online" Profiled: "How online retailer Novosbed is giving the mattress industry a wake-up call" Listed: "Sleep Better Tonight - Everything You Need For Your Dream Bed" Better made mattresses. Better sleep. Shop our mattress
